original: rnam par rtog pa bdun gyis rnam par rtog ste /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa bdun gyis rnam par rtog ste /
translated: There are seven types of conceptualization:

original: de dag kyang gang zhe na /
analyzed: de dag kyang gang zhe na /
translated: What are they?

original: mtshan ma can dang / mtshan ma can ma yin pa dang / rang gi ngang gis 'jug pa dang / tshol ba pa dang / so sor rtog pa dang / nyon mongs pa can dang / nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i rnam par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: mtshan ma can dang / mtshan ma can ma yin pa dang / rang gi ngang gis 'jug pa dang / tshol ba pa dang / so sor rtog pa dang / nyon mongs pa can dang / nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i rnam par rtog pa'o //
translated: Conceptualization with signs, without signs, spontaneous, seeking, discerning, defiled, and undefiled.

original: rnam par rtog pa mtshan ma can gang zhe na /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa mtshan ma can gang zhe na /
translated: What is conceptualization with signs?

original: sngon nyams su myong ba'i don rnams la /
analyzed: sngon nyams su myong ba'i don rnams la /
translated: It is the conceptualization of objects that have been experienced in the past,

original: dbang bo yongs su smin cing tha snyad la mkhas pa'o //
analyzed: dbang bo yongs su smin cing tha snyad la mkhas pa'o //
translated: by one whose faculties are mature and who is skilled in conventional expressions.

original: mtshan ma can ma yin pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: mtshan ma can ma yin pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is conceptualization without signs?

original: sngon gyi rjes su 'brang bas ma 'ongs pa la rtog pa dang / gsar du tha snyad la mi mkhas pa'i rnam par rtog pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: sngon gyi rjes su 'brang bas ma 'ongs pa la rtog pa dang / gsar du tha snyad la mi mkhas pa'i rnam par rtog pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is the conceptualization of the future by one who is guided by the past, and the conceptualization of one who is not skilled in conventional expressions.

original: rang gi ngang gis 'jug pa gang zhe na /🔽yul nye bar gnas pa la /
analyzed: rang gi ngang gis 'jug pa gang zhe na / yul nye bar gnas pa la /
translated: What is spontaneous conceptualization?

original: rang gi ngang gis yul gyi stobs kho nas 'jug pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: rang gi ngang gis yul gyi stobs kho nas 'jug pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is the conceptualization that occurs spontaneously, by the mere presence of the object,🔽by one whose faculties are mature and who is skilled in conventional expressions.

original: tshol ba ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: tshol ba ba gang zhe na /
translated: What is the investigation?

original: chos rnams la yongs su tshol zhing spyod pa'i rnam par rtog pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: chos rnams la yongs su tshol zhing spyod pa'i rnam par rtog pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is the discursive thought which examines the teachings.

original: so sor rtog pa gang zhe na /🔽yongs su btsal zhing dpyad pa de rnam par gzhag pa la /
analyzed: so sor rtog pa gang zhe na / yongs su btsal zhing dpyad pa de rnam par gzhag pa la /
translated: What is the discernment?

original: so sor rtog pa'i rnam par rtog pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: so sor rtog pa'i rnam par rtog pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is the discursive thought which, having examined and investigated, establishes.

original: nyon mongs pa can gang zhe na /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can gang zhe na /
translated: What is the discursive thought of defilement?

original: 'das pa la blta ba dang ldan pa dang / ma 'ongs pa la mngon par dga' ba dang ldan pa dang / da ltar byung ba la lhag pa'i chags pa dang ldan pa dang / 'dod pa'i rtog pa dang / gnod sems kyi rtog pa dang /🔽rnam par 'tshe ba'i rtog pa gang yin pa 'am /
analyzed: 'das pa la blta ba dang ldan pa dang / ma 'ongs pa la mngon par dga' ba dang ldan pa dang / da ltar byung ba la lhag pa'i chags pa dang ldan pa dang / 'dod pa'i rtog pa dang / gnod sems kyi rtog pa dang / rnam par 'tshe ba'i rtog pa gang yin pa 'am /
translated: It is the discursive thought which is associated with the view of the past, with the delight in the future, with the attachment to the present, with the idea of desire, with the idea of malice,🔽with the idea of violence,

original: nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa gang yang rung ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i rnam par rtog pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa gang yang rung ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i rnam par rtog pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: or with any other defilement or minor defilement.

original: nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the discursive thought of non-defilement?

original: dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa gang yin pa dang / mngon par byung ba'i rnam par rtog pa dang / gnod sems med pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang / rnam par mi 'tshe ba'i rnam par rtog pa 'am /
analyzed: dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa gang yin pa dang / mngon par byung ba'i rnam par rtog pa dang / gnod sems med pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang / rnam par mi 'tshe ba'i rnam par rtog pa 'am /
translated: It is any wholesome or indeterminate thought, any thought of renunciation, any thought of non-hatred, any thought of non-violence,

original: yang dad pa la sogs pa dge ba'i chos gang @7a * //🔽yang rung ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang / spyod lam la 'byung ba dang / bzo'i gnas la 'byung ba 'am /
analyzed: yang dad pa la sogs pa dge ba'i chos gang @7a * // yang rung ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang / spyod lam la 'byung ba dang / bzo'i gnas la 'byung ba 'am /
translated: or any thought associated with any wholesome factor such as faith, etc.🔽It is any thought that occurs in the postures, any thought that occurs in the creative arts,

original: sprul pa sprul par byed pa'i rnam par rtog pa gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: sprul pa sprul par byed pa'i rnam par rtog pa gang yin pa ste /
translated: or any thought that creates magical creations.

original: 'di tsam gyis na dmigs pa la rnam par rtog par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di tsam gyis na dmigs pa la rnam par rtog par 'gyur ro //
translated: To this extent there is discursive thought about the objective support.

original: dmigs pa la ji ltar nye bar sems she na /
analyzed: dmigs pa la ji ltar nye bar sems she na /
translated: How does one pay attention to the objective support?

original: rigs pas bskyed pa dang / rigs pa ma yin pas bskyed pa dang / rigs pas bskyed pa yang ma yin rigs pa ma yin pas bskyed pa yang ma yin pas nye bar sems pa'o //
analyzed: rigs pas bskyed pa dang / rigs pa ma yin pas bskyed pa dang / rigs pas bskyed pa yang ma yin rigs pa ma yin pas bskyed pa yang ma yin pas nye bar sems pa'o //
translated: One pays attention to it as produced by reason, as produced by non-reason, and as produced by neither reason nor non-reason.

original: rigs pas bskyed pa ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: rigs pas bskyed pa ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: How is it generated by reasoning?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows:

original: phyin ci log rnam ba bzhi po mi rtag pa la rtag par phyin ci log pa dang / sdug bsngal ba la bde bar phyin ci log pa dang / mi gtsang ba la gtsang bar phyin ci log pa dang / bdag med pa la bdag tu phyin ci log pas med pa la sgro 'dogs par mi byed pa dang /
analyzed: phyin ci log rnam ba bzhi po mi rtag pa la rtag par phyin ci log pa dang / sdug bsngal ba la bde bar phyin ci log pa dang / mi gtsang ba la gtsang bar phyin ci log pa dang / bdag med pa la bdag tu phyin ci log pas med pa la sgro 'dogs par mi byed pa dang /
translated: One does not reify the non-existent through the four errors: the error of permanence towards the impermanent, the error of happiness towards suffering, the error of purity towards the impure, and the error of self towards the selfless.

original: yod pa yang dag pa la yang sbyin pa med do zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rnam pa'i log par lta bas skur pa 'debs par mi byed pa 'am /🔽chos gnas pa'i shes pas kyang /🔽dngos po yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rtogs pa dang yongs su shes pa 'am /
analyzed: yod pa yang dag pa la yang sbyin pa med do zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rnam pa'i log par lta bas skur pa 'debs par mi byed pa 'am / chos gnas pa'i shes pas kyang / dngos po yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rtogs pa dang yongs su shes pa 'am /
translated: Nor does one denigrate the existent, the real, with wrong views such as “there is no generosity” and so forth.🔽Or, through the knowledge of the abiding nature of phenomena,🔽one realizes and fully understands things as they are.

original: yang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ye shes shin tu rnam par dag pas chos rnams yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du mngon par rtogs pa ste /
analyzed: yang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ye shes shin tu rnam par dag pas chos rnams yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du mngon par rtogs pa ste /
translated: Or, through supramundane wisdom that is extremely pure, one realizes phenomena as they are.

original: de ltar rigs pas bskyed pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar rigs pas bskyed pa yin no //
translated: Thus, it is produced by reasoning.

original: de las bzlog pa ni /
analyzed: de las bzlog pa ni /
translated: The opposite of that is

original: rigs pa ma yin pas bskyed par blta bar bya'o //🔽rigs pas bskyed pa yang ma yin /
analyzed: rigs pa ma yin pas bskyed par blta bar bya'o // rigs pas bskyed pa yang ma yin /
translated: to be regarded as produced by non-reasoning.

original: rigs pa ma yin pas bskyed pa yang ma yin pa ji lta bu zhe na /🔽lung du ma bstan pa'i shes rab la brten nas /
analyzed: rigs pa ma yin pas bskyed pa yang ma yin pa ji lta bu zhe na / lung du ma bstan pa'i shes rab la brten nas /
translated: What is neither produced by reasoning nor produced by non-reasoning?

original: chos rnams la nye bar sems pa ste /
analyzed: chos rnams la nye bar sems pa ste /
translated: It is the investigation of dharmas based on indeterminate prajñā.

original: de ltar dmigs pa la nye bar sems so //
analyzed: de ltar dmigs pa la nye bar sems so //
translated: Thus, it is the investigation of the object.

original: ji ltar ra ro bar byed ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar ra ro bar byed ce na /
translated: How does one become intoxicated?

original: rang gzhan gyis lus nyam chung ba dang / chang 'thung ba la ma goms pa dang / chang ha cang rno ba 'thungs pa dang / tshod ma bzung bar 'thung bar byed do //
analyzed: rang gzhan gyis lus nyam chung ba dang / chang 'thung ba la ma goms pa dang / chang ha cang rno ba 'thungs pa dang / tshod ma bzung bar 'thung bar byed do //
translated: One becomes intoxicated by the weakness of one's own body, by not being accustomed to drinking alcohol, by drinking very strong alcohol, and by drinking to excess.

original: ji ltar smyo bar byed ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar smyo bar byed ce na /
translated: How does one become insane?

original: sngon gyi las kyis 'phangs pa dang / khams mi mnyam pa dang / skrag cing 'jigs pa dang / gnad du phog pa dang / 'byung pos brlams pas byed do //
analyzed: sngon gyi las kyis 'phangs pa dang / khams mi mnyam pa dang / skrag cing 'jigs pa dang / gnad du phog pa dang / 'byung pos brlams pas byed do //
translated: It is caused by past karma, by an imbalance of elements, by fear and terror, by a blow to the vital points, and by being possessed by spirits.

original: ji ltar gnyid log par byed ce na /🔽rang bzhin gyis lus nyam chung ba dang / ngal bas dub pa'i @7b nyes pa dang / kha zas drags pa dang / mun pa'i mtshan ma yid la byed pa dang / las thams cad btang ba dang / gnyid la goms pa dang / gzhan gyis byas pa 'di lta ste /
analyzed: ji ltar gnyid log par byed ce na / rang bzhin gyis lus nyam chung ba dang / ngal bas dub pa'i @7b nyes pa dang / kha zas drags pa dang / mun pa'i mtshan ma yid la byed pa dang / las thams cad btang ba dang / gnyid la goms pa dang / gzhan gyis byas pa 'di lta ste /
translated: How does one fall asleep?

original: lus mnye ba 'am /
analyzed: lus mnye ba 'am /
translated: One falls asleep through natural weakness of the body, through the fault of being tired and exhausted, through overeating, through attending to the signs of darkness, through abandoning all activity, through being accustomed to sleep, and through the action of others.🔽For example, one falls asleep through being massaged,

original: rig sngags sam /
analyzed: rig sngags sam /
translated: through spells,

original: sman nam mthus gnyid log par byas na gnyid log par byed do//
analyzed: sman nam mthus gnyid log par byas na gnyid log par byed do//
translated: through medicine, or through the power of another.

original: ji ltar sangs par byed ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar sangs par byed ce na /
translated: How does one wake up?

original: gnyid kyis brtas nas de'i kun nas dkris pa mi bzod pa dang / bya ba yod pa de la sems gtad nas /
analyzed: gnyid kyis brtas nas de'i kun nas dkris pa mi bzod pa dang / bya ba yod pa de la sems gtad nas /
translated: One wakes up through the force of sleep, through the inability to bear its fetters, through focusing the mind on what needs to be done,

original: nyal te log pa dang / gzhan gyis byas pa byed do //
analyzed: nyal te log pa dang / gzhan gyis byas pa byed do //
translated: through lying down and falling asleep, and through the action of others.

original: ji ltar brgyal bar byed ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar brgyal bar byed ce na /
translated: How does one faint?

original: rlung dang mkhris pas dkrugs pa dang / snad pa dang / drag tu zags pa 'di lta ste /🔽phyi sa mang du 'khrus pa 'am /
analyzed: rlung dang mkhris pas dkrugs pa dang / snad pa dang / drag tu zags pa 'di lta ste / phyi sa mang du 'khrus pa 'am /
translated: One faints through the disturbance of wind and bile, through injury, and through excessive loss of🔽feces,

original: khrag mang du zags pa 'am /
analyzed: khrag mang du zags pa 'am /
translated: blood,

original: mang du zags pa la drag tu brtsal bas byed do //
analyzed: mang du zags pa la drag tu brtsal bas byed do //
translated: One does so by strongly striving to stop the great loss of semen.

original: ji ltar brgyal ba las sangs par byed ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar brgyal ba las sangs par byed ce na /
translated: How does one cause one who has fainted to regain consciousness?

original: brgyal ba'i kun nas dkris pa de nyid dang bral bas byed do //
analyzed: brgyal ba'i kun nas dkris pa de nyid dang bral bas byed do //
translated: One does so by separating the person from the envelopment of fainting.

original: ji ltar lus dang ngag gi las 'jug par byed ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar lus dang ngag gi las 'jug par byed ce na /
translated: How does one cause the engagement of physical and verbal karma?

original: lus dang ngag gi las kyi gnas lta bu'i shes pa sngon du 'gro ba dang / de las 'dun pa skyo ba dang / de las 'bad pa rtsom pa dang / de las 'bad pa sngon du 'gro ba'i lus dang / ngag gi las dang mthun pa'i rlung 'byung bas byed do //
analyzed: lus dang ngag gi las kyi gnas lta bu'i shes pa sngon du 'gro ba dang / de las 'dun pa skyo ba dang / de las 'bad pa rtsom pa dang / de las 'bad pa sngon du 'gro ba'i lus dang / ngag gi las dang mthun pa'i rlung 'byung bas byed do //
translated: One does so by means of the knowledge that is the basis of physical and verbal karma, by the prior intention, by the desire to act, by the effort that is begun, by the effort that precedes the physical and verbal karma, and by the wind that is in accord with the physical and verbal karma.

original: ji ltar 'dod chags dang bral bar byed ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar 'dod chags dang bral bar byed ce na /
translated: How does one cause the separation from attachment?

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / mthun pa'i dbang po yongs su smin pa dang / gzhan las mthun pa'i gdams ngag thob pa dang / de'i bar du gcod pa rnam par spangs pa dang / yang dag par phyin ci ma log pa yid la byed pa sgom pas byed do //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / mthun pa'i dbang po yongs su smin pa dang / gzhan las mthun pa'i gdams ngag thob pa dang / de'i bar du gcod pa rnam par spangs pa dang / yang dag par phyin ci ma log pa yid la byed pa sgom pas byed do //
translated: One who is free from attachment, whose faculties are mature, who has received the proper instructions from another, who has abandoned the obstacles to that, and who cultivates the correct and unmistaken mental attention.

original: ji ltar 'dod chags dang bral ba las yongs su nyams par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar 'dod chags dang bral ba las yongs su nyams par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How does one fall away from freedom from attachment?

original: rang bzhin gyis dbang po rtul ba dang / dge ba'i phyogs la gsar du zhugs pa dang / de'i rnam pa dang / rtags dang mtshan ma yid la mi byed pa dang / yongs su nyams par 'gyur ba'i chos yang dag par blangs te 'dug pa dang /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis dbang po rtul ba dang / dge ba'i phyogs la gsar du zhugs pa dang / de'i rnam pa dang / rtags dang mtshan ma yid la mi byed pa dang / yongs su nyams par 'gyur ba'i chos yang dag par blangs te 'dug pa dang /
translated: One whose faculties are naturally dull, who is a beginner in the virtuous practices, who does not attend to the aspects, signs, and characteristics, who has taken up the practices that lead to regression,

original: nyon mongs pas bsgribs pa dang / sdig pa'i grogs pos yongs su zin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nyon mongs pas bsgribs pa dang / sdig pa'i grogs pos yongs su zin par 'gyur ro //
translated: who is obscured by afflictions, and who is controlled by bad friends.

original: ji ltar dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams rgyun 'chad par byed ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams rgyun 'chad par byed ce na /
translated: How does one cut off the wholesome roots?

original: dbang po rno la sdig pa'i bsam pa shas chen po la lhag par spyod pa'i chos dang ldan pa dang / de dang mthun pa'i grogs rnyed pa dang / log par lta @8a * //🔽ba'i kun nas dkris ba de lhun stug par byed pas /
analyzed: dbang po rno la sdig pa'i bsam pa shas chen po la lhag par spyod pa'i chos dang ldan pa dang / de dang mthun pa'i grogs rnyed pa dang / log par lta @8a * // ba'i kun nas dkris ba de lhun stug par byed pas /
translated: Those who have sharp faculties and who engage in the performance of great sins, those who find companions who are similar to themselves, and those who have a thick covering of the entanglements of wrong views.

original: mthar thug par 'gro ba dang / sdig pa thams cad la lhag par spyod pa dag la mi ldog cing 'gyod par mi byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mthar thug par 'gro ba dang / sdig pa thams cad la lhag par spyod pa dag la mi ldog cing 'gyod par mi byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: Those who do not turn away from and regret all their sins.

original: de la sa bon yang dge ba'i rtsa ba yin la /
analyzed: de la sa bon yang dge ba'i rtsa ba yin la /
translated: Here, the seed is the wholesome roots.

original: ma chags pa la sogs pa yang dge ba'i rtsa ba yin te /🔽dge ba'i rtsa ba kun tu spyod pa dang mi mthun pas rgyud gnas par byed cing /
analyzed: ma chags pa la sogs pa yang dge ba'i rtsa ba yin te / dge ba'i rtsa ba kun tu spyod pa dang mi mthun pas rgyud gnas par byed cing /
translated: Nonattachment and so on are the wholesome roots.🔽The wholesome roots are the cause of the continuity of the stream of consciousness.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba gcod pas sa bon 'byin par byed do //
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba gcod pas sa bon 'byin par byed do //
translated: The wholesome roots are the cause of the seed, because they are the cause of the cutting off of the wholesome roots.

original: ji ltar dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams mtshams sbyor bar byed ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams mtshams sbyor bar byed ce na /
translated: How do the wholesome roots link up?

original: rang bzhin gyis dbang po rno ba dang / mdza' bshes dang nye du dang / rten grogs rnams bsod nams bya ba la mngon par brtson pa mthong ba dang / skyes bu dam pa'i thad du song nas dam pa'i chos nyan pa dang / the tshom skye zhing nges par rtogs par byed do //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis dbang po rno ba dang / mdza' bshes dang nye du dang / rten grogs rnams bsod nams bya ba la mngon par brtson pa mthong ba dang / skyes bu dam pa'i thad du song nas dam pa'i chos nyan pa dang / the tshom skye zhing nges par rtogs par byed do //
translated: The bodhisattva who is born in the desire realm is naturally sharp-facultied, sees friends and relatives and companions who are engaged in meritorious actions, goes into the presence of holy beings and hears the holy Dharma, and has doubts and resolves them.

original: ji ltar 'chi 'pho bar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar 'chi 'pho bar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How does he die and pass away?

original: tshe'i tshad yod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tshe'i tshad yod par 'gyur ro //
translated: His life span is limited.

original: 'chi ba de yang dge ba'i sems dang ldan pa dang / mi dge ba'i sems dang ldan pa dang / lung du ma bstan pa'i sems dang ldan pa yang rung ste /
analyzed: 'chi ba de yang dge ba'i sems dang ldan pa dang / mi dge ba'i sems dang ldan pa dang / lung du ma bstan pa'i sems dang ldan pa yang rung ste /
translated: And that death is with a virtuous mind, with a nonvirtuous mind, or with an indeterminate mind.

original: tshe zad pa dang / bsod nams zad pa dang / yang nga ba ma spangs pas dus dang dus ma yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: tshe zad pa dang / bsod nams zad pa dang / yang nga ba ma spangs pas dus dang dus ma yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that death is timely or untimely due to the exhaustion of life, the exhaustion of merit, and the non-abandonment of what is appropriated.

original: tshe zad pa ji lta bu yin zhe na /
analyzed: tshe zad pa ji lta bu yin zhe na /
translated: What is the exhaustion of life?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is this:

original: 'di na kha cig ji ltar 'phangs pa'i tshe ril gyis zad par gyur nas /
analyzed: 'di na kha cig ji ltar 'phangs pa'i tshe ril gyis zad par gyur nas /
translated: Here someone, having completed the life span that was projected,

original: 'chi 'pho ba ste /
analyzed: 'chi 'pho ba ste /
translated: death,

original: de ni dus la bab na 'chi ba zhes bya'o //🔽bsod nams zad pa ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: de ni dus la bab na 'chi ba zhes bya'o // bsod nams zad pa ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: which is called death when the time has come.🔽What is death through the exhaustion of merit?🔽It is death🔽of those who die through the exhaustion of the effects of their actions.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: What is death through the exhaustion of life?🔽It is death

original: 'di na kha cig yo byad med pas 'chi 'pho ba lta bu yin no //
analyzed: 'di na kha cig yo byad med pas 'chi 'pho ba lta bu yin no //
translated: of those who die through the exhaustion of the effects of their actions.🔽What is death through the exhaustion of life?🔽It is death of those who die through the exhaustion of the effects of their actions.

original: yang nga ba ma spangs pa ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: yang nga ba ma spangs pa ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is death through the exhaustion of life?

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang 'di skad du tshe ma zad par 'chi ba'i dus byed pa ni rgyu dgu dang rkyen dgu yod do /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang 'di skad du tshe ma zad par 'chi ba'i dus byed pa ni rgyu dgu dang rkyen dgu yod do /
translated: It is death of those who die through the exhaustion of the effects of their actions.🔽What is death through the exhaustion of life?🔽It is death of those who die through the exhaustion of the effects of their actions.🔽What is death through the exhaustion of life?🔽It is death of those who die through the exhaustion of the effects of their actions.🔽What is death through the exhaustion of life?🔽It is death of those who die through the exhaustion of the effects of their actions.🔽What is death through the exhaustion of life?🔽It is death of those who die through the exhaustion of the effects of their actions.🔽What is death through the exhaustion of life?🔽It is death of those who die through the exhaustion of the effects of their actions.🔽What is death through the exhaustion of life?🔽It is death of those who die through the exhaustion of the effects of their actions.🔽What is death through the exhaustion of life?🔽It is death of those who die through the exhaustion of the effects of their actions.

original: dgu gang zhe na /
analyzed: dgu gang zhe na /
translated: What is death through the exhaustion of life?🔽It is death of those who die through the exhaustion of the effects of their actions.🔽What is death through the exhaustion of life?🔽It is death of those who die through the exhaustion of the effects of their actions.🔽What is death through the exhaustion of life?

original: kha zas tshod ma zin par za ba dang / mi 'phrod pa za ba dang / ma zhu bar za ba dang / ma zhu ba bsags pa 'byin par mi byed pa dang / smin pa dgag pa dang / sman so sor mi bsten pa dang /
analyzed: kha zas tshod ma zin par za ba dang / mi 'phrod pa za ba dang / ma zhu bar za ba dang / ma zhu ba bsags pa 'byin par mi byed pa dang / smin pa dgag pa dang / sman so sor mi bsten pa dang /
translated: It is death of those who die through the exhaustion of the effects of their actions.🔽What is death through the exhaustion of life?🔽It is death of those who die through the exhaustion of the effects of their actions.🔽What is death through the exhaustion of life?🔽It is death of those who die through the exhaustion of the effects of their actions.🔽What is death through the exhaustion of life?

original: goms pa dang / ma goms pa ma shes pa dang / dus ma yin par 'gro ba dang / mi tshangs par spyod pa'o zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: goms pa dang / ma goms pa ma shes pa dang / dus ma yin par 'gro ba dang / mi tshangs par spyod pa'o zhes gsungs te /
translated: It is death of those who die through the exhaustion of the effects of their actions.🔽What is death through the exhaustion of life?

original: de ni dus ma yin par 'chi ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ni dus ma yin par 'chi ba zhes bya'o //
translated: It is death of those who die through the exhaustion

original: dge ba'i sems dang ldan par 'chi 'pho ba ji lta bu yin zhe na /
analyzed: dge ba'i sems dang ldan par 'chi 'pho ba ji lta bu yin zhe na /
translated: What is it like to die with a virtuous mind?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this.

original: 'di na kha cig 'chi ba'i tshe /
analyzed: 'di na kha cig 'chi ba'i tshe /
translated: Here, when someone is dying,

original: dge ba'i chos sngon kun tu bsten pa @8b rnams dran nam /
analyzed: dge ba'i chos sngon kun tu bsten pa @8b rnams dran nam /
translated: he remembers virtuous qualities that he has previously cultivated,

original: gzhan gyis dran par byas kyang rung ste /
analyzed: gzhan gyis dran par byas kyang rung ste /
translated: or others cause him to remember them.

original: de'i tshe de la dad pa la sogs pa dge ba'i chos gang dag sems la kun tu spyod pa de dag ji srid du 'du shes rags pa 'byung ba'i bar du'o //
analyzed: de'i tshe de la dad pa la sogs pa dge ba'i chos gang dag sems la kun tu spyod pa de dag ji srid du 'du shes rags pa 'byung ba'i bar du'o //
translated: At that time, whatever virtuous qualities such as faith are present in his mind, they remain as long as his gross discernment remains.

original: 'du shes cha phra mo rgyu bar gyur pa'i tshe ni dge ba'i sems ldog cing /
analyzed: 'du shes cha phra mo rgyu bar gyur pa'i tshe ni dge ba'i sems ldog cing /
translated: When subtle discernment is active, the virtuous mind ceases

original: lung du ma bstan pa'i sems nyid du gnas te /
analyzed: lung du ma bstan pa'i sems nyid du gnas te /
translated: and only a neutral mind remains.

original: 'di ltar des ni de'i tshe sngon goms par byas pa'i dge ba la brtsal bar yang mi nus la gzhan dag gis kyang dran par byed mi nus so //
analyzed: 'di ltar des ni de'i tshe sngon goms par byas pa'i dge ba la brtsal bar yang mi nus la gzhan dag gis kyang dran par byed mi nus so //
translated: At that time, he is unable to cultivate the virtues that he has previously cultivated, and others are also unable to cause him to remember them.

original: mi dge ba'i sems dang ldan par 'chi 'pho ba ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: mi dge ba'i sems dang ldan par 'chi 'pho ba ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is it like to die with a nonvirtuous mind?🔽It is like this.

original: 'di ltar 'di na kha cig 'chi ba'i tshe /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'di na kha cig 'chi ba'i tshe /
translated: Here, when someone is dying,

original: mi dge ba'i chos sngon goms pa rnams dran nam /
analyzed: mi dge ba'i chos sngon goms pa rnams dran nam /
translated: Do you remember the unwholesome dharmas that you have previously cultivated?

original: gzhan dag gis dran par byas kyang rung ste /
analyzed: gzhan dag gis dran par byas kyang rung ste /
translated: Or, if others remind you,🔽then at that time, whatever unwholesome dharmas such as attachment are present in your mind, they are present for as long as gross discriminations are active.

original: de'i tshe de la chags pa la sogs pa mi dge ba'i chos gang dag sems la kun tu spyod pa de dag ji srid du 'du shes rags pa rgyu ba'i bar du'o zhes bya ba thams cad dge ba'i skabs snga ma dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: de'i tshe de la chags pa la sogs pa mi dge ba'i chos gang dag sems la kun tu spyod pa de dag ji srid du 'du shes rags pa rgyu ba'i bar du'o zhes bya ba thams cad dge ba'i skabs snga ma dang 'dra'o //
translated: All of this is the same as the previous section on wholesome states.

original: de la dge ba'i sems dang ldan par 'chi na ni /
analyzed: de la dge ba'i sems dang ldan par 'chi na ni /
translated: If you die with a wholesome mind,

original: bde bar 'chi bas 'chi bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: bde bar 'chi bas 'chi bar 'gyur te /
translated: you die happily.

original: 'chi kar de'i lus la sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba drag po 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'chi kar de'i lus la sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba drag po 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: At the time of death, strong feelings of pain do not arise in your body.

original: mi dge ba'i sems dang ldan par 'chi na ni /
analyzed: mi dge ba'i sems dang ldan par 'chi na ni /
translated: If you die with an unwholesome mind,

original: sdug bsngal ba'i 'ching bas 'chi bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: sdug bsngal ba'i 'ching bas 'chi bar 'gyur te /
translated: you die with suffering.

original: 'chi kar de'i lus la sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba drag po 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'chi kar de'i lus la sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba drag po 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: At the time of death, strong feelings of pain arise in your body.

original: dge ba'i sems dang ldan par 'chi ba la ni gzugs mthong ba 'khrul par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dge ba'i sems dang ldan par 'chi ba la ni gzugs mthong ba 'khrul par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: When dying with a wholesome mind, the vision of forms is not distorted.

original: mi dge ba'i sems dang ldan par 'chi ba ni gzugs mthong ba 'khrul bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mi dge ba'i sems dang ldan par 'chi ba ni gzugs mthong ba 'khrul bar 'gyur ro //
translated: When dying with an unwholesome mind, the vision of forms is distorted.

original: lung du ma bstan pa'i sems dang ldan par 'chi 'pho ba ji lta bu yin zhe na /
analyzed: lung du ma bstan pa'i sems dang ldan par 'chi 'pho ba ji lta bu yin zhe na /
translated: What is it like to die and transmigrate with a neutral mind?

original: dge ba dang mi dge ba byed byed pa yang rung /
analyzed: dge ba dang mi dge ba byed byed pa yang rung /
translated: It is when someone has done either wholesome or unwholesome actions,

original: de ma byas pa yang rung ste /
analyzed: de ma byas pa yang rung ste /
translated: whether or not they have done so,

original: bdag nyid kyis ma dran nam /
analyzed: bdag nyid kyis ma dran nam /
translated: and they do not remember it themselves,

original: gzhan dag gis dran par ma byas pa'o //🔽dge ba'i sems kyang ma yin la /
analyzed: gzhan dag gis dran par ma byas pa'o // dge ba'i sems kyang ma yin la /
translated: nor do others remind them.🔽When someone has neither a wholesome mind

original: nyon mongs pa can gyi sems kyang ma yin pa ni /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can gyi sems kyang ma yin pa ni /
translated: nor an afflicted mind,

original: 'chi ba'i tshe de bde ba'i 'chi bas kyang 'chi bar mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: 'chi ba'i tshe de bde ba'i 'chi bas kyang 'chi bar mi 'gyur la /
translated: at the time of death, they do not die with a happy mind,

original: sdug bsngal ba'i 'chi bas kyang 'chi bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sdug bsngal ba'i 'chi bas kyang 'chi bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: nor do they die with a suffering mind.

original: yang gal te gang zag dge ba dang mi dge ba byed byed pa 'chi ba ni sngon goms pa'i dge ba dang mi dge ba'i chos rnams bdag nyid kyis dran nam /
analyzed: yang gal te gang zag dge ba dang mi dge ba byed byed pa 'chi ba ni sngon goms pa'i dge ba dang mi dge ba'i chos rnams bdag nyid kyis dran nam /
translated: Moreover, when a person who has done virtuous and nonvirtuous actions dies, he or she may remember the virtuous and nonvirtuous dharmas that were previously cultivated.

original: gzhan dag gis dran par byas kyang rung ste /
analyzed: gzhan dag gis dran par byas kyang rung ste /
translated: Or, others may remind him or her.

original: de'i tshe des gang lan mang du goms par byas pa de @9a * //
analyzed: de'i tshe des gang lan mang du goms par byas pa de @9a * //
translated: At that time, the one who has cultivated the most will

original: ches stobs dang ldan par 'gyur te /
analyzed: ches stobs dang ldan par 'gyur te /
translated: become the strongest.

original: des sems de gzhol bar 'gyur la gzhan ni brjed par gyur to //
analyzed: des sems de gzhol bar 'gyur la gzhan ni brjed par gyur to //
translated: That will cause the mind to be drawn to it, and the other will be forgotten.

original: yang gal te gnyi ga la mtshungs par goms na ni de las gang dang gang thog ma kho nar dran nam /
analyzed: yang gal te gnyi ga la mtshungs par goms na ni de las gang dang gang thog ma kho nar dran nam /
translated: Moreover, if both are cultivated equally, then the one that is remembered first

original: dran par byed du bcug pa de las ldog par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: dran par byed du bcug pa de las ldog par mi 'gyur te /
translated: or that is made to be remembered will be the one that is not overcome.

original: gzhan du mi 'jug go //
analyzed: gzhan du mi 'jug go //
translated: It will not enter into the other.

original: de'i tshe des rgyu rnam pa gnyis la 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de'i tshe des rgyu rnam pa gnyis la 'di lta ste /
translated: At that time, the two causes are as follows:

original: spros pa la mngon par dga' ba'i rgyu dang / dge ba dang mi dge ba'i las kyi rgyu'i dbang du byas te /
analyzed: spros pa la mngon par dga' ba'i rgyu dang / dge ba dang mi dge ba'i las kyi rgyu'i dbang du byas te /
translated: the cause of delighting in proliferation and the cause of virtuous and nonvirtuous karma.

original: sngon gyi las kyis 'phangs pa'i 'bras bu de spyad nas 'chi ba'i dus byed pa de'i tshe mi dge ba'i las byed byed pa ni mi dge ba sngar byas pa'i mi sdug pa'i 'bras bu'i las kyi snga ltas rnams 'dir myong bar 'gyur te /🔽'di lta ste dper na rmi lam bzhin du gzugs mi sdug pa du ma de la snang bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: sngon gyi las kyis 'phangs pa'i 'bras bu de spyad nas 'chi ba'i dus byed pa de'i tshe mi dge ba'i las byed byed pa ni mi dge ba sngar byas pa'i mi sdug pa'i 'bras bu'i las kyi snga ltas rnams 'dir myong bar 'gyur te / 'di lta ste dper na rmi lam bzhin du gzugs mi sdug pa du ma de la snang bar 'gyur te /
translated: They experience the signs of the results of those actions, which are unpleasant.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis de las dgongs nas /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis de las dgongs nas /
translated: For example, the Blessed One said,

original: de sngon sdig pa mi dge ba'i las byas shing bsags par gyur pa gang yin pa de de'i tshe de la phyem red kyi dus kyi tshe ri rnams sam /
analyzed: de sngon sdig pa mi dge ba'i las byas shing bsags par gyur pa gang yin pa de de'i tshe de la phyem red kyi dus kyi tshe ri rnams sam /
translated: “At that time, the person who has previously done and accumulated nonvirtuous actions will, at the time of death, in the evening, see the signs of the results of those actions.

original: ri'i rtse mo rnams kyi grib ma bzhin du bab cing /
analyzed: ri'i rtse mo rnams kyi grib ma bzhin du bab cing /
translated: They will appear like mountains or mountain peaks,

original: lhag par 'bab la mngon du 'bab par 'gyur ro zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: lhag par 'bab la mngon du 'bab par 'gyur ro zhes gsungs te /
translated: falling down, falling down on top of them, and falling down in front of them.”

original: gang zag de ni snang ba nas mun khrod du 'gro ba lta bur rig par bya'o //
analyzed: gang zag de ni snang ba nas mun khrod du 'gro ba lta bur rig par bya'o //
translated: That person should be understood to be like someone who goes from light into darkness.

original: de las bzlog pa sngon gyi mi dge ba'i las kyi 'bras bu yin la /
analyzed: de las bzlog pa sngon gyi mi dge ba'i las kyi 'bras bu yin la /
translated: The opposite of that is the result of nonvirtuous karma from the past.

original: da ltar 'dir dge ba byed pa ni mun khrod nas snang bar 'gro ba lta bur rig par bya'o //
analyzed: da ltar 'dir dge ba byed pa ni mun khrod nas snang bar 'gro ba lta bur rig par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that the performance of virtue here in the present is like going from darkness into light.

original: de la bye brag ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de la bye brag ni 'di yin te /
translated: The difference is as follows.

original: 'chi ba'i dus na de la rmi lam lta bu'i gzugs mi sdug pa ma yin pa yid du 'ong ba rnam pa sna tshogs snang ba 'byung bar 'gyur ro //🔽de la mi dge ba chen po byed byed pa ni mtshan ma mi sdug pa de mthong bas rdul 'byung bar 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: 'chi ba'i dus na de la rmi lam lta bu'i gzugs mi sdug pa ma yin pa yid du 'ong ba rnam pa sna tshogs snang ba 'byung bar 'gyur ro // de la mi dge ba chen po byed byed pa ni mtshan ma mi sdug pa de mthong bas rdul 'byung bar 'gyur zhing /
translated: At the time of death, for one who has performed virtuous actions, various pleasant forms appear, as if in a dream.🔽For one who has performed great nonvirtuous actions, unpleasant signs appear.

original: spu'i khung bu dag na spu zing zhes byed par 'gyur /
analyzed: spu'i khung bu dag na spu zing zhes byed par 'gyur /
translated: Upon seeing those, tears flow and the pores of the body stand on end.

original: rkang lag g-yob pa la sogs pa ni 'byung bar 'gyur /
analyzed: rkang lag g-yob pa la sogs pa ni 'byung bar 'gyur /
translated: The hands and feet move about and so forth.

original: gcin dang phyi sa 'byung bar 'gyur /
analyzed: gcin dang phyi sa 'byung bar 'gyur /
translated: Urine and feces are released.🔽One runs into space, one does not return, foam comes from the mouth, and so forth.

original: nam mkha' la snyegs pa dang / mi ldog pa dang kha nas dbu ba 'byung ba dang / de lta bu dang mthun pa'i chos rnams 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nam mkha' la snyegs pa dang / mi ldog pa dang kha nas dbu ba 'byung ba dang / de lta bu dang mthun pa'i chos rnams 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Such phenomena occur.

original: gal te 'bring byed byed na ni /
analyzed: gal te 'bring byed byed na ni /
translated: If one is a medium,

original: de la kha cig ni 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la kha cig ni 'gyur ro //
translated: some of them will be,

original: kha cig ni mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: kha cig ni mi 'gyur te /
translated: but some will not be,

original: kun rdzogs par mi 'byung ngo //🔽de thams cad kyang 'chi ba'i tshe na @9b 'du shes mi gsal ba'i skabs su ma bab pa'i bar du yun ring po nas /
analyzed: kun rdzogs par mi 'byung ngo // de thams cad kyang 'chi ba'i tshe na @9b 'du shes mi gsal ba'i skabs su ma bab pa'i bar du yun ring po nas /
translated: because the complete set will not occur.

original: goms pa'i bdag la chags pa kun tu 'byung ngo //
analyzed: goms pa'i bdag la chags pa kun tu 'byung ngo //
translated: But when all of them are dying, the attachment to self that has been cultivated for a long time will occur until the moment when the consciousness becomes unclear.🔽After that, because of the power of that attachment, the thought will occur, “I will not exist.”

original: de'i 'og tu de'i dbang gi sa bdag ni med par 'gyur ro snyam nas lus la mngon par dga' bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu de'i dbang gi sa bdag ni med par 'gyur ro snyam nas lus la mngon par dga' bar 'gyur te /
translated: Then, because of that thought, there will be attachment to the body.

original: de ni de'i bar ma do'i srid pa mngon par 'grub pa'i rten yin no //
analyzed: de ni de'i bar ma do'i srid pa mngon par 'grub pa'i rten yin no //
translated: That is the basis for the establishment of the intermediate existence.

original: de la rgyun du zhugs pa dang / lan cig phyir 'ong ba la yang de'i tshe bdag la chags pa kun tu 'byung mod kyi /
analyzed: de la rgyun du zhugs pa dang / lan cig phyir 'ong ba la yang de'i tshe bdag la chags pa kun tu 'byung mod kyi /
translated: In the case of the stream-enterers and the once-returners, the attachment to self does occur at that time,

original: rgyun du zhugs pa 'am /
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa 'am /
translated: but because they have already seen the truth,

original: lan cig phyir 'ong ba des ni bdag la chags ba de shes rab kyi sa brtags shing brtags shing mngon par spong bar byed kyi dang du len par mi byed de /
analyzed: lan cig phyir 'ong ba des ni bdag la chags ba de shes rab kyi sa brtags shing brtags shing mngon par spong bar byed kyi dang du len par mi byed de /
translated: The once-returner, having examined and investigated the attachment to self with wisdom, abandons it and does not accept it.

original: dper na mi ches stobs dang ldan pa ni /
analyzed: dper na mi ches stobs dang ldan pa ni /
translated: For example, a very strong man

original: mi ches stobs chung ba dang / stobs 'gyed na stobs chung du rdung bar byed pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: mi ches stobs chung ba dang / stobs 'gyed na stobs chung du rdung bar byed pa de bzhin du /
translated: when he fights with a very weak man, beats the weak man.

original: 'di la yang tshul de dang 'dra bar blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'di la yang tshul de dang 'dra bar blta bar bya'o //
translated: In the same way, this should be seen in this case.

original: phyir mi 'ong ba rnams ni de'i tshe bdag la chags pa de kun tu 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phyir mi 'ong ba rnams ni de'i tshe bdag la chags pa de kun tu 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: The non-returners do not let the attachment to self arise at that time.

original: de la gnad 'chad pa ni /
analyzed: de la gnad 'chad pa ni /
translated: Here, the cutting of the vital parts

original: sems can dmyal ba'i 'gro ba dang / lha'i 'gro ba ma gtogs par de las gzhan pa'i skye ba'i gnas thams cad la yod do //
analyzed: sems can dmyal ba'i 'gro ba dang / lha'i 'gro ba ma gtogs par de las gzhan pa'i skye ba'i gnas thams cad la yod do //
translated: exists in all the other places of birth except for the destiny of hell beings and the destiny of gods.

original: de la yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de la yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: And there are two kinds:

original: shin tu tshabs che ba dang / shin tu tshabs chung ba ste /
analyzed: shin tu tshabs che ba dang / shin tu tshabs chung ba ste /
translated: very serious and very slight.

original: las nyes pa byed byed pa rnams kyi ni shin tu tshabs che ba yin no //
analyzed: las nyes pa byed byed pa rnams kyi ni shin tu tshabs che ba yin no //
translated: For those who have committed evil actions, the dissolution of the elements is very painful.

original: las legs pa byed byed pa rnams kyi ni shin tu tshabs chung ba yin no //
analyzed: las legs pa byed byed pa rnams kyi ni shin tu tshabs chung ba yin no //
translated: For those who have committed good actions, the dissolution of the elements is not painful.

original: byang gi sgra mi snyan gyi ni thams cad kyang tshabs chung ba yin no //
analyzed: byang gi sgra mi snyan gyi ni thams cad kyang tshabs chung ba yin no //
translated: For those who are born in Uttarakuru, the dissolution of the elements is not painful.

original: gzugs kyi khams nas 'chi 'pho ba rnams ni dbang po tshang bar 'chi ba'i dus byed do //
analyzed: gzugs kyi khams nas 'chi 'pho ba rnams ni dbang po tshang bar 'chi ba'i dus byed do //
translated: Those who die in the realm of form die with complete faculties.🔽Those who die in the realm of desire may die with complete faculties

original: 'dod pa'i khams nas 'chi 'pho ba rnams ni kha cig ni dbang po tshang bar 'chi 'pho bar 'gyur /🔽kha cig ni dbang po nyams te 'chi 'pho bar 'gyur ro //🔽dag cing grol ba rnams kyi 'chi ba ni dul ba'i 'chi 'pho ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams nas 'chi 'pho ba rnams ni kha cig ni dbang po tshang bar 'chi 'pho bar 'gyur / kha cig ni dbang po nyams te 'chi 'pho bar 'gyur ro // dag cing grol ba rnams kyi 'chi ba ni dul ba'i 'chi 'pho ba zhes bya'o //
translated: or with incomplete faculties.🔽The death of those who are pure and liberated is called “peaceful death.”

original: dag pa ma yin pa dang / grol ba ma yin pa rnams kyi 'chi ba ni dul ba ma yin pa'i 'chi 'pho ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dag pa ma yin pa dang / grol ba ma yin pa rnams kyi 'chi ba ni dul ba ma yin pa'i 'chi 'pho ba zhes bya'o //
translated: The death of those who are impure and not liberated is called “unpeaceful death.”

original: de bas na re zhig mi dge ba'i las byed byed pa rnams ni 'chi 'pho ba'i tshe rnam par shes pas ro stod nas lus 'dor bar byed de /
analyzed: de bas na re zhig mi dge ba'i las byed byed pa rnams ni 'chi 'pho ba'i tshe rnam par shes pas ro stod nas lus 'dor bar byed de /
translated: Therefore, when those who have engaged in nonvirtuous actions die and transmigrate, their consciousness leaves the body from the upper part.

original: de'i ro stod grang mor 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i ro stod grang mor 'gyur ro //
translated: The upper part of the body becomes cold.

original: de yang snying gar thug pa'i bar du 'dor bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de yang snying gar thug pa'i bar du 'dor bar 'gyur ro //
translated: It leaves the body until it reaches the heart.

original: legs pa byed byed pa rnams @10a * //🔽kyi rnam par shes pas ni /
analyzed: legs pa byed byed pa rnams @10a * // kyi rnam par shes pas ni /
translated: Those who have engaged in virtuous actions

original: ro smad nas lus 'dor par byed de /
analyzed: ro smad nas lus 'dor par byed de /
translated: leave the body from the lower part.

original: de'i ro smad grang mor 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i ro smad grang mor 'gyur ro //
translated: The lower part of the body becomes cold.

original: de yang snying gar thug pa'i bar du 'dor bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de yang snying gar thug pa'i bar du 'dor bar 'gyur te /
translated: It leaves the body until it reaches the heart.

original: snying gnas rnam par shes pa 'pho bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: snying gnas rnam par shes pa 'pho bar rig par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that consciousness departs from the heart.

original: de nas lus thams cad nas grang mor 'gyur te de lus la chags pa skyes pa dang / sngon spros pa la mngon par dga' ba'i rgyus yongs su bsgos pa dang dge ba dang mi dge ba'i las kyi rgyus yongs su bsgos pas /
analyzed: de nas lus thams cad nas grang mor 'gyur te de lus la chags pa skyes pa dang / sngon spros pa la mngon par dga' ba'i rgyus yongs su bsgos pa dang dge ba dang mi dge ba'i las kyi rgyus yongs su bsgos pas /
translated: Then the entire body becomes cold. When attachment to the body arises, due to the cause of previous delight in fragrances, and due to the cause of virtuous and nonvirtuous actions,

original: rgyu de gnyis kyi dbang du byas te /
analyzed: rgyu de gnyis kyi dbang du byas te /
translated: the body is pervaded by the two causes.

original: de ma thag tu rang gi sa bon las bar ma do'i srid pa /
analyzed: de ma thag tu rang gi sa bon las bar ma do'i srid pa /
translated: Immediately after that, the intermediate existence arises from its own seed.

original: phyogs de nas bar chad med par dus gcig tu 'gag pa dang / skye ba'i tshul gyis srang gi thor to mthon dman du 'gyur ba bzhin du 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phyogs de nas bar chad med par dus gcig tu 'gag pa dang / skye ba'i tshul gyis srang gi thor to mthon dman du 'gyur ba bzhin du 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: From that direction, the intermediate existence ceases without interruption and arises in the same instant, like the rising and falling of the two pans of a balance scale.

original: bar ma do'i srid pa de ni dbang po tshang ba yin no //
analyzed: bar ma do'i srid pa de ni dbang po tshang ba yin no //
translated: The intermediate existence is complete with all faculties.

original: nyes pa'i las byed byed pa rnams kyi bar ma do'i srid pa ni dper na /
analyzed: nyes pa'i las byed byed pa rnams kyi bar ma do'i srid pa ni dper na /
translated: The intermediate existence of those who have done evil deeds is like

original: phyar ba nag po 'am /
analyzed: phyar ba nag po 'am /
translated: a black blanket

original: mtshan mo'i mun pa mun nag tu snang ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: mtshan mo'i mun pa mun nag tu snang ba lta bu'o //
translated: or like the appearance of pitch darkness at night.

original: legs pa'i las byed byed pa rnams kyi ni dper na /
analyzed: legs pa'i las byed byed pa rnams kyi ni dper na /
translated: The intermediate existence of those who have done good deeds is like

original: snam bu dkar po'am /
analyzed: snam bu dkar po'am /
translated: a white blanket

original: zla ba'i 'od dang bcas pa'i mtshan mor snang ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: zla ba'i 'od dang bcas pa'i mtshan mor snang ba lta bu'o //
translated: or like the appearance of a night with moonlight.

original: de ni lha'i mig shin tu rnam par dag pa'i spyod yul yin no //
analyzed: de ni lha'i mig shin tu rnam par dag pa'i spyod yul yin no //
translated: This is the domain of the divine eye that is extremely pure.

original: rnam par shes pa mi gnas pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa mi gnas pa'i phyir /
translated: Because consciousness does not abide,

original: de'i tshe sngon gyi lus la 'dod pa de /
analyzed: de'i tshe sngon gyi lus la 'dod pa de /
translated: at that time the desire for the previous body🔽arises.

original: de la kun tu mi 'byung gi / yul gyi spros pa la 'dod pa ni kun tu 'byung ngo //🔽de ni gang du skye bar 'gyur ba de'i sha tshugs lta bur bar ma do'i srid pa skye ste /🔽skye ba ni gnas ma blangs kyi bar du de'i mig lha'i mig lta bur thogs pa med do //
analyzed: de la kun tu mi 'byung gi / yul gyi spros pa la 'dod pa ni kun tu 'byung ngo // de ni gang du skye bar 'gyur ba de'i sha tshugs lta bur bar ma do'i srid pa skye ste / skye ba ni gnas ma blangs kyi bar du de'i mig lha'i mig lta bur thogs pa med do //
translated: But the intermediate beings do not arise everywhere, for they arise in the place where they will be reborn.🔽The intermediate beings have the form of the place where they will be reborn.🔽As long as they have not attained the place of their rebirth, their divine eye is unobstructed.

original: 'gro ba yang skye ba'i gnas ma blangs kyi bar du rdzu 'phrul dang ldan pa bzhin du thogs pa med do //🔽de'i mig de'i bar ma do'i srid pa pa'i sems can bdag dang skal ba mnyam pa rnams dang / de dag gi skye ba'i gnas dang / bdag gi skye ba'i gnas kyang mthong ngo //🔽nyes pa'i las byed byed pa rnams kyi mig ni thur du gsal te /🔽spyi'u tshugs su 'gro'o //🔽lhar skye ba rnams ni gyen du'o //
analyzed: 'gro ba yang skye ba'i gnas ma blangs kyi bar du rdzu 'phrul dang ldan pa bzhin du thogs pa med do // de'i mig de'i bar ma do'i srid pa pa'i sems can bdag dang skal ba mnyam pa rnams dang / de dag gi skye ba'i gnas dang / bdag gi skye ba'i gnas kyang mthong ngo // nyes pa'i las byed byed pa rnams kyi mig ni thur du gsal te / spyi'u tshugs su 'gro'o // lhar skye ba rnams ni gyen du'o //
translated: But the intermediate beings who are to be reborn in the realm of fine-materiality do not go to the place of their plane of existence by leaping over the earth; they go straight up like one rising out of meditation.

original: mir skye ba rnams ni thad kar ro //
analyzed: mir skye ba rnams ni thad kar ro //

analyzed: dper na 'o ma bskol ba grangs pa'i sbris ma bzhin du spris ma lta bur chags nas 'dus shing 'dug par 'gyur te /

original: des sa bon thams cad pa rnam par smin pa bsdus pa /
analyzed: des sa bon thams cad pa rnam par smin pa bsdus pa /

analyzed: lus len par byed pa kun gzhi rnam par shes pa 'jug par 'gyur ro //

original: ji ltar 'jug par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar 'jug par 'gyur zhe na /

analyzed: phyin ci log tu dmigs pa bar ma do'i srid pa de 'gag par 'gyur la /

original: de 'gag pa dang dus gcig tu rnam par shes pa sa bon thams cad pa de'i mthus de las gzhan pa dbang po'i 'byung ba chen po 'byung ba chen po cha phra ba dang 'dres pa /
analyzed: de 'gag pa dang dus gcig tu rnam par shes pa sa bon thams cad pa de'i mthus de las gzhan pa dbang po'i 'byung ba chen po 'byung ba chen po cha phra ba dang 'dres pa /

original: de dang mthun pa'i khu ba dang / khrag 'dus pa dbang po dang bcas pa gzhan 'byung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de dang mthun pa'i khu ba dang / khrag 'dus pa dbang po dang bcas pa gzhan 'byung bar 'gyur te /

original: de'i dus skabs su rnam par shes pa gnas par gyur pa ni nying mtshams sbyor ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de'i dus skabs su rnam par shes pa gnas par gyur pa ni nying mtshams sbyor ba zhes bya ste /

original: dbang po'i rten gyi 'byung ba chen po rnams dang / dbang po'i 'byung ba chen po de dag nyid dang / lus kyi dbang po yang lhan cig tu 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dbang po'i rten gyi 'byung ba chen po rnams dang / dbang po'i 'byung ba chen po de dag nyid dang / lus kyi dbang po yang lhan cig tu 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The great elements that are the basis of the faculties, those great elements of the faculties, and the body faculty arise together.

original: de nas dbang po'i 'byung ba chen po de dag rgyur byas nas /
analyzed: de nas dbang po'i 'byung ba chen po de dag rgyur byas nas /
translated: Then, taking as its cause the great elements of the sense faculties,

original: mig gi dbang po la sogs pa rim gyis 'grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mig gi dbang po la sogs pa rim gyis 'grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: the eye sense faculty, etc. are gradually formed.

original: dbang po'i rten gyi 'byung ba chen po de dag kyang rgyur byas nas rim gyis dbang po'i rten rnams kyang 'grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dbang po'i rten gyi 'byung ba chen po de dag kyang rgyur byas nas rim gyis dbang po'i rten rnams kyang 'grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: And, taking as their cause the great elements which are the basis of the sense faculties, the supports of the sense faculties are gradually formed.

original: dbang po rnams dang / de dag gi rten rnams byung ba las lus thams cad 'grub cing 'thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dbang po rnams dang / de dag gi rten rnams byung ba las lus thams cad 'grub cing 'thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: When the sense faculties and their supports have appeared, the whole body is formed and obtained.

original: mer mer po'i gzugs de yang sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos de dag dang / gcig la gcig grub pa dang bde bas zhugs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mer mer po'i gzugs de yang sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos de dag dang / gcig la gcig grub pa dang bde bas zhugs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This embryonic body, the kalala, is said to be “nourished by the mind and mental factors, by their mutual support and by their mutual well-being.

original: sems can gyi dbang gis kyang de rul bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sems can gyi dbang gis kyang de rul bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: ” It does not decay by reason of the sentient being.

original: de'i phan pa dang gnod pa las kyang /
analyzed: de'i phan pa dang gnod pa las kyang /
translated: And, by reason of its well-being or harm,

original: sems dang sems las byung ba rnams la phan pa dang / gnod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sems dang sems las byung ba rnams la phan pa dang / gnod par 'gyur ro //
translated: the mind and mental factors are benefited or harmed.

original: de bsan gcig la gcig grub pa dang bde ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de bsan gcig la gcig grub pa dang bde ba zhes bya'o //
translated: That is why it is said that they are mutually supportive and well-being.

original: mer mer po'i phyogs gang du rnam par shes pa zhugs par gyur pa de ni de'i tshe de'i snying gi phyogs yin no //
analyzed: mer mer po'i phyogs gang du rnam par shes pa zhugs par gyur pa de ni de'i tshe de'i snying gi phyogs yin no //
translated: The part of the heart where the consciousness enters when it is in the kalala stage is the heart.

original: de ltar na rnam par shes pa de ni phyogs gang nas 'chi 'pho ba'i phyogs de nyid du thog ma kho nar 'jug go //
analyzed: de ltar na rnam par shes pa de ni phyogs gang nas 'chi 'pho ba'i phyogs de nyid du thog ma kho nar 'jug go //
translated: Thus, the consciousness first enters the part of the body where it will depart.

original: rnam par shes pa sa bon thams cad pa de yang yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'i chos can dag gi ni sa bon yongs su tshang ba yin no //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa sa bon thams cad pa de yang yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'i chos can dag gi ni sa bon yongs su tshang ba yin no //
translated: The consciousness, which contains all the seeds, is complete in those who are destined for nirvana.

original: yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'i chos can ma yin pa dag gi ni /🔽byang chub rnam pa gsum gyi sa bon med pa yin no /
analyzed: yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'i chos can ma yin pa dag gi ni / byang chub rnam pa gsum gyi sa bon med pa yin no /
translated: In those who are not destined for nirvana,

original: // / bam po gnyis pa /
analyzed: // / bam po gnyis pa /
translated: it is incomplete, lacking the seeds of the three enlightenments.

original: lus mngon par 'grub pa gang ci yang rung ste /
analyzed: lus mngon par 'grub pa gang ci yang rung ste /
translated: Any body whatsoever is produced

original: de thams cad ni sa bon thams cad dang ldan pa yin par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de thams cad ni sa bon thams cad dang ldan pa yin par rig par bya ste /
translated: by the consciousness containing all the seeds.

original: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i lus la yang gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i sa bon yod do //
analyzed: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i lus la yang gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i sa bon yod do //
translated: The body of the realm of desire contains the seeds of the realms of desire, form, and formlessness.

original: de bzhin du gzugs na spyod pa la yang 'dod pa na spyod pa dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i sa bon yod do //
analyzed: de bzhin du gzugs na spyod pa la yang 'dod pa na spyod pa dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i sa bon yod do //
translated: In the same way, the seeds of the realm of desire and the formless realm are present in the realm of form.

original: gzugs med pa na spyod pa la yang /
analyzed: gzugs med pa na spyod pa la yang /
translated: And in the formless realm,

analyzed: 'dod pa na spyod pa dang gzugs na spyod pa'i sa bon yod do // mer mer po de yang skye ba'i tshe ni ming dang gzugs gnyis kyang /
translated: the seeds of the realm of desire and the realm of form are present.🔽And when the embryo is in the kalala stage, the two, name-and-form and the six sense bases,

analyzed: de gnyi ga ches rgya che bar 'gyur bas @13a * //

analyzed: mtshungs mnyam du skye bar 'gyur te /

analyzed: skye ba de yang lus yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur gyi bar du skye bar blta bar bya'o //

analyzed: de la sa'i khams rgyur byas nas lus kyi rgyur byas pa'i gzugs skye zhing ches rgya cher 'gyur ro //
translated: The form derived from the fundamental material elements, which is the cause of the body, is produced from the earth element as the cause.

original: chu'i khams ni de nyid sdud par byed do//
analyzed: chu'i khams ni de nyid sdud par byed do//
translated: The water element causes it to grow.

original: me'i khams ni de nyid smin par byed do //🔽'dzag par mi 'gyur ba'i tshul gyis brtan par byed do //
analyzed: me'i khams ni de nyid smin par byed do //🔽'dzag par mi 'gyur ba'i tshul gyis brtan par byed do //
translated: The fire element ripens it.🔽The wind element expands it.🔽The space element is its room.

original: rlung gi khams ni yan lag rnam par 'byed cing gnas par byed do //
analyzed: rlung gi khams ni yan lag rnam par 'byed cing gnas par byed do //
translated: The wind element is the support of the body and the separation of its members.

original: sa bon thams cad la lus mngon par 'grub pa de dge ba dang mi dge ba'i las kyi rgyu las byung ba yin yang spros pa la mngon par dga' ba nyid gtso bo'i rgyu yin par blta bar bya'o //

analyzed: rigs dang stobs dang gzugs dang tshe dang / longs spyod la sogs pa 'bras bu'i rgyu'i gtso bo ni dge ba dang / mi dge ba'i las yin no //

analyzed: lus de la yang byis pa rnams ni bdag go snyam pa dang / nga'i 'o snyam pa dang / nga'o snyam du 'dzin to //

original: 'phags pa rnams ni sdug bsngal nyid du 'dzin to //🔽mngal du gnas pa la ni rang bzhin gyis sdug bsngal yang ma yin /
analyzed: 'phags pa rnams ni sdug bsngal nyid du 'dzin to // mngal du gnas pa la ni rang bzhin gyis sdug bsngal yang ma yin /

analyzed: bde ba yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba la gnas pa'i rnam par shes pa skye bar 'gyur te /

original: de'i tshor ba de ni rnam par smin pas bsdus pa yin no //🔽de las gzhan pa'i tshor ba thams cad ni rnam par smin pa las byung ba 'am /
analyzed: de'i tshor ba de ni rnam par smin pas bsdus pa yin no // de las gzhan pa'i tshor ba thams cad ni rnam par smin pa las byung ba 'am /

original: yul gyi rkyen las gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: yul gyi rkyen las gyur ba yin no //
translated: All other feelings are born from the retribution or from the conditions of the object.

original: de la bde ba dang / sdug bsngal ba ni ched 'ga' rkyen mngon du gyur na ni 'byung la /
analyzed: de la bde ba dang / sdug bsngal ba ni ched 'ga' rkyen mngon du gyur na ni 'byung la /
translated: The pleasant and the unpleasant are sometimes produced by the presence of the conditions.

original: ched 'ga' ni mi 'byung ngo //
analyzed: ched 'ga' ni mi 'byung ngo //
translated: Sometimes they are not produced.

original: sa bon gyi rgyud kyi rgyun de yang thog ma med pa'i dus nas yod la /
analyzed: sa bon gyi rgyud kyi rgyun de yang thog ma med pa'i dus nas yod la /
translated: The stream of the seed-series has existed from beginningless time.

original: thog ma med pa'i dus nas yod pa nyid yin du zin yang /
analyzed: thog ma med pa'i dus nas yod pa nyid yin du zin yang /
translated: Even though it has existed from beginningless time,

original: dge ba dang mi dge ba'i las kyi bye brag gis yongs su bsgos pas /
analyzed: dge ba dang mi dge ba'i las kyi bye brag gis yongs su bsgos pas /

original: yang dang yang rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu yongs su 'dzin pa'i phyir sar par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yang dang yang rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu yongs su 'dzin pa'i phyir sar par 'gyur ro //
translated: It again and again holds the retribution-result.

original: 'bras bu byung nas ni sa bon de 'bras bu spyad zin pa yin te /
analyzed: 'bras bu byung nas ni sa bon de 'bras bu spyad zin pa yin te /
translated: When the result has arisen, the seed has already produced the result.

original: de ltar yongs su mya ngan las ma 'das kyi bar du 'khor ba'i rgyun 'jug go //
analyzed: de ltar yongs su mya ngan las ma 'das kyi bar du 'khor ba'i rgyun 'jug go //
translated: In this way, the stream of saṃsāra continues until the attainment of nirvāṇa.

original: de la sa bon gang dag 'bras bu ma byung ba de dag kyang /
analyzed: de la sa bon gang dag 'bras bu ma byung ba de dag kyang /
translated: The seeds that have not yet produced their fruit

original: kha cig ni skyes nas myong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: kha cig ni skyes nas myong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: some will be experienced after being reborn.

original: kha cig ni lan grangs gzhan la myong bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: kha cig ni lan grangs gzhan la myong bar 'gyur te /
