original: bskal ba 'bum @13b gyis kyang rang gi sa bon las yang lus de dag yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bskal ba 'bum @13b gyis kyang rang gi sa bon las yang lus de dag yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: Even after a hundred thousand eons, the seeds will produce their own fruit.

original: 'bras bu gzhan skye ba gang yin ba de yang rang gi sa bon nyid las byung ngo //
analyzed: 'bras bu gzhan skye ba gang yin ba de yang rang gi sa bon nyid las byung ngo //
translated: The fruit that arises from another seed also arises from its own seed.

original: tshe zad pa ni 'dir sa bon de 'bras bu yongs su spyad zin pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: tshe zad pa ni 'dir sa bon de 'bras bu yongs su spyad zin pa ni ma yin no //
translated: The exhaustion of life does not mean that the seed has already produced its fruit.

original: lus lhag ma rnams kyi sa bon dag ni 'bras bu ma byin pas na /
analyzed: lus lhag ma rnams kyi sa bon dag ni 'bras bu ma byin pas na /
translated: The seeds of the remaining bodies have not yet produced their fruit.

original: 'bras bu rnams ma spyad pa yin no //
analyzed: 'bras bu rnams ma spyad pa yin no //
translated: The fruit has not yet been experienced.

original: myong bar 'gyur bar ma nges pa'i sa bon gang yin pa de ni lus de nyid la 'bras bu myong bar 'gyur ba'i rigs pa las rkyen dang ma ldan nas myong bar ma gyur te /
analyzed: myong bar 'gyur bar ma nges pa'i sa bon gang yin pa de ni lus de nyid la 'bras bu myong bar 'gyur ba'i rigs pa las rkyen dang ma ldan nas myong bar ma gyur te /
translated: The seeds that are not certain to be experienced are not experienced in that very body because the conditions are not complete.

original: sa bon de yang de nyid kyi so na 'dug pa yin no //
analyzed: sa bon de yang de nyid kyi so na 'dug pa yin no //
translated: And the seed of that body is present in that very [mind].

original: de'i phyir lus thams cad kyi sa bon yin pas /
analyzed: de'i phyir lus thams cad kyi sa bon yin pas /
translated: Therefore, since it is the seed of all bodies,

original: lus thams cad re re nas gcig la chags na yang thams cad la chags par brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: lus thams cad re re nas gcig la chags na yang thams cad la chags par brjod par bya'o //
translated: when one is attached to any one of all bodies, it should be said that one is attached to all.

original: gcig la 'dod chags pa dang bral na yang thams cad la 'dod chags dang bral bar brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: gcig la 'dod chags pa dang bral na yang thams cad la 'dod chags dang bral bar brjod par bya'o //
translated: And when one is free from attachment to any one, it should be said that one is free from attachment to all.

original: lus de dag gi sa bon nyon mongs pa'i phyogs gang yin pa de dag ni /
analyzed: lus de dag gi sa bon nyon mongs pa'i phyogs gang yin pa de dag ni /
translated: Those afflictions that are the seeds of those bodies

original: gnas ngan len zhes bya ba dang / bag la nyal zhes bya bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gnas ngan len zhes bya ba dang / bag la nyal zhes bya bar 'gyur ro //
translated: are called negative tendencies and latent tendencies.

original: rnam par smin pa'i phyogs gang yin pa rnams dang / de las gzhan pa lung du ma bstan pa'i phyogs de dag ni /
analyzed: rnam par smin pa'i phyogs gang yin pa rnams dang / de las gzhan pa lung du ma bstan pa'i phyogs de dag ni /
translated: Those that are on the side of karmic ripening and those that are on the side of other neutral states

original: gnas ngan len zhes bya ba nyid de /
analyzed: gnas ngan len zhes bya ba nyid de /
translated: are called negative tendencies

original: bag la nyal zhes ni mi bya'o //
analyzed: bag la nyal zhes ni mi bya'o //
translated: but not latent tendencies.

original: dad pa la sogs pa dge ba'i chos kyi phyogs kyi sa bon gang yin pa de dag la ni bag la nyal zhes bya ba yang med la /
analyzed: dad pa la sogs pa dge ba'i chos kyi phyogs kyi sa bon gang yin pa de dag la ni bag la nyal zhes bya ba yang med la /
translated: Those seeds of virtuous factors such as faith are not called latent afflictive tendencies.

original: gnas ngan len zhes bya ba med do //
analyzed: gnas ngan len zhes bya ba med do //
translated: They are not called negative tendencies.

original: 'di ltar de dag skyes nas lus las su rung ba kho nar 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: 'di ltar de dag skyes nas lus las su rung ba kho nar 'gyur gyi /
translated: Because, when they arise, the body becomes fit,

original: las su mi rung bar mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: las su mi rung bar mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: not unfit.

original: de bas na gnas ngan len dang ldan pa'i phyir dang / gnas ngan len gyi rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de bas na gnas ngan len dang ldan pa'i phyir dang / gnas ngan len gyi rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, because they possess negative tendencies and because they are the nature of negative tendencies,🔽the Tathāgatas

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams ni /🔽'di lta ste /🔽'du byed kyi sdug bsngal nyid kyis /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams ni / 'di lta ste / 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal nyid kyis /
translated: have declared

original: lus mtha' dag sdug bsngal du 'dogs par mdzad do //
analyzed: lus mtha' dag sdug bsngal du 'dogs par mdzad do //
translated: that the entire body is painful due to the suffering of conditioned states.

original: sa bon gyi rnam grangs ni /
analyzed: sa bon gyi rnam grangs ni /
translated: The synonyms for seeds are:

original: khams dang / rigs dang / rang bzhin dang / rgyu dang / 'jig tshogs dang / spros pa dang / kun gzhi dang / len pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i gnas dang / nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal gyi gnas dang /
analyzed: khams dang / rigs dang / rang bzhin dang / rgyu dang / 'jig tshogs dang / spros pa dang / kun gzhi dang / len pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i gnas dang / nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal gyi gnas dang /
translated: The synonyms of the alaya are: the elements, the lineages, the nature, the cause, the perishable collection, conceptual elaboration, the foundation consciousness, appropriation, suffering, the basis of the view of the perishable collection, the basis of the pride of “I am,”

original: de lta bu dang mthun pa rnams ni rnam grangs su gtogs par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bu dang mthun pa rnams ni rnam grangs su gtogs par rig par bya'o //
translated: and so on.

original: yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'i @14a * //
analyzed: yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'i @14a * //
translated: At the time of complete nirvana,

original: dus na ni rnam par dag pa'i rnal 'byor pa /
analyzed: dus na ni rnam par dag pa'i rnal 'byor pa /
translated: the alaya of those who are pure yogis

original: gnas gyur pa rnams kyi nyon mongs pa can gyi chos thams cad kyi sa bon gyi gnas 'gyur te /
analyzed: gnas gyur pa rnams kyi nyon mongs pa can gyi chos thams cad kyi sa bon gyi gnas 'gyur te /
translated: who have transformed their bases has transformed from the basis of the seeds of all afflicted phenomena

original: dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa'i chos thams cad kyi sa bon rnams kyang rkyen rnams dang mi ldan par byed cing /
analyzed: dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa'i chos thams cad kyi sa bon rnams kyang rkyen rnams dang mi ldan par byed cing /
translated: into the basis of the seeds of all virtuous and neutral phenomena.

original: nang gi rkyen la dbang ba yang 'thob bo //
analyzed: nang gi rkyen la dbang ba yang 'thob bo //
translated: They also possess the conditions and obtain mastery over internal conditions.

original: mngal na gnas pa de yang zhag bdun phrag sum cu rtsa brgyad kyis mngal du yan lag dang nying lag thams cad dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mngal na gnas pa de yang zhag bdun phrag sum cu rtsa brgyad kyis mngal du yan lag dang nying lag thams cad dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
translated: And that being in the womb will be fully endowed with all the major and minor body parts after thirty-eight weeks.

original: de nas zhag bzhi lon na btsa' bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de nas zhag bzhi lon na btsa' bar 'gyur te /
translated: Then, after four weeks, it is born.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis mngal du 'jug pa'i mdo las /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis mngal du 'jug pa'i mdo las /
translated: The Bhagavān said in the Descent into the Womb Sūtra:

original: de ni zla ba dgu 'am de las 'das na shin tu rdzogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ni zla ba dgu 'am de las 'das na shin tu rdzogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: After nine months or more, it is fully developed.

original: zla ba brgyad kyis ni rdzogs pa yin mod kyi shin tu rdzogs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: zla ba brgyad kyis ni rdzogs pa yin mod kyi shin tu rdzogs pa ma yin no //
translated: Even if it is eight months, it is complete but not fully developed.

original: zla ba drug gam bdun gyis rdzogs par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: zla ba drug gam bdun gyis rdzogs par mi 'gyur te /
translated: If it is six or seven months, it is not complete.

original: yan lag ma tshang bar yang 'gyur ro zhes ji skad gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: yan lag ma tshang bar yang 'gyur ro zhes ji skad gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: And it will have incomplete limbs.

original: skye mched drug 'dod pa'i gnas skabs de ni mas kha zas zos pa las 'byung ba'i dangs ma ska ba des de brtas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: skye mched drug 'dod pa'i gnas skabs de ni mas kha zas zos pa las 'byung ba'i dangs ma ska ba des de brtas par 'gyur ro //
translated: The six sense bases in the desire realm are nourished by the refined essence of the mother’s food.

original: mer mer po la sogs pa shin tu sla ba'i dus na ni /
analyzed: mer mer po la sogs pa shin tu sla ba'i dus na ni /
translated: In the very soft stage of kalala and so on,

original: dangs ma shin tu sla bas brtas par 'gyur bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: dangs ma shin tu sla bas brtas par 'gyur bar rig par bya'o //
translated: One should know that the fetus is nourished by the very subtle nutritive essence.

original: mngal na gnas pa de la yang dus rnam pa brgyad yod de /
analyzed: mngal na gnas pa de la yang dus rnam pa brgyad yod de /
translated: There are eight periods in the development of the fetus.

original: dus rnam pa brgyad po gang zhe na /🔽mer mer po'i dus dang / nur nur po'i dus dang / ltar ltar po'i dus dang / mkhrang 'gyur gyi dus dang / rkang lag 'gyus pa'i dus dang / skra dang ba spu dang sen mo 'byung ba'i dus dang / dbang po dod pa'i dus dang /
analyzed: dus rnam pa brgyad po gang zhe na / mer mer po'i dus dang / nur nur po'i dus dang / ltar ltar po'i dus dang / mkhrang 'gyur gyi dus dang / rkang lag 'gyus pa'i dus dang / skra dang ba spu dang sen mo 'byung ba'i dus dang / dbang po dod pa'i dus dang /
translated: What are the eight?

original: mtshan dod pa'i dus so //
analyzed: mtshan dod pa'i dus so //
translated: The period of kalala, the period of arbuda, the period of peśin, the period of ghana, the period of praśākhā, the period of hair and body hair and nails, the period of the development of the faculties, and the period of the development of secondary sex characteristics.

original: de la spris ma lta bus yogs la nang blan te /
analyzed: de la spris ma lta bus yogs la nang blan te /
translated: The kalala is like a lump of semen and blood.

original: mar 'dug pa na ni mer mer po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mar 'dug pa na ni mer mer po zhes bya'o //
translated: When it is like a lump of coagulated milk, it is called the kalala.

original: phyi nang bcas par spris ma lta bur gyur te /🔽zho lta bur 'dug la shar ma gyur pa ni nur nur po zhes bya'o //🔽shar ni gyur la sla ba ni ltar ltar po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: phyi nang bcas par spris ma lta bur gyur te / zho lta bur 'dug la shar ma gyur pa ni nur nur po zhes bya'o // shar ni gyur la sla ba ni ltar ltar po zhes bya'o //
translated: When it is like a lump of coagulated milk on the outside and inside,🔽and is like a curd-lump that has not yet turned, it is called the arbuda.🔽When it has turned, but is still soft, it is called the peśin.

original: ska bar gyur te mnan du bzod pa ni mkhrang 'gyur zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ska bar gyur te mnan du bzod pa ni mkhrang 'gyur zhes bya'o //
translated: When it is solid and can bear pressure, it is called the ghana.

original: de nyid las sha lhag lta bur gyur te /
analyzed: de nyid las sha lhag lta bur gyur te /
translated: The same text says, “The excess flesh becomes🔽the major and minor body parts.”

original: yan lag dang nying lag gi mchan ma byung ba ni rkang lag 'gyus pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yan lag dang nying lag gi mchan ma byung ba ni rkang lag 'gyus pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The movement of the arms and legs is called “the time of the development of the faculties.”

original: de nas skra dang ba spu dang sen mo byung ba ni de nyid kyi dus yin no //
analyzed: de nas skra dang ba spu dang sen mo byung ba ni de nyid kyi dus yin no //
translated: Then, the appearance of the hair of the head, body hair, and nails is called “the time of the development of the faculties.”

original: de nas mig la sogs pa'i dbang po rnams mngon par 'grub pa ni dbang po dod pa'i @14b dus zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de nas mig la sogs pa'i dbang po rnams mngon par 'grub pa ni dbang po dod pa'i @14b dus zhes bya'o //
translated: Then, the development of the faculties such as the eyes is called “the time of the development of the faculties.”

original: de nas de'i gnas gsal bar gyur pa ni mtshan dod pa'i dus zhes bya'o //🔽mngal na gnas pa de sngon gyi las kyi dbang dang / mas ya nga ba ma spangs pa dang / ya nga ba ma spangs ba las byung ba'i rlung de dang mthun pa dag gis skra mi sdug pa dang / mdog mi sdug pa dang /
analyzed: de nas de'i gnas gsal bar gyur pa ni mtshan dod pa'i dus zhes bya'o // mngal na gnas pa de sngon gyi las kyi dbang dang / mas ya nga ba ma spangs pa dang / ya nga ba ma spangs ba las byung ba'i rlung de dang mthun pa dag gis skra mi sdug pa dang / mdog mi sdug pa dang /
translated: Then, the development of the body’s shape is called “the time of the development of the secondary signs.”

original: pags pa mi sdug pa dang / lus mi sdug par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: pags pa mi sdug pa dang / lus mi sdug par 'gyur ro //
translated: If the being in the womb is a human, and if the mother does not avoid what is harmful, then the wind that is in accord with the mother’s harmful actions will cause the being in the womb to have an ugly head, an ugly color, and an ugly body.

original: ji skad skra mi sdug par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ji skad skra mi sdug par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: What does it mean to have an ugly head?

original: des sngon de lta bur 'gyur ba'i sdig pa mi dge ba'i las byas pa dang / de'i mas 'gyur byed dang / lan tshva'i ra lta bu'i kha zas dang / skom phal cher bsten pa des na /
analyzed: des sngon de lta bur 'gyur ba'i sdig pa mi dge ba'i las byas pa dang / de'i mas 'gyur byed dang / lan tshva'i ra lta bu'i kha zas dang / skom phal cher bsten pa des na /
translated: The mother of the one who will be born in that way has committed sinful, non-virtuous actions, and she has eaten a lot of food that causes change, such as salt and buttermilk, and has drunk a lot of salty water.

original: mngal na gnas pa de'i ba spu dang / skra ngan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mngal na gnas pa de'i ba spu dang / skra ngan par 'gyur ro //
translated: The mother’s consumption of a diet that is too salty or too sour, or that is too hot, too bitter, or too astringent, will cause the child to be born with bad hair and skin.

original: ji ltar mdog mi sdug par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar mdog mi sdug par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How does the child come to have an ugly complexion?

original: las ni snga ma bzhin te rgyu yin no //
analyzed: las ni snga ma bzhin te rgyu yin no //
translated: The cause is the same as before.

original: da ltar gyi rkyen ni mas nyi ma la sogs pa shin tu tshab bsten pas des na de'i mdog gnag pa dang / sngo bsangs su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: da ltar gyi rkyen ni mas nyi ma la sogs pa shin tu tshab bsten pas des na de'i mdog gnag pa dang / sngo bsangs su 'gyur ro //
translated: The present conditions are that the mother’s consumption of too much salt, etc., will cause the child to be born with a dark or pale complexion.

original: khyim gyi nang na ha cang grang ba na 'dug pa des ni de'i mdog dkar bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: khyim gyi nang na ha cang grang ba na 'dug pa des ni de'i mdog dkar bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If the mother stays too long in a cold house, the child will be born with a white complexion.

original: kha zas ha cang tsha ba zos pa des ni /
analyzed: kha zas ha cang tsha ba zos pa des ni /
translated: If the mother eats food that is too hot,

original: de'i mdog dmar por 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i mdog dmar por 'gyur ro //
translated: the child will be born with a red complexion.

original: ji ltar pags pa mi sdug par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar pags pa mi sdug par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How does the child come to have bad skin?

original: las ni snga ma bzhin te rgyu yin no //
analyzed: las ni snga ma bzhin te rgyu yin no //
translated: The cause is the same as before.

original: da ltar gyi rkyen ni mas 'khrig ba'i chos ha cang bsten drags pa des de shu ba can nam /🔽khyi rngo can nam /🔽mdze can nam /
analyzed: da ltar gyi rkyen ni mas 'khrig ba'i chos ha cang bsten drags pa des de shu ba can nam / khyi rngo can nam / mdze can nam /
translated: This causes the child to be born with leprosy,🔽or to be born with a goiter,

original: pags pa skyon can du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: pags pa skyon can du 'gyur ro //
translated: or to be born with a skin disease.

original: ji ltar lus mi sdug par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar lus mi sdug par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How does the body become ugly?

original: las ni snga ma bzhin te rgyu yin no //
analyzed: las ni snga ma bzhin te rgyu yin no //
translated: The cause is the same as before.

original: da ltar gyi rkyen ni ma brgyug pa dang / 'phar ba dang / mchongs la sogs pa'i spyod lam drag po byed de /
analyzed: da ltar gyi rkyen ni ma brgyug pa dang / 'phar ba dang / mchongs la sogs pa'i spyod lam drag po byed de /
translated: The present condition is that the mother does not avoid rough behavior, such as running, jumping, and leaping.

original: ya nga ba de ma spangs pa des na /🔽de'i lus mi sdug pa 'am /
analyzed: ya nga ba de ma spangs pa des na / de'i lus mi sdug pa 'am /
translated: Because she does not avoid these dangerous activities,🔽the child is born with an ugly body

original: dbang po ma tshang bar 'gyur ro //🔽gal te mor gyur na ni de ma'i sgal tshigs la brten la brang logs su mdun gyis phyogs shing blo g-yon rol na 'dug go //
analyzed: dbang po ma tshang bar 'gyur ro // gal te mor gyur na ni de ma'i sgal tshigs la brten la brang logs su mdun gyis phyogs shing blo g-yon rol na 'dug go //
translated: or with incomplete faculties.🔽If the child is a girl, she will be on the right side of the womb, facing the back of the mother, with her head toward the mother’s abdomen.

original: gal te phor gyur na ni ma'i lto logs su brtan la sgal tshigs logs su mdun gyis phyogs shing blo g-yas rol na 'dug go //
analyzed: gal te phor gyur na ni ma'i lto logs su brtan la sgal tshigs logs su mdun gyis phyogs shing blo g-yas rol na 'dug go //
translated: If the child is a boy, he will be on the left side of the womb, facing the front of the mother, with his head toward the mother’s right side.

original: mngal na gnas pa yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ba ni /
analyzed: mngal na gnas pa yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ba ni /
translated: The completion of the embryo is as follows:

original: mas mngal na gnas pa shas cher mi bzod pa las /
analyzed: mas mngal na gnas pa shas cher mi bzod pa las /
translated: The mother of the embryo experiences a great deal of discomfort.

original: nang du rlung dag 'byung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: nang du rlung dag 'byung bar 'gyur te /
translated: Then the internal winds arise and

original: de dag ni de la gnod pa skyed par byed do//
analyzed: de dag ni de la gnod pa skyed par byed do//
translated: they cause harm to the embryo.

original: @15a * // de'i las kyi rnam par smin pa las byung ba /🔽skye ba'i char gtogs pa'i rlung 'byung bar 'gyur te des mngal na gnas pa de rkang ba ni gyen du bstan /
analyzed: @15a * // de'i las kyi rnam par smin pa las byung ba / skye ba'i char gtogs pa'i rlung 'byung bar 'gyur te des mngal na gnas pa de rkang ba ni gyen du bstan /
translated: The winds that arise from the ripening of the karma of the embryo

original: mgo ni thur du bstan te /🔽de nas mngal na gnas pa de shams yogs bzhin du 'byung bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: mgo ni thur du bstan te / de nas mngal na gnas pa de shams yogs bzhin du 'byung bar 'gyur la /
translated: turn the embryo upside down and🔽it emerges from the womb headfirst.

original: 'byung ba na sha ma de phyir nang du log ste lto na gnas so //
analyzed: 'byung ba na sha ma de phyir nang du log ste lto na gnas so //
translated: As the embryo emerges, the womb is turned inside out and the placenta is expelled.

original: mngal gyi sgor byung ma thag tu btsas pa'i dus zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mngal gyi sgor byung ma thag tu btsas pa'i dus zhes bya'o //
translated: As soon as the embryo emerges from the womb, it is said to be born.

original: de btsas nas rim gyis skye ba'i char gtogs pa'i reg pa 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de btsas nas rim gyis skye ba'i char gtogs pa'i reg pa 'di lta ste /
translated: After birth, the embryo experiences the contact that is part of the stage of growth,

original: mig gi 'dus te reg pa nas yid kyi 'dus te reg pa'i bar du reg par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mig gi 'dus te reg pa nas yid kyi 'dus te reg pa'i bar du reg par 'gyur ro //
translated: such as contact through the eyes up to contact through the mind.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows:

original: 'jig rten gyi spyod pa la tha snyad rjes su slob pas kyang 'dogs pa la 'jug go //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi spyod pa la tha snyad rjes su slob pas kyang 'dogs pa la 'jug go //
translated: One engages in designation by following the conventions of worldly conduct.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows:

original: skye ba'i rgyus dbang po rnams yongs su smin pas khyim na 'dug go //
analyzed: skye ba'i rgyus dbang po rnams yongs su smin pas khyim na 'dug go //
translated: One remains in the household due to the ripening of the faculties caused by birth.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows:

original: 'jig rten pa'i bzo'i las kyi gnas rnams kyi las dag kyang byed do //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i bzo'i las kyi gnas rnams kyi las dag kyang byed do //
translated: One also performs the activities of the worldly arts and crafts.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows:

original: gzugs la sogs pa sdug pa dang / mi sdug pa'i yul dag la yang spyod do //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa sdug pa dang / mi sdug pa'i yul dag la yang spyod do //
translated: One also engages with objects that are pleasant and unpleasant, such as form.

original: 'di lta ste /🔽sngon gyi las kyi rkyen tam /
analyzed: 'di lta ste / sngon gyi las kyi rkyen tam /
translated: It is as follows:🔽One experiences pleasure and pain due to the conditions of past karma

original: da ltar gyi rkyen gyis bde ba dang / sdug bsngal ba yang nyams su myong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: da ltar gyi rkyen gyis bde ba dang / sdug bsngal ba yang nyams su myong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: or due to present conditions.

original: 'di lta ste /🔽'gro ba lngar 'gro ba'i rkyen dag gam /
analyzed: 'di lta ste / 'gro ba lngar 'gro ba'i rkyen dag gam /
translated: It is as follows:🔽One is led according to conditions, due to conditions that lead to the five destinies

original: mya ngan las 'das par 'gro ba'i rkyen dag gis kyang rkyen ji lta ba bzhin du 'khrid par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das par 'gro ba'i rkyen dag gis kyang rkyen ji lta ba bzhin du 'khrid par 'gyur ro //
translated: or due to conditions that lead to nirvāṇa.🔽It is as follows:

original: sems can gang dag gi lus sems can gyi ris gang du byung bar gyur pa ste /
analyzed: sems can gang dag gi lus sems can gyi ris gang du byung bar gyur pa ste /
translated: One is born in a class of sentient beings, in a body of sentient beings.

original: sems can skal pa mnyam pa gang yin pa de sems can de dag la rkyen rnam pa bzhi po //
analyzed: sems can skal pa mnyam pa gang yin pa de sems can de dag la rkyen rnam pa bzhi po //
translated: The four conditions for those who are of the same species are:

original: sa bon gyi chos kyis sgrub pa dang / kha zas kyis rgyas par byed pa dang / kun tu legs par bsrung ba dang / lus dang ngag gi las mngon par 'du byed pa la rjes su bslab pas rkyen gyi bya ba byed de /🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: sa bon gyi chos kyis sgrub pa dang / kha zas kyis rgyas par byed pa dang / kun tu legs par bsrung ba dang / lus dang ngag gi las mngon par 'du byed pa la rjes su bslab pas rkyen gyi bya ba byed de / 'di lta ste /
translated: the establishment of the seed-nature, the nourishment of food, the protection of the guardians, and the activity of the body and speech.

original: pha ma gnyis kyis thog ma kho nar khu ba dang khrag gis sgrub par byed do //
analyzed: pha ma gnyis kyis thog ma kho nar khu ba dang khrag gis sgrub par byed do //
translated: The father and mother first establish the embryo with semen and blood.

original: de nas btsas par rig nas gzhan dag kyang de dang mthun pa'i zas ldud par byed /
analyzed: de nas btsas par rig nas gzhan dag kyang de dang mthun pa'i zas ldud par byed /
translated: Then, knowing that the child has been born, others give it suitable food.

original: gso bar byed skyed par byed do //
analyzed: gso bar byed skyed par byed do //
translated: They nourish it and raise it.

original: de nas dus ma yin par 'gro ba dang / yang bar 'gro zhing rgyu ba las de dang der kun tu srung ba'i bya ba byed do //
analyzed: de nas dus ma yin par 'gro ba dang / yang bar 'gro zhing rgyu ba las de dang der kun tu srung ba'i bya ba byed do //
translated: Then, when it is time to go out or when it is time to go to the toilet, they protect it from here and there.

original: de nas skyes pa'i rgyus dbang po rnams yongs su smin nas smra ba'i tha snyad dag slob tu 'jug ste /
analyzed: de nas skyes pa'i rgyus dbang po rnams yongs su smin nas smra ba'i tha snyad dag slob tu 'jug ste /
translated: Then, because of its birth, its faculties mature and it learns to speak and to use conventional expressions.

original: de dag @15b gis kyang gzhan dag slob tu 'jug go //
analyzed: de dag @15b gis kyang gzhan dag slob tu 'jug go //
translated: and they in turn teach others.

original: de ltar na sems can 'di dag ni thog ma med pa'i dus nas /
analyzed: de ltar na sems can 'di dag ni thog ma med pa'i dus nas /
translated: Thus, these sentient beings, since beginningless time,

original: bde ba dang / sdug bsngal ba so sor nyams su myong ste /
analyzed: bde ba dang / sdug bsngal ba so sor nyams su myong ste /
translated: have experienced individually happiness and suffering.

original: sangs rgyas rnams kyi byang chub la brten nas gzhan gyi sgra'i rgyu las byung ba dang / nang gi tshul bzhin yid la byed pas /
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams kyi byang chub la brten nas gzhan gyi sgra'i rgyu las byung ba dang / nang gi tshul bzhin yid la byed pas /
translated: In dependence on the enlightenment of the Buddhas, and by means of the cause of the words of others and the internal proper mental attention,

original: zag pa zad pa thob par ma gyur gyi bar du bde ba dang sdug bsngal ba las 'da' bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zag pa zad pa thob par ma gyur gyi bar du bde ba dang sdug bsngal ba las 'da' bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: they do not transcend happiness and suffering until they attain the exhaustion of the contaminants.

original: de bas na 'di lta ste /🔽bdag gi ni gang na yang /
analyzed: de bas na 'di lta ste / bdag gi ni gang na yang /
translated: Therefore, it is like this:🔽There is no one anywhere

original: su yang ci yang med do //
analyzed: su yang ci yang med do //
translated: who is anything at all.

original: bdag kyang gang na yang su yang /
analyzed: bdag kyang gang na yang su yang /
translated: I also am nowhere

original: ci yang ma yin no //
analyzed: ci yang ma yin no //
translated: nothing at all.

original: zhes bya ba'i tshig 'di ni shin tu rtogs par dka' ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i tshig 'di ni shin tu rtogs par dka' ste /
translated: This statement is extremely difficult to understand.

original: nang gi dngos po rnams kyi 'chi 'pho dang skye ba ni de lta bu yin no //
analyzed: nang gi dngos po rnams kyi 'chi 'pho dang skye ba ni de lta bu yin no //
translated: Such is the death and rebirth of internal things.

original: phyi rol gyi dngos po rnams kyi 'jig pa dang 'chags pa ji lta bu yin zhe na /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi dngos po rnams kyi 'jig pa dang 'chags pa ji lta bu yin zhe na /
translated: How is the destruction and evolution of external things?

original: sems can rnams kyi 'jig pa dang / 'chags bar 'gyur ba'i las kyis 'gyur te /
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi 'jig pa dang / 'chags bar 'gyur ba'i las kyis 'gyur te /
translated: External things are destroyed and evolve through the karma of beings.

original: gal te 'jig par 'gyur ba'i las nye bar gnas par gyur na ni /
analyzed: gal te 'jig par 'gyur ba'i las nye bar gnas par gyur na ni /
translated: If the karma for destruction is present,

original: de nas phyi rol gyi 'jig pa'i rkyen gyis de dag 'jig par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: de nas phyi rol gyi 'jig pa'i rkyen gyis de dag 'jig par 'gyur gyi /
translated: then external things are destroyed by the conditions of destruction.

original: nang gi rnams tshe zad pas 'gyur ba lta bus ni ma yin no //
analyzed: nang gi rnams tshe zad pas 'gyur ba lta bus ni ma yin no //
translated: But internal things are not destroyed by the exhaustion of life.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di ltar phyi rol gyi dngos po rnams ni gzugs can rags pa 'byung ba chen po bzhi las byung ba /
analyzed: 'di ltar phyi rol gyi dngos po rnams ni gzugs can rags pa 'byung ba chen po bzhi las byung ba /
translated: Because external things are gross, physical, and derived from the four great elements.

original: rgyun brtan pa yin la nang gi rnams ni de lta bu ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyun brtan pa yin la nang gi rnams ni de lta bu ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They are stable continuums, but internal things are not like that.

original: snod ni de dag gi chags pa dang / 'jig pa'i las gang yin pa de ni nges par bskal par gnas par 'phen pa yin te /
analyzed: snod ni de dag gi chags pa dang / 'jig pa'i las gang yin pa de ni nges par bskal par gnas par 'phen pa yin te /
translated: The evolution and destruction of the external receptacle world is projected by the karma of beings.

original: de las kyang mi ring la de de las kyang mi thung ngo //
analyzed: de las kyang mi ring la de de las kyang mi thung ngo //
translated: It does not last longer than that, nor is it shorter.

original: sems can du bgrang ba gang yin pa de ni dus nges pa med do //
analyzed: sems can du bgrang ba gang yin pa de ni dus nges pa med do //
translated: The sentient beings who are counted as inhabitants of the hells do not have a fixed life span.

original: 'di ltar de dag ni las sna tshogs mngon par 'du byed pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar de dag ni las sna tshogs mngon par 'du byed pa yin te /
translated: Because they create various actions,

original: de bas na de dag la ni bskal pa las lhag pa dang / de bas thung ba lo bcu'i bar dag kyang yod de //
analyzed: de bas na de dag la ni bskal pa las lhag pa dang / de bas thung ba lo bcu'i bar dag kyang yod de //
translated: some have a life span longer than a kalpa, and some have a life span of less than ten years.

original: 'di ltar 'jig pa de la yang rnam pa gsum yod par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'jig pa de la yang rnam pa gsum yod par rig par bya ste /
translated: The destruction of the world should be understood as threefold:

original: mes 'jigs pas ni mnar med pa yan chad /🔽tshangs pa'i 'jig rten man chad 'jig go //🔽chus 'jig pas ni bsam gtan gnyis pa man chad mtha' dag 'jig sgo //
analyzed: mes 'jigs pas ni mnar med pa yan chad / tshangs pa'i 'jig rten man chad 'jig go // chus 'jig pas ni bsam gtan gnyis pa man chad mtha' dag 'jig sgo //
translated: by fire, up to the realm of the second absorption;🔽by water, up to the realm of the third absorption;

original: rlung gis 'jig pas ni bsam gtan gsum pa man chang mtha' dag 'jig go //🔽bsam gtan bzhi pa na ni bsam gtan bzhi @16a * //
analyzed: rlung gis 'jig pas ni bsam gtan gsum pa man chang mtha' dag 'jig go // bsam gtan bzhi pa na ni bsam gtan bzhi @16a * //
translated: and by wind, up to the realm of the fourth absorption.

original: pa'i sa pa'i lha de dag gzhal med khang dag dang lhan cig skye zhing gzhal med khang dag dang / lhan cig 'chi 'pho bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: pa'i sa pa'i lha de dag gzhal med khang dag dang lhan cig skye zhing gzhal med khang dag dang / lhan cig 'chi 'pho bar 'gyur te /
translated: In the fourth absorption, the gods of the fourth absorption are born together with their celestial palaces and die and transmigrate together with them.

original: de'i phyir de dag la ni 'jig pa yang med la 'jig pa'i rgyu yang med do //
analyzed: de'i phyir de dag la ni 'jig pa yang med la 'jig pa'i rgyu yang med do //
translated: Therefore, there is no destruction of these realms, nor is there a cause for their destruction.

original: 'jig pa rnam pa gsum po'i rtse mo'i bsam gtan gnyis pa dang / bsam gtan gsum pa dang / bsam gtan bzhi pa'i bar du'o //
analyzed: 'jig pa rnam pa gsum po'i rtse mo'i bsam gtan gnyis pa dang / bsam gtan gsum pa dang / bsam gtan bzhi pa'i bar du'o //
translated: The three types of destruction are the destruction by fire, which occurs up to the second meditative absorption; the destruction by water, which occurs up to the third meditative absorption; and the destruction by wind, which occurs up to the fourth meditative absorption.

original: 'jig rten 'di bar gyi bskal pa nyi shur ni 'jig go //🔽bar gyi bskal pa nyi shur ni zhig par gnas so //🔽bar gyi bskal pa nyi shur ni 'chags so //
analyzed: 'jig rten 'di bar gyi bskal pa nyi shur ni 'jig go // bar gyi bskal pa nyi shur ni zhig par gnas so // bar gyi bskal pa nyi shur ni 'chags so //
translated: This world remains destroyed for twenty intermediate eons.🔽For twenty intermediate eons it remains destroyed.🔽For twenty intermediate eons it is in the process of formation.

original: bar gyi bskal pa nyi shur ni chags nas gnas so //
analyzed: bar gyi bskal pa nyi shur ni chags nas gnas so //
translated: For twenty intermediate eons it remains formed.

original: de dag ni bar gyi bskal pa brgyad cur 'gyur te /
analyzed: de dag ni bar gyi bskal pa brgyad cur 'gyur te /
translated: These make up eighty intermediate eons.

original: de ni grangs gyi gdags pas bar gyi bskal pa chen po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ni grangs gyi gdags pas bar gyi bskal pa chen po zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called a great eon according to the method of enumeration.

original: de la tshangs pa'i 'jig rten na ni tshe'i tshad bskal ba ste /
analyzed: de la tshangs pa'i 'jig rten na ni tshe'i tshad bskal ba ste /
translated: In the world of Brahma, the life span is one eon.

original: de ni thams cad kyi tha mar 'jig la /
analyzed: de ni thams cad kyi tha mar 'jig la /
translated: This is the final destruction.

original: thams cad kyi dang por de nyid 'chags so //
analyzed: thams cad kyi dang por de nyid 'chags so //
translated: This is the first formation.

original: bskal pa de'i rnam par gzhag pa gzhan du yang blta bar bya ste /🔽bar gyi bskal pa nyi shu la bskal pa gcig tu btags pa ni tshangs ris rnams kyi tshe'i tshad du rnam par gzhag go //🔽bar gyi bskal pa bzhi bcu la bskal pa gcig tu btags pa ni /
analyzed: bskal pa de'i rnam par gzhag pa gzhan du yang blta bar bya ste / bar gyi bskal pa nyi shu la bskal pa gcig tu btags pa ni tshangs ris rnams kyi tshe'i tshad du rnam par gzhag go // bar gyi bskal pa bzhi bcu la bskal pa gcig tu btags pa ni /
translated: The other divisions of the eon should be understood in the same way.🔽Twenty intermediate eons make one eon, which is the length of life of the Brahmakayika gods.

original: tshangs pa'i mdun na 'don rnams kyi tshe'i tshad du rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: tshangs pa'i mdun na 'don rnams kyi tshe'i tshad du rnam par gzhag go //
translated: Forty intermediate eons make one eon, which is the length of life of the Brahmapurohita gods.

original: bar gyi bskal pa drug cu la bskal pa gcig tu btags pa ni tshangs chen rnams kyi tshe'i tshad du rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: bar gyi bskal pa drug cu la bskal pa gcig tu btags pa ni tshangs chen rnams kyi tshe'i tshad du rnam par gzhag go //
translated: Sixty intermediate eons make one eon, which is the length of life of the Mahabrahma gods.

original: mes 'jig pa gang zhe na /🔽sems can tshe dpag tu med pa dag gi tshe 'grib ste /🔽tshe lo brgyad khri la thug par 'gyur ba dang / de dag gis mi dge ba'i chos rnams yang dag par blangs pas /
analyzed: mes 'jig pa gang zhe na / sems can tshe dpag tu med pa dag gi tshe 'grib ste / tshe lo brgyad khri la thug par 'gyur ba dang / de dag gis mi dge ba'i chos rnams yang dag par blangs pas /
translated: What is destruction by fire?🔽When the life expectancy of sentient beings is immeasurable, it decreases until it reaches eighty thousand years.🔽Then, due to the adoption of nonvirtuous practices, it decreases again until it reaches ten years.

original: yang 'grib nas tshe lo bcu pa la thug par 'gyur ba dang / de dag skye bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: yang 'grib nas tshe lo bcu pa la thug par 'gyur ba dang / de dag skye bar 'gyur te /
translated: Then, it increases again until it reaches eighty thousand years.

original: dge ba'i chos rnams yang dag par blangs pas /
analyzed: dge ba'i chos rnams yang dag par blangs pas /
translated: By correctly taking up wholesome factors,

original: tshe nur nas phyir tshe brgyad khri la thug par 'gyur ba de'i dus kyang yod de /🔽de ltar mar bri ba gang yin pa de dang / yar skye pa gang yin pa de gnyis bsdus te /
analyzed: tshe nur nas phyir tshe brgyad khri la thug par 'gyur ba de'i dus kyang yod de / de ltar mar bri ba gang yin pa de dang / yar skye pa gang yin pa de gnyis bsdus te /
translated: the life expectancy increases up to 80,000 years.

original: grangs rnam par gzhag pas bar gyi bskal pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: grangs rnam par gzhag pas bar gyi bskal pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The period of decrease and the period of increase together are called an intermediate eon.

original: bar gyi bskal pa de yang mu ge dang nad dang mtshon rnam pa gsum gyis thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bar gyi bskal pa de yang mu ge dang nad dang mtshon rnam pa gsum gyis thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: This intermediate eon is destroyed by three calamities: famine, disease, and sword.🔽Famine occurs when the life expectancy is thirty years.

original: mu ge de yang gang gi @16b tshe mi rnams kyi tshe lo sum cu thub pa de'i tshe 'byung ngo //🔽'di lta bu dag kyang 'byung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: mu ge de yang gang gi @16b tshe mi rnams kyi tshe lo sum cu thub pa de'i tshe 'byung ngo // 'di lta bu dag kyang 'byung bar 'gyur te /
translated: People die of starvation.

original: rus pa rnying pa dag kyang bskol zhing bskol zhing srog zungs su byed de /
analyzed: rus pa rnying pa dag kyang bskol zhing bskol zhing srog zungs su byed de /
translated: They boil and eat the bones of dogs and humans.🔽At that time, if someone finds a grain of rice,

original: der brgya la res 'ga' nas kyi 'bru 'am /
analyzed: der brgya la res 'ga' nas kyi 'bru 'am /
translated: a grain of wheat,

original: 'bras kyi 'bru 'am /🔽rgya shug gam /
analyzed: 'bras kyi 'bru 'am / rgya shug gam /
translated: a jujube fruit,🔽a pea,

original: rgya sran nam /
analyzed: rgya sran nam /
translated: or a sesame seed,

original: til gyi 'bru rnyed par gyur na /
analyzed: til gyi 'bru rnyed par gyur na /
translated: he wraps it in a leaf🔽and stores it as a treasure, thinking:

original: de nor bu rin po che bzhin du za ma tog gi nang du bcug ste srung bar byed do //
analyzed: de nor bu rin po che bzhin du za ma tog gi nang du bcug ste srung bar byed do //
translated: They will be placed in a precious casket and guarded.

original: sems can de dag las phal cher nyams stobs med de /
analyzed: sems can de dag las phal cher nyams stobs med de /
translated: Most of these beings will be weak.

original: sa la gan rkyal du 'gyel nas ldang yang mi nus te /
analyzed: sa la gan rkyal du 'gyel nas ldang yang mi nus te /
translated: They will fall to the ground, face down, and be unable to rise.

original: mu ge de lta bus sems can phal cher 'chi ba'i dus byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mu ge de lta bus sems can phal cher 'chi ba'i dus byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: Most beings will die in such a famine.

original: mu ge de yang re ltar thogs na /
analyzed: mu ge de yang re ltar thogs na /
translated: If that famine lasts for a while,

original: lo bdun dang / zla ba bdun dang / zhag bdun zad de /
analyzed: lo bdun dang / zla ba bdun dang / zhag bdun zad de /
translated: it will last for seven years, seven months, and seven days.

original: de phan chad thal zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de phan chad thal zhes bya'o //
translated: After that, it will be over.

original: sems can de dag kyang 'dus shing tshogs nas shas chung ngur skyo bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: sems can de dag kyang 'dus shing tshogs nas shas chung ngur skyo bar 'gyur te /
translated: Those beings will gather together and feel a little remorse.

original: de dag rgyu de dang rkyen des tshe 'grib par mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: de dag rgyu de dang rkyen des tshe 'grib par mi 'gyur la /
translated: Because of that cause and that condition, their lifespans will not decrease,

original: mu ge de yang med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mu ge de yang med par 'gyur ro //
translated: and that famine will disappear.

original: gang gi tshe mi rnams kyi tshe lo nyi shu thub cing /
analyzed: gang gi tshe mi rnams kyi tshe lo nyi shu thub cing /
translated: When the lifespan of humans is twenty years,

original: skyo ba de nyid med par gyur nas /
analyzed: skyo ba de nyid med par gyur nas /
translated: that remorse will disappear.

original: 'grib pa de'i tshe yams kyi nad dang / gnod pa dang / mgo ba'i nad dang / 'khrug pa mang po 'byung bar 'gyur te de dag nad mang pos phal cher 'chi ba'i dus byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'grib pa de'i tshe yams kyi nad dang / gnod pa dang / mgo ba'i nad dang / 'khrug pa mang po 'byung bar 'gyur te de dag nad mang pos phal cher 'chi ba'i dus byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: At that time, epidemics, violence, head diseases, and many conflicts will arise, and most will die from these many diseases.

original: de dag gi nad de yang re ltar thogs na zla ba bdun dang zhag bdun kho nar zad de /
analyzed: de dag gi nad de yang re ltar thogs na zla ba bdun dang zhag bdun kho nar zad de /
translated: Moreover, that disease will last only seven days and seven nights.

original: de phan chad thal zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de phan chad thal zhes bya'o //
translated: After that, it will be said to have passed.

original: de nas sems can de dag 'bring du skyo bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de nas sems can de dag 'bring du skyo bar 'gyur te /
translated: Then, those beings will become moderately weary.

original: rgyu de dang rkyen des tshe 'grib par mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: rgyu de dang rkyen des tshe 'grib par mi 'gyur la /
translated: By that cause and condition, their lifespans will not decrease,

original: nad de dag kyang 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nad de dag kyang 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: and those diseases will also arise.

original: gang gi tshe mi rnams kyi tshe lo bcu thub cing skyo ba de nyid med par gyur pas tshe 'grib par gyur pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: gang gi tshe mi rnams kyi tshe lo bcu thub cing skyo ba de nyid med par gyur pas tshe 'grib par gyur pa de'i tshe /
translated: When the lifespan of humans is ten years, and that weariness has not yet arisen, at that time,

original: sems can de dag gcig gis gcig mthong na bsad ba'i sems drag po nye bar gnas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sems can de dag gcig gis gcig mthong na bsad ba'i sems drag po nye bar gnas par 'gyur ro //
translated: when those beings see each other, a strong intention to kill will arise.

original: de nas de dag gis rtsva'am /
analyzed: de nas de dag gis rtsva'am /
translated: Then, with that, they will take up grass,

original: shing ngam / gseg ma 'am /
analyzed: shing ngam / gseg ma 'am /
translated: wood, pebbles,

original: gyo mo 'am /
analyzed: gyo mo 'am /
translated: or a lump of clay,🔽🔽

original: gang dang gang blangs pa de dang de dag mtshon cha rnon po legs par bdar ba bzhin du 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang dang gang blangs pa de dang de dag mtshon cha rnon po legs par bdar ba bzhin du 'gyur te /
translated: whatever they take up becomes like a well-sharpened weapon.

original: de dag gis de dag gcig la gcig gsod par byed do //
analyzed: de dag gis de dag gcig la gcig gsod par byed do //
translated: With that, they kill each other.

original: de yang re ltar thogs na zhag bdun du zad de de phan chad thal zhes bya'o //🔽sems can de dag la de'i tshe mchog tu rgud pa rnam pa gsum @17a * //
analyzed: de yang re ltar thogs na zhag bdun du zad de de phan chad thal zhes bya'o // sems can de dag la de'i tshe mchog tu rgud pa rnam pa gsum @17a * //
translated: Moreover, if they live for a long time, it is only seven days. After that, they are said to be destroyed.🔽At that time, three kinds of extreme misfortune

original: 'byung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'byung bar 'gyur te /
translated: occur for those sentient beings.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are:

original: tshe rgud pa dang / lus rgud pa dang / yo byad rgud par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tshe rgud pa dang / lus rgud pa dang / yo byad rgud par 'gyur ro //
translated: misfortune of life, misfortune of body, and misfortune of resources.

original: de la tshe rgud ba ni tshe'i tshad re ltar ring na re ltar lo bcu thub pa yin no //
analyzed: de la tshe rgud ba ni tshe'i tshad re ltar ring na re ltar lo bcu thub pa yin no //
translated: As for misfortune of life, if their life is long, it is only ten years.

original: de la lus rgud pa ni /
analyzed: de la lus rgud pa ni /
translated: As for misfortune of body,

original: lus kyi tshad re ltar ring na mtho gang dang / chag gang ba yin no //
analyzed: lus kyi tshad re ltar ring na mtho gang dang / chag gang ba yin no //
translated: if their body is large, it is only one cubit.

original: de la yo byad rgud pa ni /🔽kha zas kyi mchog ni khre rgod yin no //
analyzed: de la yo byad rgud pa ni / kha zas kyi mchog ni khre rgod yin no //
translated: As for misfortune of resources,🔽their best food is millet.

original: gos kyi mchog ni skra'i la ba yin no //
analyzed: gos kyi mchog ni skra'i la ba yin no //
translated: Their best clothing is a blanket of human hair.

original: rgyan gyi mchog ni mtshon cha yin no //
analyzed: rgyan gyi mchog ni mtshon cha yin no //
translated: The best ornament is a weapon.

original: ro rnam pa lnga po mar gyi ro dang / sbrang rtsi'i ro dang / 'bru mar gyi ro dang / bu ram shing las byung ba'i ro dang / lan tshva'i ro rnams ni thams cad kyi thams cad du med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ro rnam pa lnga po mar gyi ro dang / sbrang rtsi'i ro dang / 'bru mar gyi ro dang / bu ram shing las byung ba'i ro dang / lan tshva'i ro rnams ni thams cad kyi thams cad du med par 'gyur ro //
translated: The five tastes—butter, honey, sesame oil, sugarcane, and salt—will completely disappear.

original: de nas sems can de dag shas cher skyo bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de nas sems can de dag shas cher skyo bar 'gyur te /
translated: Then those beings will become mostly disgusted.

original: skyo ba las yongs su nyams par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: skyo ba las yongs su nyams par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: From disgust, they will not fall away.

original: de dag phan tshun 'dus shing tshogs nas tshe yongs su 'grib par 'gyur ba'i sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos rnams ni spangs /
analyzed: de dag phan tshun 'dus shing tshogs nas tshe yongs su 'grib par 'gyur ba'i sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos rnams ni spangs /
translated: They will gather together and assemble, and having abandoned the sinful, non-virtuous dharmas that cause a decrease in lifespan,

original: tshe nur bar byed pa'i dge ba'i chos rnams ni yang dag par blangs te 'dug nas /
analyzed: tshe nur bar byed pa'i dge ba'i chos rnams ni yang dag par blangs te 'dug nas /
translated: they will take up the virtuous dharmas that cause an increase in lifespan.

original: de dag gi tshe yang phyir nur ro //
analyzed: de dag gi tshe yang phyir nur ro //
translated: Then their lifespan will increase.

original: mdog dang stobs dang / bde ba dang / dbang phyug la dbang byed pas kyang dar bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: mdog dang stobs dang / bde ba dang / dbang phyug la dbang byed pas kyang dar bar 'gyur te /
translated: Their complexion, strength, happiness, and mastery will flourish,

original: tshe yang lo brgyad khri la thug par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tshe yang lo brgyad khri la thug par 'gyur ro //
translated: and their lifespan will reach eighty thousand years.

original: de ltar mar 'bri ba nyi shu dang / yar skye ba nyi shu ste /
analyzed: de ltar mar 'bri ba nyi shu dang / yar skye ba nyi shu ste /
translated: Thus, there are twenty periods of decrease and twenty periods of increase.

original: mar 'bri ba dang / yar skye ba bzhi bcu nam thal bar gyur pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: mar 'bri ba dang / yar skye ba bzhi bcu nam thal bar gyur pa de'i tshe /
translated: When the world has decreased for forty such periods and is composed of a single ocean,

original: thams cad kyi tha mar yar skye ba na /
analyzed: thams cad kyi tha mar yar skye ba na /
translated: the increase begins.

original: sems can rnams sems can dmyal ba dag nas 'chi 'pho la phyir skye bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: sems can rnams sems can dmyal ba dag nas 'chi 'pho la phyir skye bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: Beings die in the hells and are not reborn there again.

original: de dag thams cad shi 'phos pa na /🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: de dag thams cad shi 'phos pa na / 'di lta ste /
translated: When all have died there,🔽the destruction of the hells is complete.

original: sems can dmyal ba 'jig pas 'jig rten zhig ces bya'o //
analyzed: sems can dmyal ba 'jig pas 'jig rten zhig ces bya'o //
translated: The world is said to be destroyed by the destruction of the hells.

original: sems can dmyal ba zhig pa ji lta ba bzhin du /
analyzed: sems can dmyal ba zhig pa ji lta ba bzhin du /
translated: Just as the hells are destroyed,

original: dud 'gro'i 'jig pa dang / yi dags kyi 'jig pa yang de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: dud 'gro'i 'jig pa dang / yi dags kyi 'jig pa yang de dang 'dra'o //
translated: so too are the animal and ghost realms.

original: mi rnams kyi nang na yang sems can gang yang rung ba zhig gis /
analyzed: mi rnams kyi nang na yang sems can gang yang rung ba zhig gis /
translated: Among humans, a certain being

original: chos nyid kyis thob pa'i bsam gtan gnyis pa'i bar du rdzogs par byas te gnas so //
analyzed: chos nyid kyis thob pa'i bsam gtan gnyis pa'i bar du rdzogs par byas te gnas so //
translated: enters and dwells in the second concentration, which is attained naturally.

original: sems can gzhan dag kyang de'i rjes su slob cing chos nyid kyis thob pa'i bsam gtan gnyis pa'i bar du rdzogs par byas te gnas so //
analyzed: sems can gzhan dag kyang de'i rjes su slob cing chos nyid kyis thob pa'i bsam gtan gnyis pa'i bar du rdzogs par byas te gnas so //
translated: Other sentient beings also train in this way and abide in the second meditative concentration that is attained naturally.

original: de dag 'di nas shi 'phos nas /
analyzed: de dag 'di nas shi 'phos nas /
translated: When they die,

original: 'od gsal gyi lha'i ris su skye @17b bar 'gyur te /🔽de'i tshe 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'od gsal gyi lha'i ris su skye @17b bar 'gyur te / de'i tshe 'di lta ste /
translated: they are reborn in the Ābhāsvara class of gods.

original: mi 'jig pas 'jig rten 'di zhig ces bya'o //
analyzed: mi 'jig pas 'jig rten 'di zhig ces bya'o //
translated: At that time, this world is said to be destroyed by non-destruction.

original: mi'i 'jig pa ji lta ba bzhin du lha'i 'jig pa yang de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: mi'i 'jig pa ji lta ba bzhin du lha'i 'jig pa yang de dang 'dra'o //
translated: The destruction of the gods is similar to the destruction of humans.

original: gang gi tshe 'gro ba lnga'i 'jig rten gnas pa na /
analyzed: gang gi tshe 'gro ba lnga'i 'jig rten gnas pa na /
translated: When the world of five types of sentient beings is empty,

original: sems can gcig kyang med par gyur ba de'i tshe /🔽yo byad 'byung ba yang med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sems can gcig kyang med par gyur ba de'i tshe / yo byad 'byung ba yang med par 'gyur ro //
translated: not a single sentient being remains.🔽At that time, the arising of material things ceases.

original: gang gi tshe yo byad 'byung ba med par gyur pa de'i tshe char pa yang med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang gi tshe yo byad 'byung ba med par gyur pa de'i tshe char pa yang med par 'gyur ro //
translated: When the arising of material things ceases, rain does not fall.

original: char pa mi 'bab pas sa chen po 'di la rtsva dang sman dang / shing ci yod de dag skam par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: char pa mi 'bab pas sa chen po 'di la rtsva dang sman dang / shing ci yod de dag skam par 'gyur ro //
translated: Because there is no rain, the grass, trees, and forests on the great earth dry up.

original: than pa byung nas nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor 'di nyid kyis kyang rab tu shas cher sreg par byed do //
analyzed: than pa byung nas nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor 'di nyid kyis kyang rab tu shas cher sreg par byed do //
translated: When there is a drought, this very solar disk burns with even greater intensity.

original: bsreg par bya ba'i dngos po rnam pa drug yod pa'i phyir 'di lta ste /
analyzed: bsreg par bya ba'i dngos po rnam pa drug yod pa'i phyir 'di lta ste /
translated: Because there are six types of things to be burned,

original: sems can rnams kyi 'jig par 'gyur ba'i las kyi dbang nyid kyis nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor gzhan drug 'byung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi 'jig par 'gyur ba'i las kyi dbang nyid kyis nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor gzhan drug 'byung bar 'gyur te /
translated: due to the power of the karma of beings to be destroyed, six other solar disks appear.

original: nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor de dag kyang /
analyzed: nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor de dag kyang /
translated: And those solar disks

original: nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor 'di las bzhi 'gyur bzhi 'gyur gyi mthus sreg par byed do //
analyzed: nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor 'di las bzhi 'gyur bzhi 'gyur gyi mthus sreg par byed do //
translated: burn with a power that is four times greater than this solar disk.

original: de dag bdun du gyur nas bdun gyur du sreg par byed do //
analyzed: de dag bdun du gyur nas bdun gyur du sreg par byed do //
translated: When they become seven, they burn with a power that is seven times greater.

original: dngos po rnam pa drug po rnams gang zhe na /
analyzed: dngos po rnam pa drug po rnams gang zhe na /
translated: What are the six types of things?

original: lteng ka chung ngu dang / lteng ka chen po de dag ni nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor gnyis pas skems par byed do //
analyzed: lteng ka chung ngu dang / lteng ka chen po de dag ni nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor gnyis pas skems par byed do //
translated: The small and large pools are dried up by the second solar disk.

original: chu klung chung ngu dang / chu klung chen po de dag ni nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor gsum pas skems par byed do //
analyzed: chu klung chung ngu dang / chu klung chen po de dag ni nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor gsum pas skems par byed do //
translated: The small and great rivers are dried up by the third sun.

original: mtsho chen po ma dros pa de ni nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor bzhi pas skems par byed do //
analyzed: mtsho chen po ma dros pa de ni nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor bzhi pas skems par byed do //
translated: The great lake Anavatapta is dried up by the fourth sun.

original: rgya mtsho chen po de ni nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor lnga pa dang / drug pa'i phyogs gcig gis skems par byed do //
analyzed: rgya mtsho chen po de ni nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor lnga pa dang / drug pa'i phyogs gcig gis skems par byed do //
translated: The great ocean is dried up by the fifth and sixth suns, respectively, for one part and🔽then for a second part.

original: ri rab dang sa chen po de ni gzugs ches sra ba'i phyir nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor drug pa nyid dang / bdun pas sreg par byed de /
analyzed: ri rab dang sa chen po de ni gzugs ches sra ba'i phyir nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor drug pa nyid dang / bdun pas sreg par byed de /
translated: Meru and the great earth are burned by the seventh sun, because they are made of a very solid substance.

original: de nas de nyid kyi me lce rlung gis bdas nas tshangs pa'i 'jig rten man chad du 'gro zhing sreg par byed do //
analyzed: de nas de nyid kyi me lce rlung gis bdas nas tshangs pa'i 'jig rten man chad du 'gro zhing sreg par byed do //
translated: Then the flame, carried by the wind, goes to the world of Brahmā and burns it.

original: de dag kyang dngos po rnam pa gsum du gyur te /
analyzed: de dag kyang dngos po rnam pa gsum du gyur te /
translated: These seven suns are not simultaneous.

original: chu las byung ba'i dngos po rtsva la sogs pa de dag ni dang po nyid kyis skems par byed do //
analyzed: chu las byung ba'i dngos po rtsva la sogs pa de dag ni dang po nyid kyis skems par byed do //
translated: The things that are born from water, such as grass, are dried up by the first sun.

original: chu'i dngos po de dag nyid ni gzhan lnga po dag gis skems par byed do //
analyzed: chu'i dngos po de dag nyid ni gzhan lnga po dag gis skems par byed do //
translated: The five other elements dry up the element of water.

original: brtan zhing sra ba'i gzugs kyi dngos po de ni gnyis kyis sreg par byed do //
analyzed: brtan zhing sra ba'i gzugs kyi dngos po de ni gnyis kyis sreg par byed do //
translated: The element of fire burns the solid and resistant element of earth.

original: 'jig rten gnas pa de de ltar bsregs shing tshig pa @18a * //
analyzed: 'jig rten gnas pa de de ltar bsregs shing tshig pa @18a * //
translated: The world thus burned and destroyed

original: ni mdo nyid las ji skad 'byung ba bzhin du rgyas par bya ste /
analyzed: ni mdo nyid las ji skad 'byung ba bzhin du rgyas par bya ste /
translated: as the Sūtra explains in detail,

original: dud pa med la thal ba'i lhag ma yang med par 'gyur te /🔽de tsam gyis na 'di lta ste /🔽snod 'jig pas /
analyzed: dud pa med la thal ba'i lhag ma yang med par 'gyur te / de tsam gyis na 'di lta ste / snod 'jig pas /
translated: without smoke, without ashes.🔽This is what is called the destruction by fire.

original: 'jig rten zhig ces bya ste /
analyzed: 'jig rten zhig ces bya ste /
translated: The world having been thus destroyed,🔽it remains destroyed for a long time.

original: bar gyi bskal pa nyi shu 'das so //
analyzed: bar gyi bskal pa nyi shu 'das so //
translated: Twenty intermediate aeons pass

original: de bzhin du 'jig rten zhig pa yang bar gyi bskal pa nyi shur gnas so //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'jig rten zhig pa yang bar gyi bskal pa nyi shur gnas so //
translated: before the reappearance of the world.

original: chus 'jig pa gang zhe na /🔽gang tshun chad mes 'jig pa lan bdun 'das par gyur ba de'i 'og tu /
analyzed: chus 'jig pa gang zhe na / gang tshun chad mes 'jig pa lan bdun 'das par gyur ba de'i 'og tu /
translated: The same for the destruction by water.🔽The destruction by wind takes place in the same way, with this difference:

original: bsam gtan gnyis pa nyid las byung ba'i chu'i khams 'byung ste /
analyzed: bsam gtan gnyis pa nyid las byung ba'i chu'i khams 'byung ste /
translated: The wind which rises from the second meditation destroys the receptacle world up to the world of the second meditation.

original: chu'i khams kyi snod kyi 'jig rten de lan tshva bzhin du bzhus nas chu'i khams de yang snod kyi 'jig rten de dang lhan cig tu med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chu'i khams kyi snod kyi 'jig rten de lan tshva bzhin du bzhus nas chu'i khams de yang snod kyi 'jig rten de dang lhan cig tu med par 'gyur ro //
translated: The water element of the external world dissolves like salt into the water element of the internal world, and the water element of the internal world disappears with the external water element.

original: med par gyur nas kyang de bzhin du bar gyi bskal pa nyi shur gnas so //
analyzed: med par gyur nas kyang de bzhin du bar gyi bskal pa nyi shur gnas so //
translated: And this disappearance lasts for twenty intermediate cosmic ages.

original: rlung gis 'jig pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: rlung gis 'jig pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is destruction by wind?🔽After seven successive destructions by water, there is again one by fire.

original: gar tshun chad chus 'jig pa lan bdun 'das par gyur pa de'i 'og tu yang mes 'jig pa lan cig 'byung ngo //
analyzed: gar tshun chad chus 'jig pa lan bdun 'das par gyur pa de'i 'og tu yang mes 'jig pa lan cig 'byung ngo //
translated: After that, there is a destruction by wind.

original: de'i 'og tu bsam gtan gsum pa nyid las byung ba'i rlung gi khams 'byung ste /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu bsam gtan gsum pa nyid las byung ba'i rlung gi khams 'byung ste /
translated: The wind element arises in the third meditation.

original: snod kyi 'jig rten de rlung gis lus bskams pa bzhin du med par byed do //
analyzed: snod kyi 'jig rten de rlung gis lus bskams pa bzhin du med par byed do //
translated: This wind disperses the external receptacle world as if one were to disperse ashes with the wind.

original: rlung de yang de nyid dang lhan cig tu med phar 'gyur te /
analyzed: rlung de yang de nyid dang lhan cig tu med phar 'gyur te /
translated: And this wind disappears with the external receptacle world.

original: 'di ltar 'ga' zhig la rlung gi khams 'khrugs par gyur na /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'ga' zhig la rlung gi khams 'khrugs par gyur na /
translated: In fact, when the wind element is troubled,

original: rus pa'i bar du yang 'bri bar byed pa snang ba bzhin no //
analyzed: rus pa'i bar du yang 'bri bar byed pa snang ba bzhin no //
translated: it causes the body to waste away to the bones.

original: zhig nas kyang de bzhin du bar gyi bskal pa nyi shur gnas te /
analyzed: zhig nas kyang de bzhin du bar gyi bskal pa nyi shur gnas te /
translated: After its destruction, it remains empty for twenty intermediate eons.

original: 'jig rten 'jig pa ni de lta bu yin no //
analyzed: 'jig rten 'jig pa ni de lta bu yin no //
translated: This is the way the world is destroyed.

original: 'chags pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: 'chags pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the way the world is formed?🔽After the passing of these twenty intermediate eons, the world begins to

original: bar gyi bskal pa nyi shu po de dag 'das nas yang sems can rnams kyi 'chags par 'gyur ba'i las kyi dbang gis /🔽'chags ba'i bskal pa kun tu rtsom par rig par bya'o //🔽de la thog ma kho nar 'di lta ste /
analyzed: bar gyi bskal pa nyi shu po de dag 'das nas yang sems can rnams kyi 'chags par 'gyur ba'i las kyi dbang gis / 'chags ba'i bskal pa kun tu rtsom par rig par bya'o // de la thog ma kho nar 'di lta ste /
translated: form again through the power of the sentient beings’ karma, which is the cause of the formation of the world.🔽This is the way the world is formed.

original: snod chags pas /
analyzed: snod chags pas /
translated: First of all, the receptacle world is formed.

original: nam mkha' la bsam gtan gsum pa 'chags par 'gyur te /
analyzed: nam mkha' la bsam gtan gsum pa 'chags par 'gyur te /
translated: The third meditative absorption is formed in space.

original: bsam gtan gsum pa ji lta ba bzhin du gnyis pa dang dang po yang de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: bsam gtan gsum pa ji lta ba bzhin du gnyis pa dang dang po yang de dang 'dra'o //
translated: The second and first meditative absorptions are formed in the same way as the third meditative absorption.

original: de la 'jig pa gsum pa'i rtse mo nas sems can tshe zad pa dang / las zad pa dang / bsod nams zad pa rnams shi 'phos nas bsam gtan gsum par skye bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de la 'jig pa gsum pa'i rtse mo nas sems can tshe zad pa dang / las zad pa dang / bsod nams zad pa rnams shi 'phos nas bsam gtan gsum par skye bar 'gyur te /
translated: When sentient beings who have exhausted their life spans and exhausted their karma and merit die in the third stage of the third meditative absorption, they are reborn in the third meditative absorption.

original: de bzhin du thams cad du yang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du thams cad du yang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: This should be applied in the same way to all the other stages.

original: de bzhin du 'jig @18b pa gnyis pa'i rtse mo nas shi 'phos nas bsam gtan gnyis par skye bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'jig @18b pa gnyis pa'i rtse mo nas shi 'phos nas bsam gtan gnyis par skye bar 'gyur te /
translated: Likewise, when sentient beings die in the peak of the second destruction and are reborn in the second absorption,

original: de bzhin du thams cad du yang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du thams cad du yang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: this should be applied in the same way to all.

original: 'jig pa dang po'i rtse mo nas sems can gang yang rung ba zhig tshe zad cing /🔽las zad la /
analyzed: 'jig pa dang po'i rtse mo nas sems can gang yang rung ba zhig tshe zad cing / las zad la /
translated: When the life of any sentient being in the peak of the first destruction is exhausted,🔽and when their karma and merit are exhausted,

original: bsod nams zad nas bsam gtan dang po 'di lta ste /
analyzed: bsod nams zad nas bsam gtan dang po 'di lta ste /
translated: they are reborn in the first absorption,

original: tshangs pa'i 'jig rten du skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tshangs pa'i 'jig rten du skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: in the Brahma world.

original: de der tshangs pa'i nang na tshangs pa chen por 'gyur la /
analyzed: de der tshangs pa'i nang na tshangs pa chen por 'gyur la /
translated: There, they become a great Brahma in the midst of the Brahmas,

original: de gcig pu skyo bar 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: de gcig pu skyo bar 'gyur zhing /
translated: and they are alone,

original: mi dga' bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: mi dga' bar 'gyur te /
translated: disappointed and unhappy,

original: kye ma sems can gzhan dag kyang 'dir skyes na ci ma rung snyam nas /
analyzed: kye ma sems can gzhan dag kyang 'dir skyes na ci ma rung snyam nas /
translated: thinking, “Oh, if only other sentient beings could be born here!”

original: de'i sems mngon bar 'du byed pas /
analyzed: de'i sems mngon bar 'du byed pas /
translated: Through their mental aspirations,

original: sems can tshe zad cing las zad la bsod nams zad pa gzhan dag kyang bsam gtan gnyis pa nas shi 'phos nas de dang skal ba mnyam par bsam gtan dang po nyid du skye bar 'gyur te de ltar 'di lta ste /
analyzed: sems can tshe zad cing las zad la bsod nams zad pa gzhan dag kyang bsam gtan gnyis pa nas shi 'phos nas de dang skal ba mnyam par bsam gtan dang po nyid du skye bar 'gyur te de ltar 'di lta ste /
translated: Other sentient beings who have exhausted their life span, exhausted their karma, and exhausted their merit die from the second absorption and are reborn in the first absorption, which is of the same level.

original: sems can 'chags pas bsam gtan gsum po de dag 'chags pa yin no//
analyzed: sems can 'chags pas bsam gtan gsum po de dag 'chags pa yin no//
translated: Thus, the three absorptions are formed by the formation of sentient beings.

original: de nas 'dod pa na spyod pa'i lha'i ris bzhi po dag gi gzhal med khang nam mkha' las 'byung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de nas 'dod pa na spyod pa'i lha'i ris bzhi po dag gi gzhal med khang nam mkha' las 'byung bar 'gyur te /
translated: Then, the celestial palaces of the four types of desire realm gods appear in space.

original: gzhal med khang de dag thams cad kyang nam mkha' las sprul pa bzhin du 'byung bar blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: gzhal med khang de dag thams cad kyang nam mkha' las sprul pa bzhin du 'byung bar blta bar bya'o //
translated: All those celestial palaces should be seen as arising from space, like emanations.

original: de dag tu yang snga ma bzhin du 'od gsal gyi lha'i ris nas sems can dag shi 'phos nas skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag tu yang snga ma bzhin du 'od gsal gyi lha'i ris nas sems can dag shi 'phos nas skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: And sentient beings die from the Ābhāsvara class of gods and are reborn there, as before.

original: de'i 'og tu 'dir stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi tshad tsam gyi rlung gi dkyil 'khor stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten dang / sems can gzhal med khang pa ma yin pa rnams kyi rten du gyur pa mngon par 'grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu 'dir stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi tshad tsam gyi rlung gi dkyil 'khor stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten dang / sems can gzhal med khang pa ma yin pa rnams kyi rten du gyur pa mngon par 'grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: Then, after that, a wind mandala arises, having the same dimensions as the world receptacle, which serves as the support for the world receptacle and for the sentient beings who are not celestial palaces.

original: de yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: It is of two types:

original: 'og gzhir gnas pa dang / glo na gnas pa ste /🔽des chu de dag thad kar yang mi 'bo la /
analyzed: 'og gzhir gnas pa dang / glo na gnas pa ste / des chu de dag thad kar yang mi 'bo la /
translated: the wind mandala that serves as the base and the wind mandala that serves as the walls.🔽The water does not overflow because of the wind mandala.

original: thur du yang mi 'dzag go //
analyzed: thur du yang mi 'dzag go //
translated: It does not leak out because of the base wind mandala.

original: de'i steng du de dag gi las kyi dbang nyid kyis gser gyi snying po'i sprin 'byung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i steng du de dag gi las kyi dbang nyid kyis gser gyi snying po'i sprin 'byung bar 'gyur te /
translated: Then, by the power of the actions of sentient beings, a cloud called Essence of Gold arises in the sky above the water.

original: de las char 'bab par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de las char 'bab par 'gyur ro //
translated: Rain falls from that cloud.

original: chu de dag kyang rlung gi dkyil 'khor dag la brten to //
analyzed: chu de dag kyang rlung gi dkyil 'khor dag la brten to //
translated: The water is supported by the wind mandalas.

original: de nas rlung rnams 'dus nas kun du 'thas pa dang sra bar byed de /
analyzed: de nas rlung rnams 'dus nas kun du 'thas pa dang sra bar byed de /
translated: Then, the winds gather, solidify, and harden.

original: de ni steng dang 'og chu'i 'khrug pa thub pa'i phyir gser gyi sa gzhi zhes bya'o //🔽de chags nas de'i steng du yang de dag gi las kyi dbang nyid kyis @19a * //
analyzed: de ni steng dang 'og chu'i 'khrug pa thub pa'i phyir gser gyi sa gzhi zhes bya'o // de chags nas de'i steng du yang de dag gi las kyi dbang nyid kyis @19a * //
translated: It is called the golden ground because it is able to contain the agitation of the water above and below.

original: khams sna tshogs kyi snying po'i sprin 'byung bar 'gyur ro //🔽de las char 'bab par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: khams sna tshogs kyi snying po'i sprin 'byung bar 'gyur ro // de las char 'bab par 'gyur ro //
translated: When it is formed, the clouds called Essence of Various Elements arise above it, by the power of the actions of beings.

original: chu de dag kyang gser gyi sa gzhi la gnas par 'gyur te /
analyzed: chu de dag kyang gser gyi sa gzhi la gnas par 'gyur te /
translated: Rain falls from these clouds and remains on the golden ground.

original: de bzhin du yang rlung rnams kyis kun tu 'bras shing sra bar byed do //
analyzed: de bzhin du yang rlung rnams kyis kun tu 'bras shing sra bar byed do //
translated: In the same way, the winds spread it out and solidify it.

original: der yang khams bzang po mchog dang gtso bo dang / gya nom pa gang yin pa de las /
analyzed: der yang khams bzang po mchog dang gtso bo dang / gya nom pa gang yin pa de las /
translated: Then, from the best, most excellent, most sublime essence,

original: rlung gis bsgrubs pa'i dbang gis ni ri rab 'byung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: rlung gis bsgrubs pa'i dbang gis ni ri rab 'byung bar 'gyur te /
translated: Mount Sumeru appears, formed by the power of the winds.

original: rin po che sna bzhi po gser gyi rang bzhin dang / dngul gyi rang bzhin dang / shel gyi rang bzhin dang / bee d'urya'i rang bzhin can yin no //
analyzed: rin po che sna bzhi po gser gyi rang bzhin dang / dngul gyi rang bzhin dang / shel gyi rang bzhin dang / bee d'urya'i rang bzhin can yin no //
translated: It is made of four precious substances: gold, silver, crystal, and lapis lazuli.

original: de la khams 'bring gang yin pa de las ni gser gyi ri bdun po 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de la khams 'bring gang yin pa de las ni gser gyi ri bdun po 'di lta ste /
translated: The seven golden mountains are formed from the medium constituent.
