analyzed: de ltar snod kyi 'jig rten mngon par grub nas /
translated: When the receptacle world has formed in this way,

original: snga ma kho na bzhin du bskal pa'i dang po myong bar 'gyur ba'i las nyid kyis /
analyzed: snga ma kho na bzhin du bskal pa'i dang po myong bar 'gyur ba'i las nyid kyis /
translated: as before, through the power of the karma of beings to be experienced in the first eon,

original: 'od gsal gyi lha'i ris nas sems can rnams shi 'phos nas 'dir skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'od gsal gyi lha'i ris nas sems can rnams shi 'phos nas 'dir skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: beings die from the Ābhāsvara class of gods and are reborn here.

original: de yang 'dod pa na spyod pa'i las kyi nang na rab dang mchog dang / gtso bo yin te las de'i 'bras bu ni de nyid kyi tshe mngon par 'grub par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: de yang 'dod pa na spyod pa'i las kyi nang na rab dang mchog dang / gtso bo yin te las de'i 'bras bu ni de nyid kyi tshe mngon par 'grub par 'gyur gyi /
translated: Moreover, from among the actions of the desire realm, it is the best, supreme, and principal, because the result of that action is actualized in that very lifetime.

original: gzhan na ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan na ni ma yin no //
translated: Moreover, among the actions of the realm of desire, it is the best, the most excellent, the most distinguished, for its effect is realized in this very life, and not elsewhere.

original: de'i tshe sems can de dag ni bskal pa dang po pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i tshe sems can de dag ni bskal pa dang po pa zhes bya'o //
translated: At that time, these sentient beings are called inhabitants of the first eon.

original: de dag kyang gzugs bzang zhing yid las byung ba yin te /
analyzed: de dag kyang gzugs bzang zhing yid las byung ba yin te /
translated: They are beautiful, born of mind.

original: de ltar thams cad mdo nyid las byung ba bzhin no //
analyzed: de ltar thams cad mdo nyid las byung ba bzhin no //
translated: All this is as the Sūtra itself explains.

original: de'i tshe khyim dang / khong pa dang grong gnas pa med de /
analyzed: de'i tshe khyim dang / khong pa dang grong gnas pa med de /
translated: At that time, there were no houses, no villages, no towns.

original: sa thams cad gzhi mnyam pa kho nar 'dug go //
analyzed: sa thams cad gzhi mnyam pa kho nar 'dug go //
translated: The entire earth was a uniform expanse.

original: de'i 'og tu sems can de dag gi sa'i bcud byung ngo //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu sems can de dag gi sa'i bcud byung ngo //
translated: Then, for these sentient beings, the essence of the earth appeared.

original: de bzhin du rim gyis sa'i sa zhag dang / ldum bu'i tshal dang / ma rmos ma btab pa'i 'bras s'a lu shun phrags med pa dang / phub ma med pa 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de bzhin du rim gyis sa'i sa zhag dang / ldum bu'i tshal dang / ma rmos ma btab pa'i 'bras s'a lu shun phrags med pa dang / phub ma med pa 'byung ngo //
translated: In the same way, gradually, the earth’s crust, the forest of reeds, and the wild rice plant without powder or husk appeared.

original: de'i 'og tu 'bras kyi 'bru shun phrags dang / phub mas kun tu yogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu 'bras kyi 'bru shun phrags dang / phub mas kun tu yogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: Then the husk of the rice will become thick and the rice will become covered with chaff.

original: de'i 'og tu s'a lu tho rtser skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu s'a lu tho rtser skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Then the rice will grow in spikes.🔽Then the sentient beings will appear to appropriate the rice.🔽Then, because of the consumption of the essence of the earth, etc., the sentient beings will become ugly and weak.🔽Those who eat the most will become the ugliest and the weakest.

original: de'i 'og tu sems can @21a * //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu sems can @21a * //
translated: Then, because of the consumption of the essence of the earth, etc., the sentient beings will become ugly and weak.

original: de dag gis de yongs su 'dzin par snang ngo //
analyzed: de dag gis de yongs su 'dzin par snang ngo //
translated: Those who eat the most will become the ugliest and the weakest.🔽Then, because of the consumption of the essence of the earth, etc., the sentient beings will become ugly and weak.🔽Those who eat the most will become the ugliest and the weakest.

original: de'i 'og tu sems can de dag gis sa'i bcud la sogs pa de dag longs spyod pas mdog ngan par 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu sems can de dag gis sa'i bcud la sogs pa de dag longs spyod pas mdog ngan par 'gyur zhing /
translated: Then, because of the consumption of the essence of the earth, etc., the sentient beings will become ugly and weak.

original: mthu yang med par 'gyur te /
analyzed: mthu yang med par 'gyur te /
translated: Those who eat the most will become the ugliest and the weakest.🔽Then, because of the consumption of the essence of the earth, etc., the sentient beings will become ugly and weak.

original: gang gis shas cher zos pa de mdog cher ngan par 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: gang gis shas cher zos pa de mdog cher ngan par 'gyur zhing /
translated: Those who eat the most will become the ugliest and the weakest.🔽Then, because of the consumption of the essence of the earth, etc., the sentient beings will become ugly and weak.

original: lus ches lci bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lus ches lci bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Those who eat the most will become the ugliest and the weakest.

original: de'i 'og tu sems can gyis sems can la brnyas par 'gyur te /🔽mi dge ba'i chos de dag kun tu spyad pa'i rgyus /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu sems can gyis sems can la brnyas par 'gyur te / mi dge ba'i chos de dag kun tu spyad pa'i rgyus /
translated: Then, because of the consumption of the essence of the earth, etc., the sentient beings will become ugly and weak.🔽Those who eat the most will become the ugliest and the weakest.

original: snga ma snga ma sa'i bcud la sogs pa med par 'gyur te /🔽mdo las ji skad 'byung ba kho na bzhin du rgyas par bya'o //
analyzed: snga ma snga ma sa'i bcud la sogs pa med par 'gyur te / mdo las ji skad 'byung ba kho na bzhin du rgyas par bya'o //
translated: Then, because of the consumption of the essence of the earth, etc., the sentient beings will become ugly and weak.🔽Those who eat the most will become the ugliest and the weakest.

original: de'i 'og tu phan tshun mig gis tshugs su blta'o //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu phan tshun mig gis tshugs su blta'o //
translated: Then, because of the consumption of the essence of the earth, etc., the sentient beings will become ugly and weak.🔽Those who eat the most will become the ugliest and the weakest.🔽Then, because of the consumption of the essence of the earth, etc., the sentient beings will become ugly and weak.

original: de nas kun tu chags par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nas kun tu chags par 'gyur ro //
translated: Then, they become attached.

original: de'i 'og tu bud med dang skyes par 'gyur ba'i las kyis /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu bud med dang skyes par 'gyur ba'i las kyis /
translated: After that, due to the karma of becoming male or female,

original: kha cig la ni mo mtshan 'byung bar 'gyur /
analyzed: kha cig la ni mo mtshan 'byung bar 'gyur /
translated: in some, the female organ appears,

original: kha cig la ni pho mtshan 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: kha cig la ni pho mtshan 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: and in some, the male organ appears.

original: de'i 'og tu gnyis gnyis sprod pas nyal po byed de //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu gnyis gnyis sprod pas nyal po byed de //
translated: After that, they engage in sexual intercourse, two by two.

original: de nas gzhan dag gis rnam par smad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nas gzhan dag gis rnam par smad par 'gyur ro //
translated: Then, they are criticized by others.

original: de nas de'i ched du khyim dag byed do //
analyzed: de nas de'i ched du khyim dag byed do //
translated: Then, for that reason, they build houses.

original: s'a lu yongs su gzung ba'i phyir yang zhing yongs su 'dzin par byed do //
analyzed: s'a lu yongs su gzung ba'i phyir yang zhing yongs su 'dzin par byed do //
translated: They also take possession of fields in order to store grain.

original: de'i 'og tu de'i gzhi las ma byin par len cing phan tshun 'dren pa dag kyang 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu de'i gzhi las ma byin par len cing phan tshun 'dren pa dag kyang 'byung ngo //
translated: After that, due to that basis, stealing and mutual robbery arise.

original: de nas de'i gzhi las nan thur byed pa'i rgyal po bsgo bar byed de /
analyzed: de nas de'i gzhi las nan thur byed pa'i rgyal po bsgo bar byed de /
translated: Then, due to that basis, a king is appointed to punish them.

original: de ni phal po che kun gyis bkur ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ni phal po che kun gyis bkur ba zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called the “age of consensus.”

original: de ltar rgyal rigs kyi rgyud de dang / gzhan yang mdo las ji skad 'byung ba bzhin du bram ze dang / rje'u rigs dang / dmangs rigs rnams kyi rgyud rnams 'jig rten du 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de ltar rgyal rigs kyi rgyud de dang / gzhan yang mdo las ji skad 'byung ba bzhin du bram ze dang / rje'u rigs dang / dmangs rigs rnams kyi rgyud rnams 'jig rten du 'byung ngo //
translated: In this way, the caste of the kṣatriyas and the other castes, the brahmins, vaiśyas, and śūdras, appeared in the world, as described in the sūtras.

original: de dag gi lus la yod pa'i 'od de yang med par gyur nas 'jig rten du mun pa 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de dag gi lus la yod pa'i 'od de yang med par gyur nas 'jig rten du mun pa 'byung ngo //
translated: When the light that existed in their bodies disappeared, darkness appeared in the world.

original: de'i 'og tu nyi ma dang zla ba dang rgyu skar rnams 'jig rten du 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu nyi ma dang zla ba dang rgyu skar rnams 'jig rten du 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: After that, the sun, moon, and stars appeared in the world.

original: de la nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor gyi tshad ni dpag tshad lnga bcu rtsa gcig go //
analyzed: de la nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor gyi tshad ni dpag tshad lnga bcu rtsa gcig go //
translated: The diameter of the sun’s disk is fifty-one yojanas.

original: zla ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi tshad ni dpag tshad lnga bcu'o //
analyzed: zla ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi tshad ni dpag tshad lnga bcu'o //
translated: The diameter of the moon’s disk is fifty yojanas.

original: de la nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor ni me shel gyi rang bzhin yin no //
analyzed: de la nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor ni me shel gyi rang bzhin yin no //
translated: The sun’s disk is made of fire crystal.

original: zla ba'i dkyil 'khor ni chu shel gyi rang bzhin yin no //
analyzed: zla ba'i dkyil 'khor ni chu shel gyi rang bzhin yin no //
translated: The moon’s disk is made of water crystal.

original: de gnyis las kyang zla ba'i dkyil 'khor ni ches mgyogs par 'gro ba dang / nges pa med par 'gro bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de gnyis las kyang zla ba'i dkyil 'khor ni ches mgyogs par 'gro ba dang / nges pa med par 'gro bar rig par bya'o //
translated: The moon moves faster and its movement is not regular.

original: nyi ma'i dkyil @21b 'khor gyis ni gling gnyis cig car snang bar byed la /
analyzed: nyi ma'i dkyil @21b 'khor gyis ni gling gnyis cig car snang bar byed la /
translated: The sun illuminates two continents at once.

original: gling gnyis cig car mun par byed de /🔽de bas na gcig tu ni nyi ma phyed la gcig tu ni 'char ro //
analyzed: gling gnyis cig car mun par byed de / de bas na gcig tu ni nyi ma phyed la gcig tu ni 'char ro //
translated: It makes two continents dark at once.

original: gcig tu ni nam phyed la gcig tu ni nub po //
analyzed: gcig tu ni nam phyed la gcig tu ni nub po //
translated: Therefore, the sun sets in one continent while it is midnight in another and rising in a third.

original: zla ba dang nyi ma dang rgyu skar thams cad ni ri rab kyi phyed nas 'gro zhing rgyu ste /
analyzed: zla ba dang nyi ma dang rgyu skar thams cad ni ri rab kyi phyed nas 'gro zhing rgyu ste /
translated: The moon and the sun move at the level of Mount🔽Meru, at the height of its halfway point, which is sixteen thousand leagues above the water.🔽When they move far from Meru, it is winter;

original: de yang gnya' shing 'dzin dang mnyam mo de dag gang gi tshe ri rab las thag ring du rgyu ba de'i tshe ni dgun du mngon no //🔽gang gi tshe nye bar rgyu ba de'i tshe ni tsha ba'i dus su mngon no //
analyzed: de yang gnya' shing 'dzin dang mnyam mo de dag gang gi tshe ri rab las thag ring du rgyu ba de'i tshe ni dgun du mngon no // gang gi tshe nye bar rgyu ba de'i tshe ni tsha ba'i dus su mngon no //
translated: when they move close to Meru, it is summer.

original: de'i phyir myur du nub pa dang / ring zhig nas nub par 'gyur bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir myur du nub pa dang / ring zhig nas nub par 'gyur bar rig par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, the moon sets quickly and rises quickly.

original: zla ba'i dkyil 'khor ni yid tsam gyis steng du 'dzur ba na zla gam du snang ste /
analyzed: zla ba'i dkyil 'khor ni yid tsam gyis steng du 'dzur ba na zla gam du snang ste /
translated: The disk of the moon is slightly elevated. When it is seen as a half-moon,

original: des pha rol gyi ngos de tshu rol gyi ngos kyis bsgribs pa'i phyir mi snang ste /
analyzed: des pha rol gyi ngos de tshu rol gyi ngos kyis bsgribs pa'i phyir mi snang ste /
translated: it is not seen completely full because the side opposite the observer is obscured.

original: ji lta ji ltar 'dzur ba de lta de ltar shin tu gang bar snang ngo //
analyzed: ji lta ji ltar 'dzur ba de lta de ltar shin tu gang bar snang ngo //
translated: The more it is elevated, the more completely full it appears.

original: mar gyi ngo la ji lta ji ltar thur du 'dzur ba de lta de ltar bri bar snang ngo //
analyzed: mar gyi ngo la ji lta ji ltar thur du 'dzur ba de lta de ltar bri bar snang ngo //
translated: In the dark fortnight, the more it is inclined toward the earth, the more it appears to diminish.

original: rgya mtsho chen po na nya dang rus sbal la sogs pa gnas pa'i gzugs brnyan byung ba'i phyir zla ba'i nang na ri ri po yod par snang ngo //🔽skar ma rnams kyi tshad ni nang gi che ba rgyang grags bco brgyad do //
analyzed: rgya mtsho chen po na nya dang rus sbal la sogs pa gnas pa'i gzugs brnyan byung ba'i phyir zla ba'i nang na ri ri po yod par snang ngo // skar ma rnams kyi tshad ni nang gi che ba rgyang grags bco brgyad do //
translated: Because the images of fish, turtles, etc., which are in the great ocean, appear in the moon, the mountains of the moon are seen.🔽The stars are situated on the wall that delimits the receptacle of water.

original: 'bring rnams ni rgyang grags bcu'o //
analyzed: 'bring rnams ni rgyang grags bcu'o //
translated: The largest stars are eighteen krosha in size;

original: chung ngu rnams ni rgyang grags bzhi'o //
analyzed: chung ngu rnams ni rgyang grags bzhi'o //
translated: the smallest are four krosha in size.

original: rigs bzhi de byung ba na sdug pa dang mi sdug pa'i 'gro ba lnga myong bar 'gyur ba'i las kun tu rtsom par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rigs bzhi de byung ba na sdug pa dang mi sdug pa'i 'gro ba lnga myong bar 'gyur ba'i las kun tu rtsom par 'gyur ro //
translated: When the four classes of beings have arisen, they begin to create karma that will be experienced as the five types of pleasant and unpleasant migrations.

original: de'i 'og tu sems can gang yang rung ba zhig / bdag por 'gyur ba'i las kun nas nyon mongs pa can gyi sems can dmyal ba rnams na gshin rje'i rgyal por skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu sems can gang yang rung ba zhig / bdag por 'gyur ba'i las kun nas nyon mongs pa can gyi sems can dmyal ba rnams na gshin rje'i rgyal por skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: After that, some sentient beings, due to afflicted karma that is the dominant condition, are born as the king Yama in the hells.

original: de'i 'og tu sems can dmyal ba'i srung ma rnams ni sprul pa lta bur 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu sems can dmyal ba'i srung ma rnams ni sprul pa lta bur 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: After that, the hell guardians arise like emanations.

original: gnod pa dang gnod byed lcags zangs la sogs pa rnams dang / sems can dmyal ba'i me yang 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gnod pa dang gnod byed lcags zangs la sogs pa rnams dang / sems can dmyal ba'i me yang 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The harm and the harm-doers, such as iron and copper, and the hell fire also arise.

original: de'i 'og tu las kyis ji ltar 'gro ba bzhin du sems can de dag dang / de las gzhan pa'i 'gro ba dag tu skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu las kyis ji ltar 'gro ba bzhin du sems can de dag dang / de las gzhan pa'i 'gro ba dag tu skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: After that, sentient beings are born in those and other migrations according to their karma.

original: de lta bu'i tshul gyis gling bzhi pa ther 'bum dang / ri rab ther 'bum dang 'dod pa na spyod pa'i lha'i ris drug po ther 'bum dang / tshangs pa'i 'jig rten ther 'bum gyi stong gsum pa ni /
analyzed: de lta bu'i tshul gyis gling bzhi pa ther 'bum dang / ri rab ther 'bum dang 'dod pa na spyod pa'i lha'i ris drug po ther 'bum dang / tshangs pa'i 'jig rten ther 'bum gyi stong gsum pa ni /
translated: In this way, a billion four-continent worlds, a billion Mount Merus, a billion of the six types of desire realm gods, and a billion Brahma worlds are called a trichiliocosm.

original: cig car 'chags la cig car 'jig go //🔽de dag kyang 'jig rten gyi @22a * //
analyzed: cig car 'chags la cig car 'jig go // de dag kyang 'jig rten gyi @22a * //
translated: They are formed and destroyed simultaneously.

original: khams rnam pa gsum du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: khams rnam pa gsum du 'gyur ro //
translated: They are also called the three types of world systems.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are:🔽a small chiliocosm, a dichiliochosm, and a trichiliocosm.

original: zla ba stong dang / nyi ma stong dang / tshangs pa'i 'jig rten stong gi bar du gcig tu bsdus pa ni stong chung ngu'o //
analyzed: zla ba stong dang / nyi ma stong dang / tshangs pa'i 'jig rten stong gi bar du gcig tu bsdus pa ni stong chung ngu'o //
translated: A small chiliocosm is a thousand of those small worlds.

original: chung ngu de stong ni stong gnyis pa bar ma'o //
analyzed: chung ngu de stong ni stong gnyis pa bar ma'o //
translated: A dichiliochosm is a thousand of those small chiliocosms.

original: bar ma de stong la ni stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams zhes bya ste /
analyzed: bar ma de stong la ni stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams zhes bya ste /
translated: A trichiliocosm is a thousand of those dichiliochosms.

original: de lta bur shar phyogs dang / lho dang / nub dang / byang dang / steng dang 'og tu 'jig rten gyi khams 'jig pa dang / 'chags pa la mtha' med mu med do //
analyzed: de lta bur shar phyogs dang / lho dang / nub dang / byang dang / steng dang 'og tu 'jig rten gyi khams 'jig pa dang / 'chags pa la mtha' med mu med do //
translated: In the same way, the destruction and formation of world systems in the eastern direction, in the southern, western, and northern directions, below and above, are endless and limitless.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this:

original: char pa gshol mda' tsam 'bab pa na /🔽chu'i rgyun la rgyun 'chad pa med cing bar mtshams med par 'bab pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: char pa gshol mda' tsam 'bab pa na / chu'i rgyun la rgyun 'chad pa med cing bar mtshams med par 'bab pa de bzhin du /
translated: When rain falls in torrents,🔽the flow of water is uninterrupted and without gaps.

original: phyogs gzhan thams cad du 'jig rten gyi khams rnams 'jig pa dang / 'chags pa la mtha' med mu med do //
analyzed: phyogs gzhan thams cad du 'jig rten gyi khams rnams 'jig pa dang / 'chags pa la mtha' med mu med do //
translated: In the same way, the destruction and formation of world systems in all the other directions are endless and limitless.

original: stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams gang yin pa de ni sangs rgyas kyi zhing gcig ces bya ste /
analyzed: stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams gang yin pa de ni sangs rgyas kyi zhing gcig ces bya ste /
translated: A great billionfold world system is called a single buddha field.

original: der de bzhin gshegs pa byung nas /
analyzed: der de bzhin gshegs pa byung nas /
translated: When a tathāgata appears there,

original: 'jig rten gyi khams tshad med pa dag tu sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa rnams mdzad do //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams tshad med pa dag tu sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa rnams mdzad do //
translated: he performs the activities of a buddha in immeasurable world systems.

original: de ltar 'jig rten gnas pa chags nas 'gro ba lnga po sems can dmyal ba pa rnams dang / dud 'gro rnams dang / yi dags rnams dang / lha rnams dang / mi rnams 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar 'jig rten gnas pa chags nas 'gro ba lnga po sems can dmyal ba pa rnams dang / dud 'gro rnams dang / yi dags rnams dang / lha rnams dang / mi rnams 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, after the world has formed, the five types of beings appear: hell beings, animals, ghosts, gods, and humans.

original: skye gnas bzhi po sgo nga las skye ba dang / mngal nas skye ba dang / drod gsher las skye ba dang / rdzus te skye ba dang / gzhi drug dang / dus rnam pa bcu ste /
analyzed: skye gnas bzhi po sgo nga las skye ba dang / mngal nas skye ba dang / drod gsher las skye ba dang / rdzus te skye ba dang / gzhi drug dang / dus rnam pa bcu ste /
translated: There are four modes of birth: from an egg, from a womb, from heat and moisture, and spontaneously. There are six bases, and ten modes of time.

original: dus tshigs dang / lo dang / zla ba dang / zla ba phyed dang / nyin mo dang / mtshan mo dang / skad cig dang / de'i skad cig dang / thang cig dang / yud tsam dang / yongs su gzung ba'i dngos po bdun dang /
analyzed: dus tshigs dang / lo dang / zla ba dang / zla ba phyed dang / nyin mo dang / mtshan mo dang / skad cig dang / de'i skad cig dang / thang cig dang / yud tsam dang / yongs su gzung ba'i dngos po bdun dang /
translated: The ten modes of time are: season, year, month, half-month, day, night, moment, second, minute, and hour. There are seven appropriated things:

original: lus kyi yo byad bcu dang / 'dod pa la longs spyod pa bcu ste /
analyzed: lus kyi yo byad bcu dang / 'dod pa la longs spyod pa bcu ste /
translated: ten physical necessities, and ten enjoyments of desire.

original: de dag kyang lung bar ma las byung ba bzhin no //
analyzed: de dag kyang lung bar ma las byung ba bzhin no //
translated: These are as they appear in the Sutra of the Middle Length Discourses.

original: rgyun mi 'chad par rjes su spyad pa rnam pa brgyad dang / 'jig rten gyi chos brgyad de /
analyzed: rgyun mi 'chad par rjes su spyad pa rnam pa brgyad dang / 'jig rten gyi chos brgyad de /
translated: the eight kinds of continuous practice, and the eight worldly concerns.

original: rnyed pa dang / ma rnyed pa dang / snyan pa dang / mi snyan pa dang / bde ba dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / smad pa dang / bstod pa dang / phyogs gsum ste /
analyzed: rnyed pa dang / ma rnyed pa dang / snyan pa dang / mi snyan pa dang / bde ba dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / smad pa dang / bstod pa dang / phyogs gsum ste /
translated: The eight worldly concerns are gain and loss, fame and disgrace, praise and blame, pleasure and pain.🔽There are three kinds of people: friends, enemies, and neutral people.

analyzed: mdza' bshes kyi phyogs dang / mi mdza' ba'i phyogs dang / tha mal pa'i phyogs dang / @22b 'jig rten gyi spyod pa gsum dang / gtam rnam pa gsum dang / nyes tsam rnam pa nyi shu rtsa gnyis dang / sems can gyi ris drug cu rtsa bzhi dang /

original: dus brgyad dang / mngal du 'jug pa bzhi dang / spyod lam bzhi dang / 'tsho ba rnam pa drug dang / kun nas bsrung ba rnam pa drug dang / sdug bsngal rnam pa bdun dang / nga rgyal rnam pa bdun dang / rgyags ba rnam pa bdun dang /
analyzed: dus brgyad dang / mngal du 'jug pa bzhi dang / spyod lam bzhi dang / 'tsho ba rnam pa drug dang / kun nas bsrung ba rnam pa drug dang / sdug bsngal rnam pa bdun dang / nga rgyal rnam pa bdun dang / rgyags ba rnam pa bdun dang /

analyzed: tha snyad bzhi dang / tha snyad kyi gzhi mang po rnams 'byung ngo //

analyzed: de la sems can dmyal ba'i 'gro ba gang zhe na /

analyzed: sems can dmyal ba'i phung po sa bon dang / 'bras bus bsdus pa rnams dang / sems can dmyal ba myong bar 'gyur ba'i las gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is the mass of the hells, included in the seed and the fruit, and the action which should be experienced in the hells.

original: sems can dmyal ba'i 'gro ba ji lta ba bzhin du /
analyzed: sems can dmyal ba'i 'gro ba ji lta ba bzhin du /

analyzed: dud 'gro'i 'gro ba dang / yi dags kyi 'gro ba dang / lha'i 'gro ba dang / mi'i 'gro ba yang de dang 'dra ste /
translated: so are the destinies of animals, ghosts, gods, and men.

original: ci rigs par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: ci rigs par blta bar bya'o //
translated: They should be understood according to their characteristics.

original: sgo nga las skye ba'i skye gnas gang zhe na /
analyzed: sgo nga las skye ba'i skye gnas gang zhe na /

analyzed: sems can gang dag sgo nga'i sbubs mngon par brtol nas 'byung ba rnams yin te /
translated: It is the mode of birth of those sentient beings who appear breaking out of the shell of an egg.

original: de dag kyang gang zhe na /
analyzed: de dag kyang gang zhe na /
translated: Who are they?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are

original: ngang pa dang / khrung khrung dang / rma bya dang / ne tsho dang / ri skegs la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: ngang pa dang / khrung khrung dang / rma bya dang / ne tsho dang / ri skegs la sogs pa'o //
translated: geese, cranes, peacocks, parrots, myna birds, and so on.

original: mngal nas skye ba'i skye gnas gang zhe na ;
analyzed: mngal nas skye ba'i skye gnas gang zhe na ;
translated: What is birth from a womb?

original: sems can gang dag shams kun nas yogs shing sha ma brtol nas 'byung ba rnams te /
analyzed: sems can gang dag shams kun nas yogs shing sha ma brtol nas 'byung ba rnams te /
translated: It is birth of sentient beings who are born having completely entered the womb.🔽What are they?

original: de dag kyang gang zhe na /🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: de dag kyang gang zhe na / 'di lta ste /
translated: They are

analyzed: glang po che dang / rta dang / ba lang dang / bong bu la sogs pa'o //
translated: elephants, horses, cows, donkeys, etc.

original: drod gsher las skye ba'i skye gnas gang zhe na /
analyzed: drod gsher las skye ba'i skye gnas gang zhe na /
translated: What is birth from heat and moisture?

original: sems can gang dag drod gsher gang yang rung ba la brten nas skye ba rnams te /
analyzed: sems can gang dag drod gsher gang yang rung ba la brten nas skye ba rnams te /
translated: It is birth of sentient beings who are born from the union of heat and moisture.🔽What are they?

original: de dag kyang gang zhe na /🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: de dag kyang gang zhe na / 'di lta ste /
translated: They are

analyzed: srin bu dang / grog sbur dang / phye ma leb dang / shing srin rnams so //
translated: insects, ants, butterflies, and worms.

original: rdzus te skye ba'i skye gnas gang zhe na /🔽sems can gang dag las kyi dbang gis skye mched drug tshang ba'am /
analyzed: rdzus te skye ba'i skye gnas gang zhe na / sems can gang dag las kyi dbang gis skye mched drug tshang ba'am /
translated: What is spontaneous birth?

original: skye mched drug las gang yang rung ba rnams skye ba rnams te /
analyzed: skye mched drug las gang yang rung ba rnams skye ba rnams te /
translated: It is birth of sentient beings who are born complete with all their organs, either suddenly or from the union of heat and moisture.

original: de dag gang zhe na /
analyzed: de dag gang zhe na /
translated: What are they?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are🔽gods, hell beings, intermediate beings, and a part of the ghosts and the Long-Lived Ones.

original: sems can dmyal ba pa rnams dang / lha rnams dang / dud 'gro dang / yi dags dang / mi rnams las kha cig go //
analyzed: sems can dmyal ba pa rnams dang / lha rnams dang / dud 'gro dang / yi dags dang / mi rnams las kha cig go //
translated: The six bases are the hells, the animal realm, the world of hungry ghosts, the gods, humans, and the base of neither-perception-nor-non-perception.

original: gzhi drug gang zhe na /🔽gnas pa'i gzhi 'di lta ste /🔽'og gi rlung gi dkyil @23a * //
analyzed: gzhi drug gang zhe na / gnas pa'i gzhi 'di lta ste / 'og gi rlung gi dkyil @23a * //
translated: What are the six bases?🔽The first base is the foundation,

original: 'khor dang / chu'i dkyil 'khor dang / sa'i dkyil 'khor ni gzhi dang po ste /
analyzed: 'khor dang / chu'i dkyil 'khor dang / sa'i dkyil 'khor ni gzhi dang po ste /
translated: which is the circle of wind, the circle of water, and the circle of earth.

original: sems can rnams thur du mi ltung ba'i rgyu yin pas de'i phyir gzhi zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sems can rnams thur du mi ltung ba'i rgyu yin pas de'i phyir gzhi zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called a base because it is the cause for not letting sentient beings fall down.

original: gnas ni gzhi gnyis pa ste /
analyzed: gnas ni gzhi gnyis pa ste /
translated: The second base is the place,

original: de yang khang khyim dang / yang thag la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de yang khang khyim dang / yang thag la sogs pa ste /
translated: which is houses, upper stories, and so on.

original: de ni 'dzag gnod byed rnams kyis gnod par mi 'gyur ba'i rgyu yin pas de'i phyir gzhi zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ni 'dzag gnod byed rnams kyis gnod par mi 'gyur ba'i rgyu yin pas de'i phyir gzhi zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called a base because it is the cause for not being harmed by the harm of falling.

original: khang khyim dang yang thog la sogs ba de dag kyang mdor bsdu na ched du byas pa dang / ched du byas pa ma yin pa dang / gzhal med khang dang / sprul pa rnams so //
analyzed: khang khyim dang yang thog la sogs ba de dag kyang mdor bsdu na ched du byas pa dang / ched du byas pa ma yin pa dang / gzhal med khang dang / sprul pa rnams so //
translated: Those houses, upper stories, and so on are, in brief, intentional, unintentional, celestial palaces, and emanations.

original: lo legs pa ni gzhi gsum pa ste /
analyzed: lo legs pa ni gzhi gsum pa ste /

original: de ni kham gyi zas kyi rgyu yin pas de'i phyir gzhi zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ni kham gyi zas kyi rgyu yin pas de'i phyir gzhi zhes bya'o //

original: bde ba ni gzhi bzhi pa ste /
analyzed: bde ba ni gzhi bzhi pa ste /
translated: The fourth basis is happiness.

original: de ni sems can rnams mtshon cha la sogs pas ma rung bar mi 'gyur ba'i rgyu min pas de'i phyir gzhi zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ni sems can rnams mtshon cha la sogs pas ma rung bar mi 'gyur ba'i rgyu min pas de'i phyir gzhi zhes bya'o //
translated: Since it is the cause of sentient beings not being harmed by weapons, etc., it is called a basis.

original: nyi ma dang zla ba ni gzhi lnga pa ste /
analyzed: nyi ma dang zla ba ni gzhi lnga pa ste /
translated: The fifth basis is the sun and moon.

original: de ni gzugs rnams snang ba'i rgyu yin pas de'i phyir gzhi zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ni gzugs rnams snang ba'i rgyu yin pas de'i phyir gzhi zhes bya'o //
translated: Since it is the cause of the illumination of forms, it is called a basis.

original: zas ni gzhi drug pa ste /
analyzed: zas ni gzhi drug pa ste /
translated: The sixth basis is food.

original: de dag kyang zas rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: de dag kyang zas rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: There are four kinds of food:

original: kham gyi zas dang / reg pa dang / yid la sems pa dang / rnam par shes pa'i zas te /
analyzed: kham gyi zas dang / reg pa dang / yid la sems pa dang / rnam par shes pa'i zas te /
translated: material food, contact, mental volition, and consciousness.

original: de ni lus gnas par byed pa dang / rton par byed pa'i rgyu yin pas de'i phyir gzhi zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ni lus gnas par byed pa dang / rton par byed pa'i rgyu yin pas de'i phyir gzhi zhes bya'o //
translated: Since it is the cause of maintaining and supporting the body, it is called a basis.

original: yongs su gzung ba'i dngos po bdun gang zhe na /
analyzed: yongs su gzung ba'i dngos po bdun gang zhe na /

analyzed: bdag dang / pha ma dang / bu dang / chung ma dang / bran dang / bran mo dang / las byed pa dang / zho shas 'tsho ba dang / mdza' bshes dang / blon po dang / nye du dang / snag gi gnyen mtshams rnams dang /
translated: oneself, one’s parents, one’s children, one’s spouse, one’s servants, one’s employees, one’s relatives, one’s friends, one’s kinsmen, and one’s blood relatives;

original: zhing gi dngos po dang / khyim gyi dngos po dang / zong dgram pa'i dngos po dang / bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po dang / las kyi mtha' la sbyor ba'i dngos po rnams dang / nor sogs pa'i dngos po dang bdun no //
analyzed: zhing gi dngos po dang / khyim gyi dngos po dang / zong dgram pa'i dngos po dang / bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po dang / las kyi mtha' la sbyor ba'i dngos po rnams dang / nor sogs pa'i dngos po dang bdun no //
translated: fields, houses, merchandise, merit, and work; and wealth and possessions.

original: yo byad bcu gang zhe na /
analyzed: yo byad bcu gang zhe na /
translated: What are the ten kinds of necessities?

original: zas dang / skom dang / bzhon pa dang / gos dang / rgyan dang / bzhad gad dang / glu bro dang / rol mo'i sgra dang / spos dang / me tog phreng dang / byug pa dang / snod spyad dang / snang ba dang /
analyzed: zas dang / skom dang / bzhon pa dang / gos dang / rgyan dang / bzhad gad dang / glu bro dang / rol mo'i sgra dang / spos dang / me tog phreng dang / byug pa dang / snod spyad dang / snang ba dang /
translated: Food, drink, vehicles, clothing, ornaments, laughter, song, dance, incense, garlands, ointments, vessels, and light;

original: skyes pa dang / bud med dga' dgur spyod pa rnams so //
analyzed: skyes pa dang / bud med dga' dgur spyod pa rnams so //
translated: and men and women for sexual pleasure.

original: rgyun mi 'chad par rjes su spyad pa brgyad gang zhe na /
analyzed: rgyun mi 'chad par rjes su spyad pa brgyad gang zhe na /

analyzed: 'jig rten dag rgyun mi 'chad par rjes su spyod pa @23b gang yin pa rnams te /
translated: They are the continuous practices of the world.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are:

translated: embracing with the rain, physical service, observing other activities, eating food, sleeping, sexual union, the search for these, and the conversation about them.

original: 'jig rten gyi spyod pa rnam pa gsum gang zhe na /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi spyod pa rnam pa gsum gang zhe na /
translated: What are the three kinds of worldly conduct?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are:

analyzed: smra ba dang / gtam byed pa dang / so sor mgu bar byed pa dang / bag ma gtong ba dang / bag ma len pa dang / 'bod pa dang / g-yar 'dren pa dang / lhag par za ba dang / 'dus shing za ba rnams dang /

analyzed: rtsod pa byung ba rnams la gcig gis gcig gi grogs bya ba rnams so //
translated: And they are the mutual support of those who are in dispute.

original: gtam rnam pa gsum gang zhe na /
analyzed: gtam rnam pa gsum gang zhe na /
translated: What are the three kinds of conversation?

analyzed: chos dang ldan pa dang / chos dang ldan pa ma yin pa dang / de las gzhan pa ste /

original: gzhan pa chos dang ldan pa'i gtam gang zhe na /
analyzed: gzhan pa chos dang ldan pa'i gtam gang zhe na /
translated: What is conversation that is different from those two?

original: 'phags pa yo byad bsnyungs pa can dang ldan pa dang / sems kyi sgrib pa bsal bar 'gyur ba'i gtam bya ba gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: 'phags pa yo byad bsnyungs pa can dang ldan pa dang / sems kyi sgrib pa bsal bar 'gyur ba'i gtam bya ba gang yin pa ste /
translated: It is conversation that is in conformity with the Dharma of the noble ones who are detached from worldly goods and that is conducive to the removal of the obscurations of the mind.

original: rgyas par mdo las ji skad 'byung ba bzhin no //
analyzed: rgyas par mdo las ji skad 'byung ba bzhin no //
translated: It is as it is described in detail in the sutras.

analyzed: chos dang mi ldan pa gang zhe na / gang nyon mongs pa can gyi sems kyis kha zas la sogs pa'i gtam byed pa'o //
translated: What is conversation that is not in conformity with the Dharma?🔽It is conversation about food, etc.,

original: lung dum bstan pa'i sems kyis byas pa rnams ni de las gzhan pa'i gtam zhes bya'o /🔽// / bam po gsum pa /
analyzed: lung dum bstan pa'i sems kyis byas pa rnams ni de las gzhan pa'i gtam zhes bya'o / // / bam po gsum pa /

original: nyes rtsom rnam pa nyi shu rtsa gnyis gang zhe na /
analyzed: nyes rtsom rnam pa nyi shu rtsa gnyis gang zhe na /
translated: What are the twenty-two kinds of faulty behavior?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: gzhal blugs la sgyu byed pa dang / srang la sgyu byed pa dang / gzhal ba la sgyu byed pa dang / log pa'i las la sbyor ba dang / 'thab pa dang / mtshang 'bru ba dang / rtsod pa dang / 'gyed pa dang / gshe ba dang /
analyzed: gzhal blugs la sgyu byed pa dang / srang la sgyu byed pa dang / gzhal ba la sgyu byed pa dang / log pa'i las la sbyor ba dang / 'thab pa dang / mtshang 'bru ba dang / rtsod pa dang / 'gyed pa dang / gshe ba dang /

analyzed: khro ba dang / dam 'cha' ba dang / bsdigs pa dang / rdeg pa dang / gsod pa dang / 'ching ba dang / go rar 'jug pa dang / gcod pa dang / spyugs pa dang / g-yo byed pa dang / 'drid pa dang / drag shul dang /
translated: anger, making promises, threatening, beating, killing, binding, putting in prison, cutting off, banishing, deceiving, deceiving through sorcery,

original: brdzun zer ba rnams so //
analyzed: brdzun zer ba rnams so //
translated: and lying.

original: sems can gyi ris drug cu rtsa bzhi gang zhe na /
analyzed: sems can gyi ris drug cu rtsa bzhi gang zhe na /
translated: What are the sixty-four types of sentient beings?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: sems can dmyal ba pa rnams dang / dud 'gro rnams dang / yi dags rnams dang / lha rnams dang / mi rnams dang / rgyal rigs rnams dang / @24a * //
analyzed: sems can dmyal ba pa rnams dang / dud 'gro rnams dang / yi dags rnams dang / lha rnams dang / mi rnams dang / rgyal rigs rnams dang / @24a * //
translated: sentient beings in the hells, animals, pretas, gods, humans, the kṣatriya class,

original: bram ze rnams dang / rje'u rigs rnams dang / dmangs rigs rnams dang / skyes pa rnams dang / bud med rnams dang / ma ning rnams dang / ngan pa rnams dang / 'bring rnams dang / bzang po rnams dang / khyim pa rnams dang /
analyzed: bram ze rnams dang / rje'u rigs rnams dang / dmangs rigs rnams dang / skyes pa rnams dang / bud med rnams dang / ma ning rnams dang / ngan pa rnams dang / 'bring rnams dang / bzang po rnams dang / khyim pa rnams dang /
translated: the brahmins, the kṣatriyas, the vaiśyas, the śūdras, the men, the women, the neuter persons, the wicked, the middling, the good, the householders,

original: rab tu byung ba rnams dang / dka' thub drag bo can rnams dang / dka' thub drag po can ma yin pa rnams dang / sdom pa can rnams dang / sdom pa can yang ma yin /
analyzed: rab tu byung ba rnams dang / dka' thub drag bo can rnams dang / dka' thub drag po can ma yin pa rnams dang / sdom pa can rnams dang / sdom pa can yang ma yin /
translated: the renunciants, those with severe austerities, those without severe austerities, those with vows, those without vows,

analyzed: sdom pa can ma yin pa yang ma yin pa rnams dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba rnams dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba ma yin pa rnams dang / log pa nyid du nges pa'i phung po rnams dang / yang dag pa nyid du nges pa'i phung po rnams dang /

analyzed: skye ba na rang gi sa bon las 'dus pa nyid chung ngu 'am /

analyzed: rdul phra rab ni blos tshad kyi mtha' yongs su bcad pa las 'dogs par zad de /

analyzed: dbang po ma gtogs pa rnams dang / dbang po dang bcas pa la ni /

analyzed: yul gcig pa'i phyir 'dres pa'i tha dad med pa ni 'di lta ste /

original: gzugs 'dus pa de mtha' dag ni /
analyzed: gzugs 'dus pa de mtha' dag ni /

analyzed: 'byung ba chen po'i phyogs dang tha dad du ni mi gnas te /

analyzed: 'byung ba chen po rnams kyis phyogs ji tsam non pa rgyur byas pa'i gzugs kyis kyang de tsam non te /

analyzed: de'i phyir yang rgyur byas pa'i gzugs ni 'byung ba chen po la brten pa zhes bya'o //

original: de nyid kyi phyir 'byung ba chen po rnams ni /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir 'byung ba chen po rnams ni /
translated: For this very reason, the great elements are said to be

analyzed: 'byung ba chen po zhes bya ste /

analyzed: chen por 'byung ba'i phyir 'byung ba chen po zhes bya'o //

analyzed: gzugs 'dus pa de dag kyang mdor bsdu na /

original: rdzas rnam pa bcu bzhi yod de /
analyzed: rdzas rnam pa bcu bzhi yod de /

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: Namely,

original: sa dang / chu dang / me dang / rlung dang / gzugs dang / sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya rnams dang / mig la sogs pa'i dbang po'i gzugs can lnga ste /
analyzed: sa dang / chu dang / me dang / rlung dang / gzugs dang / sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya rnams dang / mig la sogs pa'i dbang po'i gzugs can lnga ste /

original: yid kyi spyod yul gyi gzugs nyid ma gtogs so //
analyzed: yid kyi spyod yul gyi gzugs nyid ma gtogs so //
translated: , excluding the form that is the object of the mental faculty.
