analyzed: shes bzhin ma yin pa la thug pa yan chad do //
translated: up to the moment when there is no longer any vigilance.

original: du zhig thams cad du 'byung la /
analyzed: du zhig thams cad du 'byung la /
translated: How many are found everywhere?🔽How many are not found everywhere?🔽How many are found in all the realms?

original: sa thams cad pa ma yin /🔽dus thams cad du ma yin /
analyzed: sa thams cad pa ma yin / dus thams cad du ma yin /
translated: How many are not found in all the realms?🔽How many are found in all the stages?🔽How many are not found in all the stages?🔽How many are found in all the times?

original: thams cad kyang ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: thams cad kyang ma yin zhe na /
translated: How many are not found in all the times?

original: 'gyod pa la sogs pa nas spyod pa la thug pa yan chad do //
analyzed: 'gyod pa la sogs pa nas spyod pa la thug pa yan chad do //
translated: Regret, etc. , up to investigation are found everywhere.

original: de la dbang po yang yongs su ma nyams shing /
analyzed: de la dbang po yang yongs su ma nyams shing /
translated: When the organ is intact,

original: yul yang snang bar gyur la /
analyzed: yul yang snang bar gyur la /
translated: when the object is present,

original: de'i 'og tu de dang 'byung ba yid la byed pa nye bar gnas par gyur na /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu de dang 'byung ba yid la byed pa nye bar gnas par gyur na /
translated: when the mental application is present,

original: rnam par shes pa 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: then the consciousness arises.

original: dbang po yongs su ma nyams pa ji lta bu yin zhe na /
analyzed: dbang po yongs su ma nyams pa ji lta bu yin zhe na /
translated: What is meant by the organ being intact?

original: rgyu gnyis kyis te /
analyzed: rgyu gnyis kyis te /
translated: It is intact for two reasons:

original: ma rung bar ma gyur pa dang / rtul ba'i rang bzhin ma yin pas so //
analyzed: ma rung bar ma gyur pa dang / rtul ba'i rang bzhin ma yin pas so //
translated: it is not damaged; it is not obscured.

original: yul snang bar gyur pa ji lta bu yin zhe na /
analyzed: yul snang bar gyur pa ji lta bu yin zhe na /
translated: What is meant by the object being present?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is present in the following six ways:

original: rten tam / ngo bo nyid dam /
analyzed: rten tam / ngo bo nyid dam /
translated: as support, as intrinsic nature,

original: yul lam / dus sam /
analyzed: yul lam / dus sam /
translated: as object, as time,

original: gsal ba'am / mi gsal ba'am /
analyzed: gsal ba'am / mi gsal ba'am /
translated: as clarity, as non-clarity,🔽as non-obstruction.

original: dngos po mtha' dag gam phyogs gcig kyang rung ste /
analyzed: dngos po mtha' dag gam phyogs gcig kyang rung ste /
translated: It is either all things or a part of things.

original: gal te sgrib pa bzhi po dag gis ma bsgribs pa dang / ma bskal pa yin te /
analyzed: gal te sgrib pa bzhi po dag gis ma bsgribs pa dang / ma bskal pa yin te /
translated: It is not obscured by the four obscurations and is not distant.

original: sgrib g-yog gi sgrib pa dang / mi snang bar byed pa dang / zil gyis non pa dang / mig slu bar byed pas ma bsgribs shing /
analyzed: sgrib g-yog gi sgrib pa dang / mi snang bar byed pa dang / zil gyis non pa dang / mig slu bar byed pas ma bsgribs shing /
translated: It is not obscured by the obscuration of the covering of obscuration, by the obscuration of non-appearance, by the obscuration of suppression, or by the obscuration of deception of the eye.

original: yul gyis bskal pa dang / chung dus bskal pa gnyis kyis ma bskal pa'o //
analyzed: yul gyis bskal pa dang / chung dus bskal pa gnyis kyis ma bskal pa'o //
translated: It is not distant by the distance of the object or by the distance of the small.

original: de dang 'byung ba yin la byed pa ji ltar 'byung bar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de dang 'byung ba yin la byed pa ji ltar 'byung bar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How does it arise by the arising of that?

original: rnam pa bzhis 'gyur te 'dun pa'i stobs dang / dran pa'i stobs dang / yul gyi stobs dang / goms pa'i stobs kyis 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnam pa bzhis 'gyur te 'dun pa'i stobs dang / dran pa'i stobs dang / yul gyi stobs dang / goms pa'i stobs kyis 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: It arises by four causes: by the power of will, by the power of memory, by the power of the object, and by the power of habit.

original: 'dun pa'i stobs kyis ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: 'dun pa'i stobs kyis ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: How does it arise by the power of will?

original: gang @29b rjes su chags pa der sems shas cher 'jug pa 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: gang @29b rjes su chags pa der sems shas cher 'jug pa 'byung ba'o //
translated: It arises by the predominance of the mind in the direction of the will.

original: dran pa'i stobs kyis ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: dran pa'i stobs kyis ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: How does it arise by the power of memory?

original: gang du shin tu mtshan ma bzung ba dang / shin tu rab tu bkra bar bzung ba der sems shas cher 'jug pa 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: gang du shin tu mtshan ma bzung ba dang / shin tu rab tu bkra bar bzung ba der sems shas cher 'jug pa 'byung ba'o //
translated: The mind becomes more and more engaged in the object to the extent that it is well-defined and well-illuminated.

original: yul gyi stobs kyis ji lta bu zhe na /🔽gang na yul cher rags pa'am /
analyzed: yul gyi stobs kyis ji lta bu zhe na / gang na yul cher rags pa'am /
translated: How does the object have power over the mind?

original: ches yid du 'ong ba nye bar gnas pa der sems shas cher 'jug pa 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: ches yid du 'ong ba nye bar gnas pa der sems shas cher 'jug pa 'byung ba'o //
translated: The mind becomes more and more engaged in the object to the extent that it is gross or very attractive.

original: goms pa'i stobs kyis ji lta bu zhe na /🔽shin tu 'dris shing /
analyzed: goms pa'i stobs kyis ji lta bu zhe na / shin tu 'dris shing /
translated: How does the mind have power over the mind?

original: shin tu yongs su 'dris par gyur pa gang yin pa der sems shas cher 'jug pa 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: shin tu yongs su 'dris par gyur pa gang yin pa der sems shas cher 'jug pa 'byung ba'o //
translated: The mind becomes more and more engaged in the object to the extent that it is very familiar and very intimate.

original: de lta ma yin na dmigs pa gcig la rtag tu yid la byed pa rnam pa gcig pu 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na dmigs pa gcig la rtag tu yid la byed pa rnam pa gcig pu 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, the mind would always be engaged in the same way in the same object.

original: rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga'i skad cig gnyis lhan cig tu 'byung ba yang med la /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga'i skad cig gnyis lhan cig tu 'byung ba yang med la /
translated: There is no simultaneous arising of two moments of the five collections of consciousness.

original: phan tshun gyi mjug thogs su phan tshun 'byung bar 'gyur bar yang ma nges so //
analyzed: phan tshun gyi mjug thogs su phan tshun 'byung bar 'gyur bar yang ma nges so //
translated: And it is not certain that they arise in succession to each other.

original: skad cig gcig la byung ba'i rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga po dag gi mjug thogs su /
analyzed: skad cig gcig la byung ba'i rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga po dag gi mjug thogs su /
translated: Immediately after the five collections of consciousness that arise in a single moment,

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa nges par 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa nges par 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: a mental consciousness necessarily occurs.

original: de ma thag tu gal te rnam par g-yeng bar gyur na ni /
analyzed: de ma thag tu gal te rnam par g-yeng bar gyur na ni /
translated: If it is distracted immediately after that,

original: de'i 'og tu rnam par shes pa'am /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu rnam par shes pa'am /
translated: then a mental consciousness or

original: rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga po dag las gang yang rung ba zhig 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga po dag las gang yang rung ba zhig 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: any of the five collections of consciousness will occur.

original: gal te rnam par g-yeng bar ma gyur na ni /
analyzed: gal te rnam par g-yeng bar ma gyur na ni /
translated: If it is not distracted,

original: de'i 'og tu nges pa zhes bya ba yid kyi rnam par shes pa gnyis pa 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu nges pa zhes bya ba yid kyi rnam par shes pa gnyis pa 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: then a second mental consciousness called “determining” will occur.

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa tshol ba dang / nges bde gnyis kyis kyang de la rnam par rtog par byed do //
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa tshol ba dang / nges bde gnyis kyis kyang de la rnam par rtog par byed do //
translated: The two mental consciousnesses—that which seeks and that which determines—conceive of it.

original: de la nyon mongs pa can nam /
analyzed: de la nyon mongs pa can nam /
translated: In that case, a defiled or

original: dge ba'i chos ni rgyu gnyis pa rnam par rtog pa dang / sngon gyi 'phen pas 'byung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: dge ba'i chos ni rgyu gnyis pa rnam par rtog pa dang / sngon gyi 'phen pas 'byung bar 'gyur te /
translated: virtuous phenomenon will occur due to two causes: conception and the prior impetus.

original: de la yid kyi rnam par shes pa la ni rgyu gnyis kas 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de la yid kyi rnam par shes pa la ni rgyu gnyis kas 'byung ngo //
translated: The mental consciousness arises from both causes.

original: rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga po dag la ni sngon gyi 'phen pa kho nas 'byung ngo //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga po dag la ni sngon gyi 'phen pa kho nas 'byung ngo //
translated: The five collections of consciousness arise from the impetus of previous actions.

original: nyon mongs pa can dang / dge ba'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i 'phen pa las de ma thag tu mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa la nyon mongs pa can dang / dge ba'i chos 'byung bar 'gyur gyi rnam par rtog pas ni ma yin te /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can dang / dge ba'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i 'phen pa las de ma thag tu mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa la nyon mongs pa can dang / dge ba'i chos 'byung bar 'gyur gyi rnam par rtog pas ni ma yin te /
translated: Immediately after the impetus of a defiled or good mental consciousness, a defiled or good mental state arises in the visual consciousness, etc. But it does not arise from discursive thought,

original: de dag ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the visual consciousness, etc., are non-discursive.

original: de nyid kyi phyir mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams ni /🔽yid @30a * //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams ni / yid @30a * //
translated: For this very reason, the visual consciousness, etc.,

original: kyi rnam bar shes ba'i rjes su 'jug pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: kyi rnam bar shes ba'i rjes su 'jug pa zhes bya'o //
translated: are said to be “concomitant with the mental consciousness.”

original: gang sems gcig gam /
analyzed: gang sems gcig gam /
translated: If a single thought or🔽mental state arises,

original: de'i phyi ma rnam shes bya ba de la /
analyzed: de'i phyi ma rnam shes bya ba de la /
translated: then immediately after that, a single thought or mental state arises.

original: sems gcig tu ji ltar bzhag ce na /
analyzed: sems gcig tu ji ltar bzhag ce na /
translated: How can it be said that a single thought or mental state arises?

original: tha snyad gdags pa'i sems kyi skad cig gis bzhag gi 'jug pa'i skad cig ni ma yin no //
analyzed: tha snyad gdags pa'i sems kyi skad cig gis bzhag gi 'jug pa'i skad cig ni ma yin no //
translated: The mind is momentary, but the designation of a moment is made by the mind that is conventionally momentary, not by the mind that is momentary in reality.

original: tha snyad gdags par sems gcig gang zhe na /
analyzed: tha snyad gdags par sems gcig gang zhe na /
translated: What is the mind that is conventionally momentary?

original: tshig gcig la brten nas dngos po gcig la dus ji tsam gyis rnam par rig pa 'byung ba de cam la sems gcig ces bya'o //
analyzed: tshig gcig la brten nas dngos po gcig la dus ji tsam gyis rnam par rig pa 'byung ba de cam la sems gcig ces bya'o //
translated: As long as a single thing is cognized by the mind in dependence on a single word, that is called a single mind.

original: de dang 'dra bar rgyu ba de la yang gcig ces bya'o //
analyzed: de dang 'dra bar rgyu ba de la yang gcig ces bya'o //
translated: That which proceeds in a similar way is also called a single mind.

original: mi 'dra ba ni de las gnyis pa zhes bya'o //🔽de la yid kyi rnam par shes pa rtsol ba med cing /
analyzed: mi 'dra ba ni de las gnyis pa zhes bya'o // de la yid kyi rnam par shes pa rtsol ba med cing /
translated: That which is dissimilar is called a second mind.

original: rnam par g-yeng bar gyur pa dang / dmigs pa ma 'dris pa la ni 'dun pa la sogs pa 'jug pa med do //
analyzed: rnam par g-yeng bar gyur pa dang / dmigs pa ma 'dris pa la ni 'dun pa la sogs pa 'jug pa med do //
translated: In that case, the mental consciousness is not active when it is distracted or when the object is not familiar.

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa de ni nye bar gnas ba las byung ba zhes brjod par byas te /
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa de ni nye bar gnas ba las byung ba zhes brjod par byas te /
translated: The mental consciousness that is not active is called the mind that arises from the mind that is present.

original: 'das pa la dmigs pa kho na'o //
analyzed: 'das pa la dmigs pa kho na'o //
translated: It has only the past as its object.

original: rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga po dag gi mjug thogs su byung ba'i yid la tshol ba 'am /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga po dag gi mjug thogs su byung ba'i yid la tshol ba 'am /
translated: The mental consciousness that arises immediately after the five groups of consciousness is called the mind that arises from the mind that is present.

original: nges pa ni gal te /
analyzed: nges pa ni gal te /
translated: The certainty is this:

original: de'i yul de'i dmigs pa yin na /
analyzed: de'i yul de'i dmigs pa yin na /
translated: If the object of that is the objective support of that,

original: da ltar gyi yul can kho na zhes bya'o //
analyzed: da ltar gyi yul can kho na zhes bya'o //
translated: then it is said that only the present is the objective support.

original: de la rnam par shes pas ni dngos po mtha' dag gi mtshan nyid rnam par shes par byed do//
analyzed: de la rnam par shes pas ni dngos po mtha' dag gi mtshan nyid rnam par shes par byed do//
translated: With regard to that, consciousness causes the characteristics of all things to be cognized.

original: de nyid rnam par rig par ma gyur pa ni /
analyzed: de nyid rnam par rig par ma gyur pa ni /
translated: That itself, when it is not cognized,

original: rnam par shes par bya ba'i mtshan nyid ces bya ste /
analyzed: rnam par shes par bya ba'i mtshan nyid ces bya ste /
translated: is called the characteristic of the cognizable.

original: de ni yid la byed pas rnam par shes par byed do //
analyzed: de ni yid la byed pas rnam par shes par byed do //
translated: That is cognized by mental attention.

original: de nyid la sdug pa dang mi sdug pa dang gnyis ka las bzlog pa'i mtshan nyid gang yin pa de ni reg pas rig par byed do //
analyzed: de nyid la sdug pa dang mi sdug pa dang gnyis ka las bzlog pa'i mtshan nyid gang yin pa de ni reg pas rig par byed do //
translated: That itself, the characteristic of which is the opposite of both the pleasant and the unpleasant, is cognized by contact.

original: de nyid la phan pa dang gnod pa dang / gnyis ka las bzlog pa'i mtshan nyid gang yin pa de ni tshor bas rig par byed do //
analyzed: de nyid la phan pa dang gnod pa dang / gnyis ka las bzlog pa'i mtshan nyid gang yin pa de ni tshor bas rig par byed do //
translated: That itself, the characteristic of which is the opposite of both benefit and harm, is cognized by feeling.

original: de nyid la tha snyad kyi mtshan ma'i mtshan nyid gang yin pa ni 'du shes kyis rig par byed do //
analyzed: de nyid la tha snyad kyi mtshan ma'i mtshan nyid gang yin pa ni 'du shes kyis rig par byed do //
translated: That itself, the characteristic of which is the conventional sign, is cognized by perception.

original: de nyid la yang dag pa dang log pa dang gnyis ka las bzlog pa'i bsgrub pa'i mtshan ma'i mtshan nyid gang yin pa de ni sems pas rig par byed de /
analyzed: de nyid la yang dag pa dang log pa dang gnyis ka las bzlog pa'i bsgrub pa'i mtshan ma'i mtshan nyid gang yin pa de ni sems pas rig par byed de /
translated: The characteristics of the signs of accomplishment, which are real, unreal, and the opposite of both, are known by the mind.

original: de lta bas na sems las byung ba yid la byed pa la sogs pa nas /
analyzed: de lta bas na sems las byung ba yid la byed pa la sogs pa nas /
translated: Therefore, mental activities such as attention, etc.,

original: sems pa la thug pa de dag ni sa thams cad pa /
analyzed: sems pa la thug pa de dag ni sa thams cad pa /
translated: up to volition, are found on all stages,

original: thams cad la dus thams cad du thams cad 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: thams cad la dus thams cad du thams cad 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: and they occur at all times and in all situations.

original: yid la byed pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: yid la byed pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is attention?

original: sems kyi @30b 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: sems kyi @30b 'jug pa'o //
translated: It is the orientation of the mind.

original: rig pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: rig pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is contact?

original: gsum 'dus pa'o //
analyzed: gsum 'dus pa'o //
translated: It is the coming together of the three.🔽What is feeling?

original: tshor ba gang zhe na myong ba'o //
analyzed: tshor ba gang zhe na myong ba'o //
translated: It is experience.

original: 'du shes gang zhe na /
analyzed: 'du shes gang zhe na /
translated: What is perception?

original: kun shes pa'o //
analyzed: kun shes pa'o //
translated: It is apprehension.

original: sems pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: sems pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is volition?

original: sems mngon par 'du byed pa'o //
analyzed: sems mngon par 'du byed pa'o //
translated: It is the formation of the mind.

original: 'dus pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: 'dus pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is contact?

original: gang 'dod pa'i dngos po de dang de la de'i rjes su 'gro zhing byed 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: gang 'dod pa'i dngos po de dang de la de'i rjes su 'gro zhing byed 'dod pa'o //
translated: It is the desire to act with regard to this or that object.

original: mos pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: mos pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is resolve?

original: gang des pa'i dngos po de dang de la de'i rjes su 'gro zhing nges par 'dzin nus pa'o //
analyzed: gang des pa'i dngos po de dang de la de'i rjes su 'gro zhing nges par 'dzin nus pa'o //
translated: It is the ability to follow and to hold on to a given object.

original: dran pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: dran pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is memory?

original: gang 'dris pa'i dngos po de dang de la de'i rjes su 'gro zhing mngon par brjod pa'o //
analyzed: gang 'dris pa'i dngos po de dang de la de'i rjes su 'gro zhing mngon par brjod pa'o //
translated: It is the ability to follow and to express a given object with which one is familiar.

original: ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
translated: What is concentration?

original: gang brtag pa'i dngos po de dang de la de'i rjes su 'gro zhing nges par sems pa la brten nas sems rtse gcig pa'o //
analyzed: gang brtag pa'i dngos po de dang de la de'i rjes su 'gro zhing nges par sems pa la brten nas sems rtse gcig pa'o //
translated: It is one-pointedness of mind based on the holding of a given object in the mind.

original: shes rab gang zhe na /🔽gang brtag pa'i dngos po nyid de dang de la de'i rjes su 'gro zhing /
analyzed: shes rab gang zhe na / gang brtag pa'i dngos po nyid de dang de la de'i rjes su 'gro zhing /
translated: What is wisdom?

original: chos rnams la rab tu rnam par 'byed pa ste /🔽rigs pas bskyed pa 'am /🔽rigs pa ma yin pas bskyed pa'am /
analyzed: chos rnams la rab tu rnam par 'byed pa ste / rigs pas bskyed pa 'am / rigs pa ma yin pas bskyed pa'am /
translated: It is the discernment of things, based on the holding of a given object in the mind.

original: rigs pas bskyed pa yang ma yin rigs pa ma yin pas bskyed pa yang ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: rigs pas bskyed pa yang ma yin rigs pa ma yin pas bskyed pa yang ma yin pa'o //
translated: It is produced by reasoning, or by non-reasoning, or by both, or by neither.

original: de la yid la byed pa las ci byed ce na /
analyzed: de la yid la byed pa las ci byed ce na /
translated: What is the function of attention?

original: sems gtod pa'i las byed do //
analyzed: sems gtod pa'i las byed do //
translated: It is the function of directing the mind.

original: reg pa las ci byed ce na /
analyzed: reg pa las ci byed ce na /
translated: What is the action of contact?

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / sems pa rnams kyi gnas sbyin pa'i las byed do //
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / sems pa rnams kyi gnas sbyin pa'i las byed do //
translated: It causes the sensation, ideation, and volition to be present.

original: tshor ba las ci byed ce na /
analyzed: tshor ba las ci byed ce na /
translated: What is the action of sensation?

original: srid pa skye ba dang / btang snyoms su 'jog pa'i las byed do //
analyzed: srid pa skye ba dang / btang snyoms su 'jog pa'i las byed do //
translated: It causes the production of craving and the indifference of one who is satisfied.

original: 'du shes las ci byed ce na /
analyzed: 'du shes las ci byed ce na /
translated: What is the action of ideation?

original: dmigs ba la sems mtshan mar 'dzin pa'i tha snyad kyi las byed do //
analyzed: dmigs ba la sems mtshan mar 'dzin pa'i tha snyad kyi las byed do //
translated: It causes the mind to grasp the sign of the object.

original: sems pa las ci byed ce na /
analyzed: sems pa las ci byed ce na /
translated: What is the action of volition?

original: rtog pa dang / lus dang / ngag gi las la sogs pa slong ba'i las byed do //
analyzed: rtog pa dang / lus dang / ngag gi las la sogs pa slong ba'i las byed do //
translated: It causes the mind to be active in the production of thought, speech, and action.

original: 'dun pa las ci byed ce na /
analyzed: 'dun pa las ci byed ce na /
translated: What is the action of desire?

original: brtson 'grus rtsom pa skyed pa'i las byed do //
analyzed: brtson 'grus rtsom pa skyed pa'i las byed do //
translated: It causes the undertaking of vigor.

original: mos pa las ci byed ce na /🔽yon tan nam nyes pa 'am /
analyzed: mos pa las ci byed ce na / yon tan nam nyes pa 'am /
translated: What is the action of contact?

original: gnyi ga ma yin pas dmigs pa la dga' bar byed pa'i las byed do //
analyzed: gnyi ga ma yin pas dmigs pa la dga' bar byed pa'i las byed do //
translated: It causes the mind to be attracted to a good, bad, or neutral object.

original: dran pa las ci byed ce na /
analyzed: dran pa las ci byed ce na /
translated: What is the action of memory?

original: yun ring po nas bsams pa dang / byas pa dang / smras pa dang / dran pa las rjes su dran pa'i las byed do //
analyzed: yun ring po nas bsams pa dang / byas pa dang / smras pa dang / dran pa las rjes su dran pa'i las byed do //
translated: The function of memory is to remember what was done, said, or thought a long time ago.

original: ting nge 'dzin las ci byed ce na /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin las ci byed ce na /
translated: What is the function of concentration?

original: ye shes kyi gnas sbyin pa'i las byed do //
analyzed: ye shes kyi gnas sbyin pa'i las byed do //
translated: The function of concentration is to give a basis to knowledge.

original: shes rab las ci byed ce na /🔽spros pa rgyu ba dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba dang / mthun @31a * //
analyzed: shes rab las ci byed ce na / spros pa rgyu ba dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba dang / mthun @31a * //
translated: What is the function of wisdom?

original: pa la spyod pa'i las byed do //
analyzed: pa la spyod pa'i las byed do //
translated: The function of wisdom is to eliminate the proliferation of conceptualization, to eliminate the afflictions, and to engage in purification.

original: de la dus gsum rnam par gzhag pa ji lta bu yin zhe na /
analyzed: de la dus gsum rnam par gzhag pa ji lta bu yin zhe na /
translated: How are the three times established?🔽The three times are established in the same way that a dharma is established as having or not having produced its result.

original: sa bon rnams kyi ni chos de las tha mi dad pas na /🔽'bras bu byin ma byin las chos de rnam par gzhag pa bzhin du de yang rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: sa bon rnams kyi ni chos de las tha mi dad pas na / 'bras bu byin ma byin las chos de rnam par gzhag pa bzhin du de yang rnam par gzhag go //
translated: The result is not different from the dharma.

original: 'bras bu rnams kyi ni 'gags pa'i mtshan nyid gang yin pa de ni 'das pa'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu rnams kyi ni 'gags pa'i mtshan nyid gang yin pa de ni 'das pa'o //
translated: The result of past is that which has ceased.

original: rgyu yod la ma byung ba'i mtshan nyid ni ma 'ongs pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu yod la ma byung ba'i mtshan nyid ni ma 'ongs pa'o //
translated: The future is that which has not yet arisen, although its cause exists.

original: byung la ma 'gags pa'i mtshan nyid ni da ltar byung ba'o //
analyzed: byung la ma 'gags pa'i mtshan nyid ni da ltar byung ba'o //
translated: The characteristic of that which has arisen and not yet ceased is present.

original: skye ba dang / rga ba dang / gnas pa dang / mi rtag pa nyid ji ltar rnam par gzhag ce na /
analyzed: skye ba dang / rga ba dang / gnas pa dang / mi rtag pa nyid ji ltar rnam par gzhag ce na /
translated: How are origination, duration, change, and impermanence established?

original: rnam par shes pa'i rgyud thams cad la ni sa bon gyi rgyud thams cad lhan cig rgyu bar rnam par gzhag ste /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i rgyud thams cad la ni sa bon gyi rgyud thams cad lhan cig rgyu bar rnam par gzhag ste /
translated: The stream of consciousness and the stream of seeds are established as coexisting in all the streams of consciousness.

original: rkyen yod la /
analyzed: rkyen yod la /
translated: When the conditions are present,

original: rkyen yod pa'i dbang gis rgyud snga nas ma byung ba las dang po chos gang 'byung ba de ni 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid skye ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rkyen yod pa'i dbang gis rgyud snga nas ma byung ba las dang po chos gang 'byung ba de ni 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid skye ba zhes bya'o //
translated: the first factor that arises in a stream of consciousness that has not previously existed due to the power of the conditions is called the characteristic of the conditioned called origination.

original: de nyid gzhan du 'gyur ba ni rga ba'o //
analyzed: de nyid gzhan du 'gyur ba ni rga ba'o //
translated: The transformation of that is called duration.

original: de la yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de la yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: There are two kinds of that:

original: gzhan nyid du gzhan du 'gyur ba dang / tha dad pas gzhan du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan nyid du gzhan du 'gyur ba dang / tha dad pas gzhan du 'gyur ro //
translated: transformation as another and transformation as different.

original: de la 'dra bar 'byung ba ni gzhan nyid du gzhan du 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: de la 'dra bar 'byung ba ni gzhan nyid du gzhan du 'gyur ba'o //
translated: The arising of something similar is transformation as another.

original: mi 'dra bar 'byung ba ni tha dad par gzhan du 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: mi 'dra bar 'byung ba ni tha dad par gzhan du 'gyur ba'o //
translated: The arising of something dissimilar is transformation as different.

original: skyes ma thag pa'i skye ba tsam gyi skad cig rjes su 'jug pa ni gnas pa'o /
analyzed: skyes ma thag pa'i skye ba tsam gyi skad cig rjes su 'jug pa ni gnas pa'o /
translated: Abiding is the mere continuation of the moment of birth that has just occurred.

original: skye ba ni skad cig phan chad skad cig mi gnas pa ni mi rtag pa nyid de /
analyzed: skye ba ni skad cig phan chad skad cig mi gnas pa ni mi rtag pa nyid de /
translated: Impermanence is the non-abiding of the moment after its birth.

original: de dag kyang chos de nyid kyi dus kyi bye brag las mtshan nyid bzhir 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag kyang chos de nyid kyi dus kyi bye brag las mtshan nyid bzhir 'gyur ro //
translated: These four characteristics are the particular states of the dharma itself.

original: rkyen ni bzhi ste /🔽rgyu'i rkyen dang / mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen dang / dmigs pa'i rkyen dang / bdag po'i rkyen dang / de la sa bon gyi rgyu'i rkyen te /
analyzed: rkyen ni bzhi ste / rgyu'i rkyen dang / mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen dang / dmigs pa'i rkyen dang / bdag po'i rkyen dang / de la sa bon gyi rgyu'i rkyen te /
translated: There are four conditions:🔽the causal condition, the immediately preceding condition, the object condition, and the dominant condition.

original: mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen ni /
analyzed: mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen ni /
translated: The causal condition is the seed of the effect.

original: rnam par shes pa gang gi mjug thogs su rnam par shes pa gang dag 'byung bar nges pa de ni de dag gi mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen to //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa gang gi mjug thogs su rnam par shes pa gang dag 'byung bar nges pa de ni de dag gi mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen to //
translated: The immediately preceding condition is the immediately preceding cessation of a factor that is ready to arise.

original: dmigs pa'i rkyen ni sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos gang dag gi dmigs pa gang yin pa'o//
analyzed: dmigs pa'i rkyen ni sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos gang dag gi dmigs pa gang yin pa'o//
translated: The object condition is the object of mind and mental factors.

original: bdag po'i rkyen ni sa bon ma gtogs pa'i gnas gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: bdag po'i rkyen ni sa bon ma gtogs pa'i gnas gang yin pa ste /
translated: The dominant condition is whatever is the basis, with the exception of the seed.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: For example,

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa'i mig dang / de'i grogs su gtogs pa'i chos gang yin pa rnams so //
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa'i mig dang / de'i grogs su gtogs pa'i chos gang yin pa rnams so //
translated: the eye is the dominant condition for the eye consciousness and for whatever other phenomena are associated with it.

original: rnam par shes pa lhag ma rnams kyang de dang 'dra ba ste /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa lhag ma rnams kyang de dang 'dra ba ste /
translated: The same is true for the remaining consciousnesses.

original: 'dod pa dang mi 'dod pa'i 'bras bu @31b yongs su 'dzin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'dod pa dang mi 'dod pa'i 'bras bu @31b yongs su 'dzin pa'i phyir /
translated: Because they take on desirable and undesirable results,

original: dge ba dang mi dge ba nyid gang yin pa dang / de lta bu dang mthun pa rnams ni bdag po'i rkyen to //
analyzed: dge ba dang mi dge ba nyid gang yin pa dang / de lta bu dang mthun pa rnams ni bdag po'i rkyen to //
translated: the virtuous and nonvirtuous are dominant conditions.

original: de la sa bon las ni rgyu'i rkyen rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: de la sa bon las ni rgyu'i rkyen rnam par gzhag go //
translated: The seed is posited as the causal condition.

original: ngo bo nyid las ni mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid las ni mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen rnam par gzhag go //
translated: The essential nature is posited as the immediately preceding condition.

original: dmigs pa las ni de nyid rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: dmigs pa las ni de nyid rnam par gzhag go //
translated: The object is posited as the objective condition.

original: gnas dang grogs la sogs pa las ni bdag po'i rkyen rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: gnas dang grogs la sogs pa las ni bdag po'i rkyen rnam par gzhag go //
translated: The basis, the companion, and so forth are posited as the dominant condition.

original: rnam par shes pa 'byung ba'i rgyu gang dag yin pa dang / rkyen gang dag yin pa zhes gang bstan pa de la /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa 'byung ba'i rgyu gang dag yin pa dang / rkyen gang dag yin pa zhes gang bstan pa de la /
translated: What are the causes and conditions of the arising of consciousness?

original: bzhi po 'di dag nyid la rgyu'i rkyen gcig po ni /🔽rgyu yang yin la /
analyzed: bzhi po 'di dag nyid la rgyu'i rkyen gcig po ni / rgyu yang yin la /
translated: Among these, the causal condition is one of the four conditions.

original: rkyen yang yin no //
analyzed: rkyen yang yin no //
translated: It is both a cause and a condition.

original: lhag ma rnams ni rkyen nyid do //🔽dge ba dang mi dge ba dang / lung du ma bstan pa zhes gang bstan pa la /
analyzed: lhag ma rnams ni rkyen nyid do // dge ba dang mi dge ba dang / lung du ma bstan pa zhes gang bstan pa la /
translated: The remaining conditions are only conditions.🔽What are the distinctions of wholesome, unwholesome, and indeterminate?

original: de dag gi rab tu dbye ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: de dag gi rab tu dbye ba gang zhe na /
translated: What is the classification of wholesome, etc.?

original: dge ba ni rnam pa gcig ste /
analyzed: dge ba ni rnam pa gcig ste /
translated: Wholesome is of one kind,

original: kha na ma tho ba med pa'i don gyis so //
analyzed: kha na ma tho ba med pa'i don gyis so //
translated: in the sense of being free from reproach.

original: rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: It is of two kinds,

original: skyes nas thob pa dang / sbyor ba las byung ba'o //
analyzed: skyes nas thob pa dang / sbyor ba las byung ba'o //
translated: as innate and as derived from application.

original: rnam pa gsum ste /🔽ngo bo nyid dang ldan pa dang / kun nas bslang ba'o //
analyzed: rnam pa gsum ste / ngo bo nyid dang ldan pa dang / kun nas bslang ba'o //
translated: It is of three kinds,🔽as related to the three realms of existence.

original: rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: It is of four kinds,

original: bsod nams kyi cha dang mthun pa dang / thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa dang / nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa dang / zag pa med pa'o //
analyzed: bsod nams kyi cha dang mthun pa dang / thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa dang / nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa dang / zag pa med pa'o //
translated: as related to merit, to the life-cycle, to penetration, and as uncontaminated.

original: rnam pa lnga ste /
analyzed: rnam pa lnga ste /
translated: There are five types:

original: sbyin pa las byung ba dang / tshul khrims las byung ba dang / bsgoms pa las byung ba dang / sdug pa'i 'bras bu dang / bral ba'i 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: sbyin pa las byung ba dang / tshul khrims las byung ba dang / bsgoms pa las byung ba dang / sdug pa'i 'bras bu dang / bral ba'i 'bras bu'o //
translated: that which results from generosity, that which results from morality, that which results from meditation, the result of separation, and the result of the beautiful.

original: dge ba'i rnam pa drug ste /
analyzed: dge ba'i rnam pa drug ste /
translated: There are six types of wholesome action:

original: gzugs dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa dang / so sor brtags pas 'gog pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa dang / so sor brtags pas 'gog pa'o //
translated: form, sensation, conception, volition, consciousness, and analytical cessation.

original: rnam pa bdun te dran pa nye bar gzhag par bsdus pa dang / yang dag pa'i spong ba dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang ba dang / dbang po dang / stobs dang / byang chub kyi yan lag dang / lam gyi yan lag tu bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: rnam pa bdun te dran pa nye bar gzhag par bsdus pa dang / yang dag pa'i spong ba dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang ba dang / dbang po dang / stobs dang / byang chub kyi yan lag dang / lam gyi yan lag tu bsdus pa'o //
translated: There are seven types: those included in the foundations of mindfulness, the correct exertions, the bases of supernatural power, the faculties, the powers, the limbs of awakening, and the limbs of the path.

original: rnam pa brgyad de /
analyzed: rnam pa brgyad de /
translated: There are eight types:

original: mngon par smra ba dang / phyag 'tshal ba dang / ldang ba dang / thal mo sbyar ba'i las su bsdus pa dang / legs par smras pa la legs so zhes bya ba sbyin pa dang / bden pa'i bsngags pa brjod par bsdus pa dang /
analyzed: mngon par smra ba dang / phyag 'tshal ba dang / ldang ba dang / thal mo sbyar ba'i las su bsdus pa dang / legs par smras pa la legs so zhes bya ba sbyin pa dang / bden pa'i bsngags pa brjod par bsdus pa dang /
translated: the giving of approval to those who speak well; the praise of truth;🔽the service of the sick;

original: nad g-yog bya bar bsdus pa dang / bla ma rnams la gus par bsnyen bkur @32a * //
analyzed: nad g-yog bya bar bsdus pa dang / bla ma rnams la gus par bsnyen bkur @32a * //
translated: the respectful service of the gurus;

original: byed par bsdus pa dang / rjes su yi rang bar bsdus pa dang / gzhan yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug par bsdus pa dang / yongs su bsngo bar bsdus pa dang / tshad med par bsgom par bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: byed par bsdus pa dang / rjes su yi rang bar bsdus pa dang / gzhan yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug par bsdus pa dang / yongs su bsngo bar bsdus pa dang / tshad med par bsgom par bsdus pa'o //
translated: the rejoicing in the good deeds of others; the exhortation of others to virtue; the resolve to attain enlightenment; and the meditation on the immeasurables.

original: rnam pa dgu ste /
analyzed: rnam pa dgu ste /
translated: The path of cultivation is ninefold:

original: sbyor ba dang / bar chad med pa dang / rnam par grol ba dang / khyad par gyi lam du bsdus pa dang / chung ngu dang / 'bring dang / chen po dang / 'jig rten pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam du bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: sbyor ba dang / bar chad med pa dang / rnam par grol ba dang / khyad par gyi lam du bsdus pa dang / chung ngu dang / 'bring dang / chen po dang / 'jig rten pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam du bsdus pa'o //
translated: the paths of application, immediate succession, liberation, and distinctive qualities; the small, medium, and great paths; and the mundane and supramundane paths.

original: rnam pa bcu ste /🔽rdzas las byung ba dang / rdzas las byung ba ma yin pa dang / thos pa las byung ba dang / bsams pa las byung ba dang / sdom par bsdus pa dang / sdom pa yang ma yin /
analyzed: rnam pa bcu ste / rdzas las byung ba dang / rdzas las byung ba ma yin pa dang / thos pa las byung ba dang / bsams pa las byung ba dang / sdom par bsdus pa dang / sdom pa yang ma yin /
translated: There are ten types:

original: sdom pa ma yin pa yang ma yin par bsdus pa dang / dngos gzhi dang nyer bsdogs su bsdus pa dang / nyan thos kyi theg par bsdus pa dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi theg par bsdus pa dang / theg pa chen por bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: sdom pa ma yin pa yang ma yin par bsdus pa dang / dngos gzhi dang nyer bsdogs su bsdus pa dang / nyan thos kyi theg par bsdus pa dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi theg par bsdus pa dang / theg pa chen por bsdus pa'o //
translated: arising from substance, not arising from substance, arising from hearing, arising from reflection, included in the vows, included in neither vows nor negative vows, included in the actual basis and access concentrations, included in the Śrāvaka Vehicle, included in the Pratyekabuddha Vehicle, and included in the Great Vehicle.

original: yang rnam pa bcu ste /
analyzed: yang rnam pa bcu ste /
translated: There are also ten types:

original: 'dod pa dang ldan pa dang / bsam gtan dang po dang / gnyis pa dang / gsum pa dang / bzhi pa dang ldan pa dang / nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched dang / rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched dang / ci yang med pa'i skye mched dang /
analyzed: 'dod pa dang ldan pa dang / bsam gtan dang po dang / gnyis pa dang / gsum pa dang / bzhi pa dang ldan pa dang / nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched dang / rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched dang / ci yang med pa'i skye mched dang /
translated: associated with the desire realm, associated with the first, second, third, and fourth concentrations, associated with the sphere of infinite space, the sphere of infinite consciousness, the sphere of nothingness,

original: 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched dang ldan pa dang / zag pa med par bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched dang ldan pa dang / zag pa med par bsdus pa'o //
translated: the sphere of neither-perception-nor-non-perception, and the undefiled.

original: yang rnam pa bcu ste /
analyzed: yang rnam pa bcu ste /
translated: There are ten kinds of good:

original: dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam rnams so //
analyzed: dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam rnams so //
translated: the ten paths of wholesome action.

original: yang rnam pa bcu ste /
analyzed: yang rnam pa bcu ste /
translated: There are ten kinds of training:

original: mi slob pa'i yang dag pa'i lta ba nas /
analyzed: mi slob pa'i yang dag pa'i lta ba nas /
translated: the right views, etc. of the adept,

original: yang dag pa'i rnam par grol ba dang / yang dag pa'i shes pa'i bar ro //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i rnam par grol ba dang / yang dag pa'i shes pa'i bar ro //
translated: up to the right liberation and the right cognition.

original: yang rnam pa bcu ste /
analyzed: yang rnam pa bcu ste /
translated: There are ten kinds of good:

original: bsod nams las skye ba brgyad dang / 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal por 'gyur ba dang / mi g-yo bar nye bar 'gro ba'i dge ba ste /
analyzed: bsod nams las skye ba brgyad dang / 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal por 'gyur ba dang / mi g-yo bar nye bar 'gro ba'i dge ba ste /
translated: the eight kinds of good that arise from merit, the state of a universal monarch, and the good that leads to the unshakable.

original: de lta bu dang mthun pa rnams ni dge ba'i rab tu dbye ba yin no //
analyzed: de lta bu dang mthun pa rnams ni dge ba'i rab tu dbye ba yin no //
translated: Such are the various kinds of good.

original: mdor bsdu na ni dge ba'i don rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: mdor bsdu na ni dge ba'i don rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: In brief, the meaning of good is twofold:

original: sdug pa'i 'bras bu yongs su 'dzin pa'i don dang / dngos po yongs su shes pa la mkhas pa de'i 'bras bu'i don to //
analyzed: sdug pa'i 'bras bu yongs su 'dzin pa'i don dang / dngos po yongs su shes pa la mkhas pa de'i 'bras bu'i don to //
translated: the meaning of the possession of a desirable effect, and the meaning of the effect of skill in the knowledge of things.

original: mi dge ba de dag ni mi sdug pa'i 'bras bu yongs su 'dzin pa'i phyir dang / dngos po yang @32b dag par yongs su mi shes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi dge ba de dag ni mi sdug pa'i 'bras bu yongs su 'dzin pa'i phyir dang / dngos po yang @32b dag par yongs su mi shes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: These unwholesome factors are the cause of the unpleasant effect and the cause of the non-understanding of things as they are.

original: dge ba'i chos la bgegs byed par gyur ba dang / sgrib par gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: dge ba'i chos la bgegs byed par gyur ba dang / sgrib par gyur ba yin no //
translated: They are an obstacle to wholesome factors and a hindrance to them.

original: lung du ma bstan pa ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: lung du ma bstan pa ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: The indeterminate factors are of four kinds:

original: rnam par smin pa las byung ba dang / de la spyod lam las byung ba kha cig dang / bzo'i gnas las byung ba dang / sprul pa byed pa las byung ba'o //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa las byung ba dang / de la spyod lam las byung ba kha cig dang / bzo'i gnas las byung ba dang / sprul pa byed pa las byung ba'o //
translated: those arisen from the ripening cause, those arisen from the cause of the practice of deportment, those arisen from the cause of skill in the arts, and those arisen from the cause of emanation.

original: bzo'i bag gang ci yang rung ste /
analyzed: bzo'i bag gang ci yang rung ste /
translated: Whatever skill in the arts is practiced

original: dga' ba dang rtse ba'i don du byed kyi /
analyzed: dga' ba dang rtse ba'i don du byed kyi /
translated: for the sake of pleasure and amusement,

original: 'tsho ba'i don du ni yin pa dang / las kyi 'du shes kyis byed pa ma yin pa dang / so sor brtags pas byed pa ma yin pa'i bzo'i gnas las byung ba de ni nyon mongs pa can no //
analyzed: 'tsho ba'i don du ni yin pa dang / las kyi 'du shes kyis byed pa ma yin pa dang / so sor brtags pas byed pa ma yin pa'i bzo'i gnas las byung ba de ni nyon mongs pa can no //
translated: not for the sake of livelihood, not by the idea of action, not by the idea of examination, that skill in the arts is defiled.

original: gzhan ni lung du ma bstan pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan ni lung du ma bstan pa'o //
translated: The others are indeterminate.

original: bzo'i gnas las byung ba ji lta bar spyod lam las byung ba yang de bzhin no //
analyzed: bzo'i gnas las byung ba ji lta bar spyod lam las byung ba yang de bzhin no //
translated: The same holds for the good arisen from practice.🔽The good arisen from meditation is of two types: wholesome and non-defined.🔽The good arisen from superknowledge is of two types: wholesome and non-defined.

original: sprul pa byed pa las byung ba ni dge ba dang / lung du ma bstan pa'o //
analyzed: sprul pa byed pa las byung ba ni dge ba dang / lung du ma bstan pa'o //
translated: The good arisen from supernormal accomplishments is wholesome and non-defined.

original: mig ni rnam pa gcig ste /
analyzed: mig ni rnam pa gcig ste /
translated: The eye is of one type:

original: gzugs rnams la lta ba'o //
analyzed: gzugs rnams la lta ba'o //
translated: it sees visible forms.🔽It is of two types:

original: rnam pa gnyis te rgyas pa las byung ba dang / rnam par smin pa las byung ba'o //
analyzed: rnam pa gnyis te rgyas pa las byung ba dang / rnam par smin pa las byung ba'o //
translated: retribution and growth.

original: rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: It is of three types:

original: sha'i mig dang / lha'i mig dang / shes rab kyi mig go //
analyzed: sha'i mig dang / lha'i mig dang / shes rab kyi mig go //
translated: the fleshly eye, the divine eye, the wisdom eye.

analyzed: gdags pa'i chos su bsdus pa dang / gdags pa ma yin pa'i chos su bsdus pa'o //
translated: because it is included in the imputed and the real.

original: rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: There are three types:

original: gzugs can dang / gzugs can ma yin pa dang / 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas so //
analyzed: gzugs can dang / gzugs can ma yin pa dang / 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas so //
translated: those that are material, those that are not material, and those that are conditioned and unconditioned.

original: rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: There are four types:

original: gzugs can gdags pa'i chos su bsdus pa dang / gzugs can ma yin pa sems las 'byung ba'i chos su bsdus pa dang / gzugs can ma yin pa dang ldan ldan pa ma yin pa gdags pa'i chos su bsdus pa dang / gzugs can ma yin pa 'dus ma byas pa gdags pa'i chos su bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs can gdags pa'i chos su bsdus pa dang / gzugs can ma yin pa sems las 'byung ba'i chos su bsdus pa dang / gzugs can ma yin pa dang ldan ldan pa ma yin pa gdags pa'i chos su bsdus pa dang / gzugs can ma yin pa 'dus ma byas pa gdags pa'i chos su bsdus pa'o //
translated: those that are material and are included in the aggregates, those that are not material and are included in the aggregates of volitional action and consciousness, those that are not material and are included in the aggregates of feeling and perception, and those that are not material and are included in the aggregate of formations.

original: rnam pa lnga ste /
analyzed: rnam pa lnga ste /
translated: There are five types:

original: gzugs dang / sems las byung ba'i chos rnams dang / sems dang ldan pa ma yin pa rnams dang / 'dus ma byas dge ba dang / lung du ma bstan pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs dang / sems las byung ba'i chos rnams dang / sems dang ldan pa ma yin pa rnams dang / 'dus ma byas dge ba dang / lung du ma bstan pa'o //
translated: material form, the aggregates of feeling, perception, and volitional action, and consciousness.

original: rnam pa drug ste /
analyzed: rnam pa drug ste /
translated: There are six types:

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams las mtshungs par ldan pa rnams dang ldan pa ma yin pa rnams dang / gzugs dang / 'dus ma byas so //
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams las mtshungs par ldan pa rnams dang ldan pa ma yin pa rnams dang / gzugs dang / 'dus ma byas so //
translated: feeling, perception, volitional action, consciousness, material form, and the unconditioned.

original: rnam pa bdun te /
analyzed: rnam pa bdun te /
translated: There are seven types:

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / sems pa dang / nyon mongs pa can dang / nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa dang / gzugs dang 'dus ma byas so //
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / sems pa dang / nyon mongs pa can dang / nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa dang / gzugs dang 'dus ma byas so //
translated: feeling, ideation, volition, the defiled, the non-defiled, matter and the unconditioned.

original: rnam pa brgyad de /
analyzed: rnam pa brgyad de /
translated: There are eight types:

original: dge ba dang / mi dge ba dang / lung du ma bstan pa dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / gzugs dang 'dus ma byas rnams so//
analyzed: dge ba dang / mi dge ba dang / lung du ma bstan pa dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / gzugs dang 'dus ma byas rnams so//
translated: the wholesome, the unwholesome, the undefined, feeling, ideation, the formations, matter and the unconditioned.

original: rnam pa dgu ste /
analyzed: rnam pa dgu ste /
translated: There are nine types:

original: 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa la sogs pa'i bye brag gis so /
analyzed: 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa la sogs pa'i bye brag gis so /
translated: past, future, etc.

original: rnam pa bcu ni /
analyzed: rnam pa bcu ni /
translated: There are ten types:

original: rnam pa bcu'i phyir te /
analyzed: rnam pa bcu'i phyir te /
translated: because of ten aspects.

original: rjes su 'brel ba'i skye bo'i don dang / dmigs pa myong ba'i don dang / dmigs pa'i mtshan mar 'dzin pa'i don dang / dmigs pa mngon par 'du byed pa'i don dang / chos de dag nyid dus tha dad pa'i don dang / sgrib pa med pa'i don dang /
analyzed: rjes su 'brel ba'i skye bo'i don dang / dmigs pa myong ba'i don dang / dmigs pa'i mtshan mar 'dzin pa'i don dang / dmigs pa mngon par 'du byed pa'i don dang / chos de dag nyid dus tha dad pa'i don dang / sgrib pa med pa'i don dang /
translated: The meaning of the basis, the meaning of the object of the basis, the meaning of the object of the basis of the basis, the meaning of the object of the basis of the basis of the basis, the meaning of the object of the basis of the basis of the basis of the basis, the meaning of the object of the basis of the basis of the basis of the basis of the basis, the meaning of the object of the basis of the basis of the basis of the basis of the basis of the basis, the meaning of the object of the basis of the basis of the basis of the basis of the basis of the basis of the basis, the meaning of the object of the basis of the basis of the basis of the basis of the basis of the basis of the basis of the basis, the meaning of the object of the basis of the basis of the basis of the basis of the basis of the basis of the basis of the basis of the basis.

original: mi rtag pa dang bral ba'i don dang / mi rtag pa dang ma bral ba'i don dang / rtag pa phyin ci ma log pa'i don dang / bde ba dang sdug bsngal dang bral ba'i don dang / tshor ba dang bral ba ma @36b yin pa'i don dang /
analyzed: mi rtag pa dang bral ba'i don dang / mi rtag pa dang ma bral ba'i don dang / rtag pa phyin ci ma log pa'i don dang / bde ba dang sdug bsngal dang bral ba'i don dang / tshor ba dang bral ba ma @36b yin pa'i don dang /
translated: the meaning of being separated from impermanence, the meaning of not being separated from impermanence, the meaning of the non-erroneous permanence, the meaning of being separated from happiness and suffering, the meaning of not being separated from feeling,

original: tshor ba dang bral ba'i don dang / nang dang phyi'i skye mched rnams kyi rab tu dbye ba de dag ni /
analyzed: tshor ba dang bral ba'i don dang / nang dang phyi'i skye mched rnams kyi rab tu dbye ba de dag ni /
translated: the meaning of being separated from feeling, the meaning of the classification of the internal and external sense spheres,

original: drug brgya drug cu yod do //🔽de la zad par ma gyur gyi bar du gzugs rnams la blta ba'i phyir /
analyzed: drug brgya drug cu yod do // de la zad par ma gyur gyi bar du gzugs rnams la blta ba'i phyir /
translated: there are six hundred and sixty.

original: spyod cing zad par ma gyur gyi bar du gzugs rnams la blta ba'i phyir spyod pas na mig go //🔽'di la grag pa rnams dmigs shing /🔽'di la grag pa rnams dmigs pas rna ba'o //
analyzed: spyod cing zad par ma gyur gyi bar du gzugs rnams la blta ba'i phyir spyod pas na mig go // 'di la grag pa rnams dmigs shing / 'di la grag pa rnams dmigs pas rna ba'o //
translated: In this regard, the eye is so called because one engages in seeing forms until the end of their exhaustion.🔽The ear is so called because one engages in hearing sounds until the end of their exhaustion.

original: dri rnams snom zhing dri rnams snom pas na sna'o //
analyzed: dri rnams snom zhing dri rnams snom pas na sna'o //
translated: The nose is so called because one engages in smelling smells until the end of their exhaustion.

original: bkres pa'i nyam chung ba sel ba dang / brjod pa rnam pa sna tshogs la 'dris pas 'bod par byed pas na lce'o //
analyzed: bkres pa'i nyam chung ba sel ba dang / brjod pa rnam pa sna tshogs la 'dris pas 'bod par byed pas na lce'o //
translated: The tongue is so called because it is what moves to speak and because it is what removes the weakness of hunger.

original: lus 'di ni dbang po zad par gyi rjes su song bas na lus so //
analyzed: lus 'di ni dbang po zad par gyi rjes su song bas na lus so //
translated: The body is so called because it is what is left over from the exhaustion of the senses.

original: yun ring po nas 'di byis pa rnams kyis bcos shing bsrungs la bdag gir bzung ste /🔽'di ni bdag gi'o //
analyzed: yun ring po nas 'di byis pa rnams kyis bcos shing bsrungs la bdag gir bzung ste / 'di ni bdag gi'o //
translated: This body has been fabricated, protected, and appropriated by childish beings for a long time.🔽This is mine.

original: 'di ni nga bdag gis so //
analyzed: 'di ni nga bdag gis so //
translated: This is my self.

original: 'di ni bdag gis bdag yin no snyam nas /🔽de la 'jig rten gyi ming /
analyzed: 'di ni bdag gis bdag yin no snyam nas / de la 'jig rten gyi ming /
translated: This is the self of me, the self-possessor.

original: sems can dang / ming dang / srog dang / skye ba po dang / shed las skyes pa dang / shed bu zhes bya bas na yid do //
analyzed: sems can dang / ming dang / srog dang / skye ba po dang / shed las skyes pa dang / shed bu zhes bya bas na yid do //
translated: The mind is so called because it is what is called the world, a sentient being, a life-force, a person, a human, and a human being.

original: yul dang der brtag par byar rung ba dang / yul de dang der gnod par byar rung zhing /
analyzed: yul dang der brtag par byar rung ba dang / yul de dang der gnod par byar rung zhing /
translated: The object is so called because it is what is suitable to be investigated there, and it is what is suitable to be harmed there in that object.

original: skye bas de'i phyir gzugs zhes bya'o //
analyzed: skye bas de'i phyir gzugs zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called form because it is what arises from that.

original: brjod bzhin du 'jig pas na sgra'o //
analyzed: brjod bzhin du 'jig pas na sgra'o //
translated: Sound is so called because it is what is destroyed as it is expressed.

original: 'di la smra ba sna tshogs gnas pas de'i phyir sgra zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di la smra ba sna tshogs gnas pas de'i phyir sgra zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called sound because it is what is the basis for various expressions.

original: rdzi phyogs su 'gro zhing rgyugs pas de'i phyir dri'o //
analyzed: rdzi phyogs su 'gro zhing rgyugs pas de'i phyir dri'o //
translated: It is odor because it moves and runs in the direction of the wind.

original: nad rnams sdud pa dang / myang bar bya ba yin pas de'i phyir ro'o //🔽lus kyi reg par bya zhing /
analyzed: nad rnams sdud pa dang / myang bar bya ba yin pas de'i phyir ro'o // lus kyi reg par bya zhing /
translated: It is taste because it is collected and savored by the tongue.🔽It is tangible because it is touched by the body.

original: lus kyi reg par bya ba'i phyir reg bya'o //🔽yid kyi yul 'ba' zhig tu 'dzin cing /
analyzed: lus kyi reg par bya ba'i phyir reg bya'o // yid kyi yul 'ba' zhig tu 'dzin cing /
translated: It is tangible because it is touched by the body.🔽It is the mental object because it is grasped by the mind alone.

original: yid kyi yul 'ba' zhig tu 'dzin pas na chos rnams te /
analyzed: yid kyi yul 'ba' zhig tu 'dzin pas na chos rnams te /
translated: It is the mental object because it is grasped by the mind alone.

original: de lta bu dang mthun pa rnams ni chos rnams kyi rab tu dbye ba yin par rig par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bu dang mthun pa rnams ni chos rnams kyi rab tu dbye ba yin par rig par blta bar bya'o //
translated: Such are the distinctions of the elements.

original: de la sdom ni /
analyzed: de la sdom ni /
translated: The summary verse:🔽The mind is engaged by way of five doors:

original: ngo bo nyid dang gnas dang ni //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid dang gnas dang ni //
translated: own-being, basis,🔽object, companion, and action.

original: dmigs pa dang ni grogs rnams dang // las te sgo ni lnga po yis //🔽sems ni rab tu 'jug par 'gyur //
analyzed: dmigs pa dang ni grogs rnams dang // las te sgo ni lnga po yis // sems ni rab tu 'jug par 'gyur //
translated: The mind is engaged by way of five doors:🔽own-being, basis,🔽object, companion, and action.

original: de la rnam par shes pa'i tshogs drug gi chos lnga po'o //
analyzed: de la rnam par shes pa'i tshogs drug gi chos lnga po'o //
translated: The five dharmas of the six collections of consciousness are the own-being of the mind.

original: ngo bo nyid dang / gnas dang / dmigs pa dang grogs dang / las 'di dag gis ni phung po la mkhas pa yang bsdus par rig par bya'o //🔽khams la mkhas pa dang / skye mched la mkhas pa dang / @37a * //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid dang / gnas dang / dmigs pa dang grogs dang / las 'di dag gis ni phung po la mkhas pa yang bsdus par rig par bya'o // khams la mkhas pa dang / skye mched la mkhas pa dang / @37a * //
translated: The aggregates are also included in the expertise in nature, location, object, companion, and function.🔽The expertise in the elements and the expertise in the sense bases are also included in the expertise in nature, location, object, companion, and function.

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba la mkhas pa dang / gnas dang gnas ma yin pa la mkhas pa dang / dbang po la mkhas par yang bsdus par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba la mkhas pa dang / gnas dang gnas ma yin pa la mkhas pa dang / dbang po la mkhas par yang bsdus par rig par bya'o //
translated: The expertise in dependent origination, the expertise in what is possible and impossible, and the expertise in faculties are also included in the expertise in nature, location, object, companion, and function.

original: sangs rgyas kyi bka'i dngos po dgu yang bsdus par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi bka'i dngos po dgu yang bsdus par rig par bya'o //
translated: The nine topics of the Buddha's words are also included in the expertise in nature, location, object, companion, and function.

original: dngos po dgu gang zhe na /
analyzed: dngos po dgu gang zhe na /
translated: What are the nine topics?

original: sems can gyi dngos po dang / longs spyod kyi dngos po dang / skye ba'i dngos po dang / gnas pa'i dngos po dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i dngos po dang / sna tshogs kyi dngos po dang / ston pa po'i dngos po dang /
analyzed: sems can gyi dngos po dang / longs spyod kyi dngos po dang / skye ba'i dngos po dang / gnas pa'i dngos po dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i dngos po dang / sna tshogs kyi dngos po dang / ston pa po'i dngos po dang /
translated: The topic of sentient beings, the topic of enjoyments, the topic of birth, the topic of abode, the topic of affliction, the topic of purification, the topic of variety, the topic of teacher, and the topic of teaching.

original: bstan par bya ba'i dngos po dang / 'khor gyi dngos po'o //🔽de la sems can gyi dngos po ni /
analyzed: bstan par bya ba'i dngos po dang / 'khor gyi dngos po'o // de la sems can gyi dngos po ni /
translated: the thing to be taught, and the audience.

original: nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga po rnams so //
analyzed: nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga po rnams so //
translated: The thing that is the sentient being is the five appropriative aggregates.

original: de'i longs spyod kyi dngos po ni skye mched bcu gnyis po rnams so //
analyzed: de'i longs spyod kyi dngos po ni skye mched bcu gnyis po rnams so //
translated: The thing that is its enjoyment is the twelve sense spheres.

original: skye ba'i dngos po ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba yan lag bcu gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: skye ba'i dngos po ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba yan lag bcu gnyis pa'o //
translated: The thing that is the birth is the twelve members of dependent origination.

original: skyes pa'i gnas pa'i dngos po ni zas bzhi po rnams so //
analyzed: skyes pa'i gnas pa'i dngos po ni zas bzhi po rnams so //
translated: The thing that is the abiding of the one born is the four nutriments.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i dngos po ni 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi po rnams so //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i dngos po ni 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi po rnams so //
translated: The thing that is defilement and purification is the four noble truths.

original: sna tshogs kyi dngos po ni khams tshad med pa rnams so //
analyzed: sna tshogs kyi dngos po ni khams tshad med pa rnams so //
translated: The thing that is the variety is the immeasurable elements.

original: ston pa po'i dngos po ni sangs rgyas rnams dang / de dag gi nyan thos rnams so //
analyzed: ston pa po'i dngos po ni sangs rgyas rnams dang / de dag gi nyan thos rnams so //
translated: The thing that is the teacher is the Buddhas and their śrāvakas.

original: bstan par bya ba'i dngos po ni dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la sogs pa byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams so //
analyzed: bstan par bya ba'i dngos po ni dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la sogs pa byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams so //
translated: The thing that is to be taught is the factors of enlightenment such as the applications of mindfulness.

original: 'khor gyi dngos po ni 'khor brgyad de /
analyzed: 'khor gyi dngos po ni 'khor brgyad de /
translated: The retinue consists of eight assemblies:

original: rgyal rigs kyi 'khor dang / bram ze'i 'khor dang / khyim bdag gi 'khor dang / dge sbyong gi 'khor dang / rgyal chen bzhi'i ris kyi 'khor dang / sum cu rtsa gsum pa'i 'khor dang / bdud kyi ris kyi 'khor dang / tshangs pa'i 'khor to //
analyzed: rgyal rigs kyi 'khor dang / bram ze'i 'khor dang / khyim bdag gi 'khor dang / dge sbyong gi 'khor dang / rgyal chen bzhi'i ris kyi 'khor dang / sum cu rtsa gsum pa'i 'khor dang / bdud kyi ris kyi 'khor dang / tshangs pa'i 'khor to //
translated: the assembly of the royal class, the assembly of the priestly class, the assembly of the householder class, the assembly of ascetics, the assembly of the gods of the desire realm, the assembly of the gods of the form realm, the assembly of the gods of the formless realm, and the assembly of the hearers.🔽The summary:

original: sdom ni / 'dus pa dang ni tshogs rnams dang // dus dang mtshan nyid rkyen rnams dang // dge ba la sogs rab dbye dang // mkhas pa dngos po tham yin //
analyzed: sdom ni / 'dus pa dang ni tshogs rnams dang // dus dang mtshan nyid rkyen rnams dang // dge ba la sogs rab dbye dang // mkhas pa dngos po tham yin //
translated: The assemblies, the groups, the times, the characteristics, the conditions, the divisions of virtue and so forth, and the experts—these are the ten topics.

original: rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las yid kyi sa ste gnyis pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las yid kyi sa ste gnyis pa rdzogs so /
translated: This completes the second ground of the yoga practitioners, The Stainless.

original: // / bam po bzhi pa /🔽rtog pa dang bcas shing /
analyzed: // / bam po bzhi pa / rtog pa dang bcas shing /
translated: The third ground, The Luminous.

original: dpyod pa dang bcas pa'i sa ni gang /🔽rtog pa med pa la dpyod pa tsam gyi sa ni gang /
analyzed: dpyod pa dang bcas pa'i sa ni gang / rtog pa med pa la dpyod pa tsam gyi sa ni gang /
translated: What is the level that possesses both investigation and analysis?🔽What is the level that possesses no investigation but does have analysis?

original: rtog pa med pa la dpyod pa yang med pa'i sa ni gang zhe na /
analyzed: rtog pa med pa la dpyod pa yang med pa'i sa ni gang zhe na /
translated: What is the level that possesses neither investigation nor analysis?

original: spyi sdom la /
analyzed: spyi sdom la /
translated: The general summary:
